Reviews.Title: “Great Beds and View”
Reviews.Author: jjhaustin
Reviews.Content: This Westin is just off Market and a block from SFMOA. This location is good for the Bart (Montgomery) but not close to any of the great SF neighborhoods. The hotel is modern and clean and he beds are great, but there are few restaurants within a short walk. This is a business hotel. The lobby is busy and almost everyone is wearing a suit and tie in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the location, hotel nice. Felt "businessy"”
Reviews.Author: J K
Reviews.Content: We liked the location, being close to so much shopping, restaurants, BART, etc in Union Square. Room was nice enough. We used Sheraton points, so can't complain. Really liked the bar and its view towards Fisherman's Warf (although it took forever to get a seat... as people just hang our for hours and sip their drinks).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: smm22
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for my bday weekend and we were very happy with the stay we had at the Westin. We were supposed to get a room from floors 1-7 but we mentioned it was my birthday and the front desk was very kind and moved our room to a higher level with an AMAZING view! The room was pretty small but they made everything fit and we had everything we needed. The hotel is located in central Union Square, so it was a great location and you can walk or catch a ride numerous ways at this location. The staff was very friendly and all in all we were very happy with our stay. We would definetly stay here again for our future visits to San Fran!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and room with a view”
Reviews.Author: two2keikis
Reviews.Content: We recently had a mini vacation with the kids for spring break and decided to go with public transportation during our entire trip from the Los Angeles area. We arrived by feet since we took the BART. The location is close to Yerba Buena and Union Square. Yerba Buena has a kids museum with bowling alley/skating ring which we were unable to par take because one of the days we were there they had a private event. We did explore the city without a problem on public transporation which included trolley, cable cars, BART and the muni. The hotel was situation in a great area for our travels. We were close enough to Union Square, but not in the madness altough Market Street is a busy street. We had a room on 31st floor which had a view of Unions Square and the waterfront! It was amazing! One of our nights there we saw lighting and my dh (dear husband) was trying to capture pictures from our room with his new nifty camera. We did not use any of the hotel amenities if it had any because we were out in about exploring the City. For the most part, it was a nice stay in a clean hotel. The beds were kind of hard, but the pillows made up as well as the in room robes which is a nice comfortable touch. You can't use the fridge for personal items otherwise alledgly they will charge you if an item is removed and/or moved for longer than 10 seconds! So, had to leave leftovers at the restaurants (sad and a waste). My husband checked us in, so i don't know how his experience was with front desk. I do know he didnt complain, so it must have been acceptable. They have a nice lounge area with a fire place and several seating areas for you to relax, read and or watch t.v. or catch up on work on your laptop.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: eye-tripped
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed two nights. We found the rooms to be nicely decorated and clean. The bar area was nice. It had plenty of seating and you didn't feel cramped. The staff was friendly, check-in was quick, and anything extra that we had asked for was provided with a smile. The location is great, and is part of the energy of Market St. Plenty of shopping and restaurants nearby. The concierge could have been a little more helpful with restaurant selection. Seemed like she was steering us to a few specific places. We survived. I attended a two-day work-related training session and the room temperature was very comfortable as were the chairs - very conducive setting for learning. Snacks and beverages were of good quality. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location is super, service is nice”
Reviews.Author: fozzetti
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel in downtown SF. Very close to Union Square and the financial district. The hotel offers lovely rooms and quality service. It's had a very nice upgrade of the past few years. The top floors offer some terrific views. Typically this hotel has a lower price point than the other Westin in town or some of the other nice hotels in the area. It offers a super value in that regard. A great business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice views ... average room”
Reviews.Author: JBGregory
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in April for a seminar next door at the Marriott (hotel sold out) and had to move from the first room I was given on the 28th floor due to a worn-out mattress and some issues in the bathroom (dirty, drain broken and hair left in the tub – yuck!). After the first night I was moved and stayed on the 33rd floor and had a great view of AT&T park and the surrounding area and Bay. Ordered room service on the third night and it was not worth the money, but that is nothing new at a chain hotel. All-in-all the hotel was a little too expensive ($429/night) as compared to surrounding hotels, very crowded due to conventions, however, the view somewhat made-up for it ... I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for a fairly central location with near-by parking (Jessie Square) garage.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: bgcola
Reviews.Content: i recently stayed at the Market St San Francisco Westin. The lobby is massive, the concierge helpful, the room big and beds were wonderful. The location also is perfect for the trolley, nearby walk-to areas, and other mass transit

Reviews.Title: “Great location, expensive internet, nice bar/lounge”
Reviews.Author: piesie23
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in San Fran. We picked this hotel because it was part of the Starwood group, had a reasonable rate (avr $160+ lots of weird city taxes), good gym, and was in a prime location. For the rate we paid, I felt good about the stay. But, I'm am still annoyed that I had to pay $14.95/day for internet, which is redonk and my pet peeve when I travel. There wasn't free internet even in the lobby. Just across at Peet's or Starbucks. We valet parked our rental car ($52/day including tax) and found the valets pleasant and responsive. We took it out at least once a day. Check-in was pleasant and front staff was great. Concierge was helpful, as well as other staff we consulted for help with various things during our stay. The location of the hotel really can't be beat. It is near a wide-range of restaurants, tons of shops in Union Square, and gives easy access to all the other locations we wanted to visit. I used the gym most days and was pleased to see and use all-new cardio machines (5 treadmills, 2 or 3 ellipticals and 2 bikes) plus a good assortment of dumbbells, a few weight benches and 3-5 nautilus stations. We didn't use housekeeping at all for the 5 days we stayed, so I can't speak to that service. We did eat at Ducca, the onsite Italian restaurant one night. It was only OK. I wouldn't go back to dine there.

Reviews.Title: “SAN FRANCISCO”
Reviews.Author: kathystravel52
Reviews.Content: Westin is great,clean and centrally located, right around the corner from the mall,smaller shops and restaurants

Reviews.Title: “Average ... at best.”
Reviews.Author: Jen_and_Rob
Reviews.Content: Nothing too special here, especially compared to other hotels in the area. The best parts of the room were the comfortable bed and the floor to ceiling window looking over the city. The bathroom was small, lighting not great in the room, and the TV does the annoying "turn on at full blast volume" bit. Concierge gave me inaccurate directions via bus ... thankfully the bus drivers were helpful and got me to squared away and on to the proper route. Hotel is conveniently located near the BART station, close walk to the Cable Carsa at Powell, Union Square, etc.

Reviews.Title: “The Real Deal Says Problems but Great Service Wins Out”
Reviews.Author: jimnick
Reviews.Content: I fly 100-150,000 miles a year. I want to stay in 4 star hotels that are real 4 stars not rated by some nameless agency that says all Westins and Hyatts are 4.. This one is and could be 5 stars. I went to check in mid-day and they had not honored the King bed choice or the quiet room I have in my profile and checked in the reservation. The person behind the desk took 15-20 minutes to find one - because he had to get a managers approval etc. was a much bigger deal than it should have been and started me off with a bad taste. Then the manager stepped up and found the room, grabbed a few glasses of wine tickets and said pardon your wait. Within 5 minutes of getting to the room - an OK room but nice size for the city - the manager called and personally asked me if I was comfortable and OK. These two touches made the bad start better. When I needed help from the concierage they were very well informed and quite helpful. When it rained they had umbrellas available for everyone that wanted it. There were numerous touches like this around the service of the hotel. I wrote a review a few minutes ago about how the Hyatt San Francisco Airport was a 3 minus because of bad service throughout./ This hotel has excellent service and it just makes all the difference in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Off of Market St. and not far from Union Square”
Reviews.Author: JDBonthemove
Reviews.Content: The Westin is pretty nicely situated a block away from Market Street and near a couple of BART stations. It's also a quick walk to happening Union Square... a very convenient location if you like shopping. The lobby is well appointed. And I had heard that the rooms had been renovated. Unfortunately our room did not appear to be one of the new ones. There was really nothing wrong with it. I was just hoping to see the new decor. And, at this price point, I would expect a tad more elegance. Free WiFi and a stellar view from the 25th floor made up for it. And the signature heavenly bed always makes for a comfortable sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected Surprise for a KLUTZ”
Reviews.Author: Gerald K
Reviews.Content: While I was checking into the Westin San Francisco Market St. I was trying to adjust the bag I was carrying. I unfortunately had the special bottle of wine I brought with us in the bag and dropped it and it shattered on the floor. I felt horrible because of the mess I made, but instead of making me feel bad for making a mess of the floor, the receptionist (believe her name was Salora) appologized to me and offered to have a bottle of red wine sent up to us. That made me feel so special and made a very embarrassing moment immediately change to an exeptionally pleasent experience. That wasn't the end of the tremendous experience. When the bellman, Edwardo, rang he brought not only the wine but a tray with fruit and cheeze and cracckers. He was extremely polite and wished us a very pleasant evening. A few minutes later Edwardo called and aske how we were enjoying the wine. He said that chocolate was the perfect thing to enhance our enjoyment of that wine and that he would be bringing up some strawberries dipped in chocolate to make our wine night perfect. I want to say that your staff at the Westin made our stay so special that we will most definitely be making it a point to stay there again again. We live in Santa Cruz and go to many Giant games and plays in the City, so we are able to enjoy San Francisco often. I would recomend the Westin on Market to anyone who enjoys comfortable surroundings and an exeptional staff to make sure every detail is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and close to BART”
Reviews.Author: Gscjjj
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because we didn't want to have to rent a car during our vacation. The hotel charges $48/night valet parking but is very convenient to BART stations which we took from the airport for $8.10 per person and also the trolley which goes to Fisherman's Wharf. Taxis were always in front of the hotel so getting one to go elsewhere was never a problem. The tours that we took picked us up right in front of the hotel. The hotel was very nice and generally clean, although a dirty glass from the bar stayed in our room for three days without being removed by the maid. The beds were wonderful. The restaurant food was good but the breakfast buffet is $25 per person making it an expensive breakfast for a family. We had a room near the elevators which sounded like a jet airplane taking off so be sure to ask for a room AWAY from them. We did not hear any street noise but were on an upper floor. This hotel is right across from a California Pizza kitchen and 1/2 block away from a great breakfast place and a coffee shop + near to several large shopping areas. Our room was an even number and we had a view of the bay and Alcatraz, so ask about that if you are interested.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: E K
Reviews.Content: The Westin is a very nice hotel. We paid for the upgraded room ($50 per night), and it was well worth it, the view we had was a beautiful one of the city and part of the bay. The room was spacious. Will recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Convenient Location and Pleasurable Stay”
Reviews.Author: krawner
Reviews.Content: The Westin San Francisco is well-situated, 1 block from the BART Montgomery station. At $8.10, the ride from San Francisco Airport (SFO) to the hotel is a steal. The hotel is located in Union Square with an abundance of restaurants and shopping in close proximity. For business travelers, it's only a short walk to Moscone Center. It's also near the MUNI (to go elsewhere in SF) and within walking distance of Chinatown (10 minute walk). Geraldine at the front desk was absolutely fantastic and gave us a room on the 35th floor. The rooms have floor-to-ceiling windows, so the view was spectacular. The shower had a soothing double shower head. Decor was modern and clean. Beds were comfortable. The concierge was also helpful and friendly. I enjoyed my stay here and would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience and poor service (concierge)”
Reviews.Author: LeVoyageurdeLondres
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on vacation for 3 nights in April 2012. Had an bad experience with the concierge. Coming from Europe, it was our first time in SF. On our first day in the city, we went to the concierge for help. One of the thing we had to do was to walk across the Golden Gate bridge and enjoy the view of the bay from there. We did not know how to get there from the hotel. The concierge did not seem very competent in showing us the way and could not tell us very clearly how to get there by bus. She was a bit clumsy with the map. Then, one of her colleague passed behind her and told her that the bridge was closed for pedestrians. She did not check to confirm the information and simply sold us the bike tour company that they work with for $72 (for 2 people). It was "the only way" we could see the view from the bridge (we did not have a car at this time). We then thought we had no choice but to buy the 24hr bike rental as we could not come to SF and not go over the bridge. It was only to our sad surprise that once we reached the bridge there was lots of pedestrians crossing the bridge. We were really unhappy about this and disppointed that the hotel misinformed us. We ended spending money for something we did not was based on their advice. We got back to the hotel late that night and decided to share our feedback/complaints with the concierge the next morning. Another person received us and told us that they thought the bridge was closed. I know that this is mainly a hotel for business but if the concierge is not well informed to advise tourists then you may as well not have a concierge desk. Furthermore, the person took my name, room number and assured me that the desk manager would contact me to explain the situation. I told him that I was checking out the next day and he said that it would be fine, someone would get back to me before then. I checked my messages three times and asked upon check out if the concierge left me a message. NOTHING. I am not sure what I expected: a refund of perhaps just an apology but I got none of the above. Very disappoiting to say the least for such a flagship hotel. And the cherry on the cake was that on the back of the SF city maps that they give to everyone, there is a 5 USD discount per person applicable on the bike tour they sold to us. They obviously 'forgot' to mention that to us when they booked it for us... Beware of the concierge in this hotel! The hotel itself has nothing particular. It is quite well located, close to Market street and walkable distance to Union Square. The room we got was ok. The bathtub is too small of have a bath. Good bed though. I would not return to this hotel. Poor customer service from a the concierge staff.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and stylish”
Reviews.Author: Evanston_Jeff
Reviews.Content: I was in SF for a meeting and stayed for 4-nights at the Westin San Francisco and enjoyed my stay. The rooms were very nice- modern and comfortabel and although my room layout was a bit quirky, I had a wonderful view of the city. The concierge was fantastic and helped get tickets for tours in the city and they were very responsive with good suggestions for places to eat. The gym was reasonably adequate, and the pool was more for a dip than a swim. Internet access was good, but my one complaint was that the restaurant in the hotel is not very good, although there are a number of good restaurants nearby, so this is not an issue, unless you are in a hurry in the morning. Overall- a good hotel, with a nice location; I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Market Street - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: atljs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Market Street for a long weekend this spring, and were very pleased with our time there. From the second we got out of our car, the staff was so nice and helpful. The room was very nice and clean, and while it was slightly smaller than an average size one, it wasn't cramped for the two of us. The floor-to-ceiling windows definitely make it feel larger. As with other Westins, the bed was so comfortable. Every morning during our stay, we had breakfast in the hotel restaurant, which was good. And of course there are plenty of restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. It's in a great location - easy to get anywhere you need to go. We had redeemed Starwood points for this trip, but I would definitely consider staying here my next time San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Frank L
Reviews.Content: I was up here during an extended weekend for a wedding. The hotel was easy to get to by BART from OAK. From the moment we checked in, we were greeted with nothing but smiles and friendliness. The room was wonderful like all the other Westin properties I've stayed in. I can't ask for a better location, everything was within walking distance, if not there are numerous buses near me to take me to my destinations. If I am back in SF, I'll def be back here.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, typical Westin, nothing out of the ordinary”
Reviews.Author: RPWfour
Reviews.Content: We were beginning a four week tour of Africa and China by celebrating a birthday in San Francisco. We had flown in from Portland, Oregon and were catching our Cathay Pacific flight out of SFO the next day. Being a Starwood Rewards member we booked a room at the Westin San Francisco Market Street for the night. Also being a Hilton Honors Diamond member I was expecting a less than ordinary welcome and possibly something special considering I had informed them of the nature of our stay. We got nothing! Not that I was expecting much, but even a piece of chocolate and a "Happy Birthday" message would have been appreciated. We were given a $15 drink credit at the bar, which pretty much afforded us one glass of "cheap" wine. All in all, this hotel is okay if you need a quick place to stay in San Francisco. Do not expect anything above the ordinary, and if you are a Starwood member, consider switching to Hilton Honors. At least you would get an upgrade if available.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, pleasant staff!”
Reviews.Author: Stacythewitch
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so clean, smoke free, comfortable beds, and a pleasant staff. The location is terrific! You only have to walk 1/2 block to Market Street where you have access to the Bart (subway system), and various busses and trams! We took the Bart to and from SFO airport. It was easy, inexpensive and quick. The cost was $8.10 per person, however, if you have a lot of luggage I would recommend not doing it. For $2 you can travel and transfer from trams and busses. The museum of Modern Art is one block away, union square is about 6 blocks from the hotel also. When I go to San Francisco again, I will book this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Short walk to my office, shops and restaurants. With Westin you know what you get, but they have very good beds.”
Reviews.Author: GAKill
Reviews.Content: Great location (for me). Standard Westin formula. Gym OK, but bit cramped for mat work and gets very full early in the mornings. Good beds, as with other Westins.

Reviews.Title: “$15/day for Wi-Fi Internet!”
Reviews.Author: agdaniele
Reviews.Content: Good location and the stay was pleasant. Service very good. I couldn't help but notice the lack of available Wi-Fi service anywhere in the hotel unless you paid $15 per day---even in the common areas of the hotel there was no public wi-fi. When paying more than $300 per night for a room, and with bandwidth so inexpensive and ubiquitous, Wi-Fi should be included. Disgraceful.

Reviews.Title: “Super Location & Great Room”
Reviews.Author: Keleeisenhauer
Reviews.Content: We got a great last minute rate on the Westin website that really added value to our stay. The location of the hotel is perfect with many restaurants & bars within walking distance. The front desk & room service staff were friendly. We were impressed with the quality of room service food. The lobby has impressive floral displays that were really creative & a true focal point upon entry. The rooms were updated, comfortable & clean- we slept great! I would absolutely return here if the price were reasonable again. We did try to go down to have a drink at the hotel bar, but it was packed with no seating. That was a bummer, but also a good sign.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service. Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Josh K
Reviews.Content: I do not often write reviews, but the service at this hotel was so far above what I have encountered elsewhere that I feel compelled. The hotel itself has a very luxurious feel. The lobby is well decorated and rooms are well appointed. The room was spacious, full of light, and had all of the amenities you would expect at hotel of this class. The bed and pillows were extremely comfortable, something that I find very important and often supbar, even at luxury hotels. I did not have time to see the gym, so I can't comment on that, but they had rental excercise gear from new balance, which I thought was a good idea. The location is excellent and was right in the middle of everything. I was there for 4 nights for a conference at Moscone, which was literally a 2 minute walk. I did have a day to explore the city, so being in the middle of everything and next to the T (subway) was helpful. As far as food, I didn't eat at the hotel bar/restaurant. However, the caliber of restaurants within walking distance was impressive. The best part was the service. I was first greated by Rocelyn (I think that was her name) who was very curteous and helpfull. Everyone I talked to had a smile on, which was nice. One day it was really pouring (big surprise in SF), and I was surpirsed that as I was leaving in my suit they offered me a loaner umbrella to take with me. Never had that happen at a hotel before! Overall, an impressive hotel in a great location with excellent service. I highly recommend this hotel, especially if you need to be near Moscone or the heart of the city.

Reviews.Title: “In the Middle of Everything”
Reviews.Author: beentheredonethat56
Reviews.Content: This Westin is right in the middle of everything I need access to in SF: Market St (duh!), convention center, Embarcadero (walking distance) and even a Whole Foods. It's a bustling business hotel and I found the hotel clerk to be extremely helpful and friendly. The rooms were adequate (for a big city hotel) but not huge. However, I was on a very high floor, and with floor-to-ceiling windows, the view was spectacular. My one disappointment is that because of a change in plans, I needed to cancl my last night and at check-in, asked if the reservation could be changed to the Westin at SFO. Although there was no penalty to do so, she said that "the systems were not linked" and I would have to make the change myself. As a consolation, she said, airport hotels are usually much cheaper. Unfortunately, after many tries to get through to the Westin SFO, the rate rate was actually about $100 MORE than I was paying ($379 vs $279). I ended up staying at the Hilton SFO which boasted a huge room for $179 instead. It pays to shop around.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: clickonline
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location! The hotel is conveniently located close to Union Square. There are tons of restaurants available in the area and you are close to major attractions in SF. The hotel was clean and the rooms were very spacious for a hotel right in the middle of the city. It is definitely one of the better Westin's I have stayed at in the US. Will highly recommend for business or leisure travellers.

Reviews.Title: “San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Mumzacab
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms are spacious and very comfortable. After a direct flight from europe I got a good sleep. I didnt have much time for sighseeing but the conciege desk were very helpful in directing me to the tram stop to travel down to pier 39 and from here I walked on to Fishermans Wharf. The hotel is located about 5 minute walk from the BART which will get you to the airport - although the downward escalators were out of action when I had to travel to the airport so I had to get my suitcase and laptop bag down the flight of steps. Didnt eat at the hotel - starbucks across the road for coffee and a supermarket up around the corner where you grab a snack. I did go to a wonderful Chinese Restaurant called WANG's next door to the fire station about 5 mins walk from the hotel and the Moscone Convention centre - gets very busy lunchtimes but well worth the wait!

Reviews.Title: “World class service”
Reviews.Author: WanderSteve
Reviews.Content: Just a great experience with world class service. They really rolled out the red carpet for me. And it's also the little things like complimentary waters. Nice.

Reviews.Title: “Bachelorette in the City”
Reviews.Author: Bubertons
Reviews.Content: One of our friends decided to have her bachelorette in San Francisco and stay at Westin Market Street. It was a perfect location to access downtown shopping and bars while still being close to the Warf to grab a bread bowl and wine tasting at Giradelli Square. Staff was friendly and very accomidating to our requests.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay.”
Reviews.Author: Sactown123
Reviews.Content: I booked on a third party website and got a great deal for a weekend rate that included free WiFi. The hotel had no idea, but I brought the print out and they were glad to honor it. The Wi Fi in the hotel was horrible! My 3G smartphone was faster and more reliable than their WiFi. I can't believe this is a business hotel. If I had any business to do, I would have been ticked off! Other than that, the rooms are small, the bed is uncomfortable and towels are thin. This is a typical 3 star property, not really bad, but not four stars.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION FOR EXPLORING SFO”
Reviews.Author: GTSINC
Reviews.Content: Stayed several times in past, last over St Patty's Day w/e. Understandably abit of a madhouse with parade/guests, but, hotel was an oasis for me. It has a great location just off Market St, within walking distance to Union Square area for shopping, resturants, theater, etc. Also BART, MUNI, SAM TRANS, AC TRANSIT, CAL TRAIN transit options for trip to Castro, Pier 39, North Beach, Berkeley, SFO, etc. Only issue was broken leg of desk in room. Would recommend and stay again.Jacob at check in and Carmen at check out provided great customer service. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “They're here for you!”
Reviews.Author: Truly T
Reviews.Content: After some very bad miscommunication with my new employer regarding accommodations for my orientation, Gina at the front desk of the Westin SF went above and beyond to do what she could to assist me. She was kind, thoughtful and went out of her way to help me sort out details. She made a miserable day into a happy one just by being kind and considerate. The rooms and service at the Westin SF are bar none. I'll be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: poohkin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights while on business. Staff was extremely friendly and attentive upon arrival. A usual high-standard Westin greeting. I stayed on the fourth floor of the hotel and would definitely recommend staying on one of the higher floors for a view. My room was near the gym and the elevators but there was not a noise to be heard - much to my relief. Room was nothing special really. I had two queen beds with a flat screen and a work space. The bathroom was pretty standard as well. Bed was super comfortable for sleeping and the room was extremely quiet and peaceful overall. The location of the hotel is great. Definitely walk-able to lots of destinations. Walked from Little Italy and North Beach one night and felt safe and definitely easy to find. Academy of the Arts and MOMA San Francisco are right there. Plus a Starbucks so you can avoid the $5 cup of coffee in the lobby restaurant. I ate in the restaurant for breakfast one morning and had to keep it to a $15 per diem limit. There is literally one thing on the menu under $15 - a smoothie. Add a $5 cup of coffee and you're over. Seems like they could offer better choices within a reasonable price for breakfast. Can I please get a bagel? All in all, the hotel is comfortable, rooms are spacious and the hotel is centrally located. Definitely would stay again when in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: movinon6
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located in the center of downtown San Francisco. Fun area to walk, shop , or just relax in Union Square located just across the street. We stayed in the Towers this time, the newer section, and were very pleased with our room. (Although our last stay was in the older section and the room was smaller but not that bad at all.) We were upgraded to a higher floor upon our request with a beautiful view of the city and the Bay. The staff was polite and helpful. The Oak Room bar is always bustling. And if you need a quick bite or breakfast you can pick one up in the lobby's cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...”
Reviews.Author: BlkBetty
Reviews.Content: It's a big hotel, but a nice one. The rooms are great and what can you say about their beds except "heavenly." So warm and comfy!! The staff is always warm and welcoming. Sometime the front and Concierge desks are a bit busy so it's better to call them!

Reviews.Title: “Check your invoice carefully”
Reviews.Author: ia2ca1984
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference there recently and the hotel is okay. However, when looking at my invoice after checkout, I noticed I was was given a charge for using the mini bar. I called them and asked for accounting. No one was home, so I called back and asked for sales. They forwarded me to the front desk who put me on hold and then hung up on me. I called again and managed to speak with someone. I explained that I NEVER use hotel mini bars because they're for the rich or suckers and I wanted the charge reversed immediately. I was told that the mini bar door sensors could have prompted the charge. Hardly a satisfactory explaination, but the upshot was that they reversed the charge within 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great views, small bathroom”
Reviews.Author: pgregory53
Reviews.Content: The location of the property is great. Staff are friendly and the rooms are nicely furnished. In spite of the bathroom that was not designed for people over 5 foot 9 inches, we stay at the hotel on our trips to SF.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good for families”
Reviews.Author: MumInOz
Reviews.Content: After such a long flight from Australia, it was so nice to stay at this hotel with its heavenly beds and very friendly staff. We were first greeted by the very friendly and forward-thinking check-in staff who offered us a small bar fridge in addition to the crib for my baby. (the fridge was so useful to keep snacks and drinks for my ever so hungry toddler) Our room is what we expected for a Westin: beautiful heavenly beds that were so comfy that we had the best sleep ever for the 4 nights we stayed in SF. The crib is not just a portable pack and play, it was an actual mobile crib and even the baby slept for a reasonable amount of time (didn't have to get up in the middle of the night for the first time since before he was born). The rooms were large and spacious (we had a 2 queen bed) and the flat screen TVs were nice to keep my toddler entertained. The view from our room was of Kearny street and since we were on a lower floor, we could hear some street noise but it did not bother us at all. The 2nd time we checked in, we were given a room on the highest floor (36th) which had no street noise but the view was fantastic: same aspect, but we could see Union Square, San Francisco Bay and the top of the Bay bridge on the other side. Getting to and from this hotel from the airport using BART was no problem at all and it was convenient to other means of public transport (buses, the F-line, cable car) because of its proximity to Market Street. We were even close to the Amtrak bus pickup point just in front of the Westfield which was a few blocks away. Overall, I'd recommend this place for a hassle-free relaxed stay.

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed this place...”
Reviews.Author: Io-Truman
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this place even though we typically avoid large hotels. This is a large hotel. Yet, there are enough personal touches to make the experience so much better. One example was the nice surprise of coming in from the cold to find a polite staff member offering us little snacks and pastries. The room was comfortable and the views were great. Also, it is located right near the BART so it is very easy to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: trixdesigns
Reviews.Content: This is my go-to hotel every time I travel to San Francisco. The staff is courteous and attentive. They have everything you could need and will get you anything else. This Westin is rated an SPG Category 5, but is leaps and bounds ahead of it's sister property in Union Square. The property is a short walk from Market Street with connections to several trollies and buses. It is also very close to the Moscone if you happen to be in town for a conference. Even with a sold out hotel, their internet still provided 2Mbps down and 1Mbps up! With floor to ceiling windows on SPG Preferred rooms and the overall feel of the hotel, this will continue to be one of my favorites.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience and checked out early to stay at a nearby hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Coxbergeron
Reviews.Content: We arrived to the hotel late in the evening and was told at the front desk we had our reservations for a king bed room. Upon entering our room we had a queen bed, mot king, and we found urine all over the toilet seat and immediately called the front desk. They were not overly apologetic but did have someone bring up keys to another room. The next room was also dirty, toilet seat not clean, hairs on the bedding and it was a handicap room with a queen bed- not the king we booked. The shower head went below my husbands shoulders and he couldnt even wash his hair. We called the front desk and expressed our frustrations and again, was not impressed with the manager on duty. He informed us that because we booked through Orbitz he wouldn't be able to honor our room selection and this was the best they had for us. We told him we were so unhappy with our accommodations and the room cleanliness that we didnt want to stay for the remainder of our reservation and he just said go ahead you can check out in the morning. At $335 a night, we received an experience equivalent to a 2 or 3 star hotel. Given the abundance of hotel options in San Francisco I would definitely not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel in the heart of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: mdditt2000
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Westin San Francisco Market Street hotel three times. As a SPG platinum guess I was upgrade the last two times. The upgraded suites are very nice and worth the upgrade. I believe the suites are located on the end and have numbers ending with #06. Be aware the hotel can be very busy when there is a conference held at the Moscone Center or hotel meeting rooms. If you are staying at Westin San Francisco Market Street hotel on vacation or pleasure you might want find a smaller or Boutique Hotel. The last two times I have not been impressed by the service!! In fact I would highly recommend staying away from Ducca Restaurant. The service was really bad! They had bad wine and horrible beer available on the happy hour menu. Nobody finished their drinks!! The Westin San Francisco Market Street concierge desk is excellent. They booked all my tickets to the California Academy of Sciences and provided some excellent recommendations for dinner. Highly recommend using their services except. I wanted to use the hotel driving service but they wanted to charge me $65 for an inter-city drop off. That is crazy. Hotel has no shuttle service. If you stay at the W hotel one block away you can reserve the Acura. I have never eaten breakfast at this hotel. Good Peets coffee and Starbucks directly across the street. In my opinion the Westin San Francisco Market Street is the best option when staying in San Francisco on business. Hotel fails short for personal travel. Carmen at the front check-in desk is very helpful. It's night and day between her and some of the other staff. Also beware that if you leave your luggage on a cart with the luggage staff it won't be locked up. This happened twice. I was really concerned with somebody walking off with my laptop. I wouldn't recommend leaving luggage with the bell staff unless you see them lockup the bags. Maybe it's because I used a luggage cart. Also don't expect the bell staff pushing the cart if you choose not the valet park. WIFI in the hotel is really expensive.

Reviews.Title: “great service but not so heavenly beds.”
Reviews.Author: jennifer c
Reviews.Content: I went to sanfrancisco for the weekend with my daughter. when I checked in Roycelynn at the front desk assisted me. she was very friendly and helpful. I believe she truly is an amazing asset to the Service express team. she was quick to check me in and always said hi to me as i passed through the lobby and would ask how my stay was going. I truly believe that the little things like this are the building blocks for providing great service. thanks again roycelynn for all your help!! Micheal from valet too was very helpful too.. My only complaint is that they beds were not so heavenly..

Reviews.Title: “Great location; Nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: TorranceRyan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a 3 day getaway. The staff was very courteous. The rooms were nice, although on the smaller side, but this is San Francisco, so I wasn't expecting a lot of space. The views from the room were great and the floor to ceiling windows really allowed us to enjoy them. The best part of our stay was the hotel location. We were only a few blocks from Union Square and the Westfield Centre and the Ferry Building and Fisherman's Wharf were a quick ride down the F-line, which is a great bargain at $2. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable and great price.”
Reviews.Author: superusta
Reviews.Content: Our favorite hotel in SF. Great location and comfortable rooms. I did some research and I got the best price on Westin's website. On Expedia, it was about $100 more per night. The valet parking was expensive, but I guess parking in SF can be expensive. We will stay here again when we visit SF next time.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mbhCosta
Reviews.Content: Rooms are nice size, especially compared to the Westin in Union Square which I hated. Service is excellent, location is great, heart of downtown. My only complaints are the gym is small, at 6:45am a lot of the machines were tied up and the room service hours and menu are limited. I would definitely stay here again although the Marriot around the block offers a similar experience for a smaller price.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: ECexpat
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a conference here and brought my son with me. Pros: The rooms are big, especially the Executive Suite rooms. They have cribs instead of Pack N Play units. The beds are quite comfortable. The rooms have good temperature control, and the bathrooms have dual-head showers. The hotel is centrally located in SOMA within walking distance to BART. Cons: Like other reviewers have mentioned, since they tend to be full, they don't usually have rooms available before check-in time. Room service menu is limited and expensive and has a 20% service fee. Do not valet your car at the hotel unless you absolutely have to. With tax, it's over $50 a day to park at the hotel. There is a much more affordable parking garage right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “High Quality, Reasonably priced, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Tom_Edin
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice hotel at a brilliant location. Very convenient for BART to the airport. The price was very attractive for the location and standard and as a result the hotel was packed full. Don't expect to check in early or get a late checkout. Food in the hotel is pricey, as is WiFi so the deal is not quite as good as it looks from the room rate but it is still great value for the hotel standard and location. I've stayed at a lot of hotels around this area and this would be top of my list for the next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: James0821
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend went to California for a Oakland Raiders game. The hotel was in a great location. The room was a nice size and very clean! The lady at the front desk was very helpfull. She gave me a map and marked directions to specific sights. i stayed on the 16th floor and had a nice view. Breakfast was a little on the pricey side. i would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great San Francisco hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ahn556
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the 17th floor. Hotel had a great view. Lobby was nicely decorated in birds of paradise. Room had Starbucks coffee to wake up to and was very nice. Would stay again and again

Reviews.Title: “Great beds and pretty good location”
Reviews.Author: Tranedan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin on the front side of a week in San Fransico. Was a pretty good location. I was a little upset on how loud and thin the walls seamed to be. But very clean, great service. The hotel suggested a great dinner spot and took care of all the details, I'm not sure I would stay this close to market street again but that is part of what you learn the first time in a city you haven't been in.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Usual Westin Experience”
Reviews.Author: Tacos23
Reviews.Content: Stayed on a business trip and not the usual Westin experience that I am used to. As a SPG member, was not put on the member floor. Hotel is a little run down and the location, while some parts around the hotel are ok, there is equally scary areas as well. Will not be staying at this location again.

Reviews.Title: “Bland, charmless, overpriced, uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: jwholloway
Reviews.Content: The best that can be said of this Starwood property is that the lobby's nice and the staff helpful. After that -- once one exits the elevator into the institutional-beige guest floors and the drab institutional-beige rooms -- it's Motel 6 territory, for $200/night more. The overall design of the rooms is atrocious. the mind-numbling dull color scheme, the peculiar arrangement of the lights, the shabby grout and tile. Luckily I was only here three nights -- any longer and I've had joined the bums in camping along the embarcadero.

Reviews.Title: “Spent 6 nights, could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: DoctorsK
Reviews.Content: So I chose this hotel because of the location--close to Union Square, close to Moscone convention center--and being a Starwood member, had heard that the Market St. Westin was slightly more consistently nice than the Westin on Union Square, which is more of a "historic" building. Staff: was excellent; requested a high floor, which I didn't necessarily get (17 of 30something), but it was high enough. Requested a king away from the elevator, which I did get. Used the concierge a couple times, who were very helpful. Needed a 6 passenger cab for transport to the airport, which was easily arranged with the doorman (though plan ahead). Cleaning staff were all friendly. Room: considering the price, $311/night, I've stayed in nicer rooms at that price. Bathroom was pretty small. Had a large king bed, which was extremely comfortable. Full sized desk as well as another chair next to the bed. Large flat screen TV was nice, but due to the shape of the room, was kind of in an awkward position to watch from bed. Room had plenty of plugs for cell/laptop/iPad chargers. Closet was a little small, as well as the storage for clothes (for those of us who like to unpack). Not a huge fan of the Westin brand toiletries--but that's the same at all their hotels (W stuff is much better). The room I had was a pretty nice location; very end of the hall, almost a corner-type room, with a view of the bay. It was right next to the ice machine, but I NEVER heard it. Food: didn't eat in the hotel a single time, though friends who did use the restaurant said it was very good. Misc: The gym is average. Not very large. At one time, there were 10+ people there, and it was way too crowded. I did see signs about Westin clients being able to use the gym at the Four Seasons, but I didn't investigate this. It should be noted, the elevators were extremely fast. The hotel was crowded, there are tons of rooms, yet I never felt I had to wait for an elevator. Overall, the place was clean, staff was awesome and accommodating, and the Westin bed is very nice to sleep in when spending such a long time in a hotel room. I would give the hotel a 5 star rating if the rooms were a little larger and maybe more extravagant, considering the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good overall, but not super Westin experience”
Reviews.Author: evilexis
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here many times over the past year for business trips. it is a reasonable hotel, clean, great beds, etc. but probably the most run of the mill Westin I've stayed at. If I dont get room upgrades to higher floors, the view is pretty dismal, and the rooms dont even have chairs besides a desk chair. the reason i rate this hotel average is that recently I have been paying much more than I used to (up to $329 a night, whereas I used to routinely get rooms for $179ish). It is a good value in SF at the lower range of price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good staff”
Reviews.Author: Lounim
Reviews.Content: Even though my room wasn't what I thought it would be, I enjoyed my stay. if you bring a car, don't use hotel parking. Park across the street for half price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business hotel”
Reviews.Author: YDz
Reviews.Content: Rooms are large with floor to ceiling windows and great views. Comfortable room, bathroom and noiseless A/C. Good size gym. Just off Market, close to Union Square, Moscone, Chinatown and Embarcadero.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AJWW4764
Reviews.Content: stayed for 2 nights during a flying trip. Nice rooms with all mod cons.Cant complain abpout much. However would like to praise the concierge staff who went over and above the standard of service for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, with kind staff going out of their way to be helpful!”
Reviews.Author: fievel1079
Reviews.Content: It's incredibly refreshing when you find good customer service in this day and age of lackadaisical nonchalance and indifference. Having stayed at this Westin for a week for a business trip/conference, I was pleasantly surprised by repeated encounters with just truly kind staff - from an always smiling, sweet housekeeper, to a bellhop who went out of his way to share with us the scoop on a behind the scenes fun walk to the waterfront, to all other staff encountered being just...genuinely ... nice! How refreshing! A super comfy bed, had great views from the 28th floor, and pleasantly surprised the conference food served throughout the week was quite good - for conference food! All in all, highly recommend, particularly for business/conference functions. Kudos Westin!

Reviews.Title: “Overall very good.”
Reviews.Author: Kuttermax
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at the Westin on Market Street at least once a year when I'm San Francisco on business. Although I prefer the "W" down the street, the Westin tends to offer better rates. I'm SPG Platinum, so often am able to get an upgrade at the Westin Market Street. Check in was prompt and efficient and I was given an upgrade to an available suite, which was great. The room was clean and quiet and had really nice views of San Francisco. There were large flat panel televisions in both the sitting room and the bedroom. Westin has recently changed to a new television interface that is nice, but a little laggy. I've noticed this in several recently Westin's that I stay in. I did not utilize the much of the hotel amenities this time around due to the short nature of my stay. Previously the gym was adequate, but nothing special. Not sure if it has changed or not this time around. The doorman was friendly and efficient, and I did use their car service back to the airport. It's slightly more expensive than a cab (about $65 with tip included), but you get to go in a larger luxury vehicle and they are waiting for you downstairs at the scheduled time. My main complaint is that I was charged for internet use. As SPG Platinum internet is included. I called down in the morning when I got the bill under the door and the front desk attendant apologized and said she would take it off the bill and immediately send up a new one. It never came. When I went downstairs, there was a lineup at the front desk and my car was waiting, so I didn't get a chance to talk to them. I then checked my statement and was in fact billed for the internet and never credited.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: travel8nyc
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks new, the rooms were clean, the location was great, and the staff were great. Great stay! Parking was expensive at $54 per 24 hrs. so we parked across the street. We only paid $139/ night for our room. They ran a promotion so it was super cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Decent for the price. If you're from the area, you get it....”
Reviews.Author: Filonia
Reviews.Content: Go anywhere else and for the same amount of money, you get a much larger room and most likely free parking. In San Francisco, you get a room the size of a box, surrounded by busy streets (traffic and pedestrians) and you have to pay for parking. BUT, it's San Francisco. If you're from the Bay Area, you typically expect it. I just recently moved from the Bay Area so I wasn't surprised. Down to business, the hotel is in a great location; for tourists, it's in the heart of the city, right next to Union Square. It's also close to the Ferry building, BART station and the Bay Bridge. The rooms were very clean and for the size, well organized. For work trips, plenty of outlets for all your electrical gadgets and a decent desk space to work on. The noise outside is a bit much, but that's pretty much anywhere in the city. The cleaning staff, room service, valet and concierge were all friendly and helpful. The front desk staff were very nice, friendly, helpful and welcoming. I ran into one not so friendly front desk staffer on my last day there. She seemed a bit scattered though, so in all fairness, it may have just been an off day. That being said, unless a room is free, I think it's fair to expect everyone to be pleasant. Definitely not a hotel to avoid, but I wouldn't go out of my way to stay there either.

Reviews.Title: “Westin didn't wow”
Reviews.Author: bcheong
Reviews.Content: We reached the hotel in the morning after a 12hour flight and were hoping to get our rooms before the standard check-in time and alas we had no such luck. we were told to return 4-5 hours later and skip our rest and sleep. When we returned they were still trying to get us rooms and finally asked if we minded rooms on seperate floors. I hope they didn't prevent us from getting rooms because they were trying to find rooms on the same floor, that just lacks initiative. The lobby is fairly nice and swanky, and the rooms are a little less so. They have the required flat screen tv, but the ipod player doesn't quite work, and they didn't have a shower cube, just the old bathtub. They also didn't refill the bath amenities after 3 days, not good. Room service and laundry collection were ok 1 key benefit is the location, just next to Union Square and you can fulfil all your shopping fantasies. For breakfast, you can also choose to skip the expensive hotel buffet ($25, though the spread is not too bad by US standards) and have breakfast or (good) coffee at Peets just across the street from westin, or Cafe de la Presse on Grant. For lunch/dinner, there's R&G chinese at chinatown, also a stone's throw from westin

Reviews.Title: “As always....lovely visit”
Reviews.Author: mudhonie
Reviews.Content: The staff is super accomodating. The location cannot be beat, right off of Market, close to all the fabulous stores and restaurants. The whole zen aesthetic of the Westin brand is refreshing. The bar in the lobby has great prices for happy hour and is fun to commune with friends. The Heavenly brand sheets and shower head are hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Boroondara
Reviews.Content: Nearing the end of a 2 week holiday it was so nice to have a refreshing and happy check in, it started our final stopover in USA wonderfully. The usual things you look forward to at Westin was all there only complaint was the smallness of the room, but location meals bar all very nice for my husband and I. Thank you Westin S.F

Reviews.Title: “Totally misleading website”
Reviews.Author: Oliver F
Reviews.Content: At the time of booking, in December 2011, there was no mention anywhere on the WestinSF website that this is a 100% non-smoking hotel. On the internet booking, the system allowed you to select a room that was described as a "smoking room" as well as other rooms described as "non-smoking". We booked a "smoking room". On arrival at the hotel there were lots of signs saying "100% smoke free" - they even stamp the complimentary newspapers "clean air, all Westin North America hotels are smoke free". There was notice in the room informing you there is a $200 fine for smoking. It was forbidden to smoke on the forecourt area in front of the hotel, you had to go to the corner of the block where there is an ashtray in a doorway on the next street (where Westin staff seem to spend a lot of time). The staff at check-in said the hotel had not had smoking rooms for several years. If this is the case, then why does the website not mention it, and why does the website allow you to book one? If we had known that there were not smoking rooms available, we would have chosen a different hotel in SF. We were totally misled. We will not be staying at any Westin hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is located in downtown San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelers34
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in good location in downtown San Francisco and walkabout to many restaurants and shops. About a one-mile easy walk to the pier where you can see the Bay Bridge. Very comfy bed and pillows. If you have a car, be prepared to pay $48 per day for valet parking. I was told there are self park lots across the street for about $25 per day but lot closes at 11 pm (you should verify this on your own). Wi-Fi in rooms is an additional $15 per day. Didn't use the lounge, but it looked like a decent place to gather and have cocktails. All of the staff were very friendly and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “I love SF!”
Reviews.Author: keentravellerDelhi
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay in San Francisco - and a large part of that was because my work was good, the hotel was great and the city is so beautiful!! I stayed in the old wing - with a view of Union Square. There is a beautifyl clock in th elobby, right next to the bar and fabulous views from the elevator! Very conveniently located - the stop of the famous Powell & Mason St tram line is at the hotel; across from Macy's and the Cheesecake Factory (which can have a LONG waiting time). I got a room I didn't like, and the staff was quick to move me to a "room with a (restricted) view" ... the room is very well done, the first thing I noticed is the chandelier and if you open the window a little (in the summer)... it can get really nice and cold (no AC required!) I would definitely go back and stay there when I revist.

Reviews.Title: “Stuff you don't know, but should”
Reviews.Author: Robert M
Reviews.Content: I have been staying here 17+ years this is not your ordinary review. All the staff has always been super, including my recent stay last week. Carmen is among the best there is. My issue is twofold, the complacent man in charge of security, and Westin short-sighted budget cuts that could impact your stay Two staff employees confirmed this particular Westin pays for just one person to handle calls through the evening hours for 350+ guests. No problem if you are waiting for towels, but if you need serious help, (security or health) they will NOT answer if they are taking service requests. You don't ring-through, or even connect to voice mail. Women traveling alone looking for a good hotel need to consider what happened to me. My first night I woke at 11:30 to clicking noises at my door then knocking. I went to the peephole, the person was gone. Second incident same thing, nobody visible. 3rd time I realize a disturbed person was knocking on my adjoinging door that attaches to his room. He periodically knocked, then started whistling through the crack in our door. I called express service,, rang off the hook. (FYI,,, I was told by the staff dialing “O” uses the same phone line.) To be 100% accurate, after the fact, they said my only other choice was to dial 7005 the front desk. Try to imagine yourself as a new guest knowing this # at midnight in the dark I dressed to go to the lobby, gave the phone another try, got right through. A second-string guy arrived in room service attire, said the security guy was handling another matter. (interesting!) I was told CALL IF IT HAPPENED AGAIN. I told him he didn't get it,,, the guy was repeatedly knocking on my adjoining door, not my hall door. The creep knocked again while the room service guy was there, now my credibility can't be questioned. The room service guy knocked on the this guys door for over a minute, no success. I had to personally call this fella on my phone and demand he come out and get this resolved. The low-life opened, denied doing anything till I told him the room service guy was my witness. He admitted it all. My real issue is the next day. The guy wasn't moved, I was told “don't worry he can't get in”. Go back to sleep with that thought ladies. I am a guy, I was prepared to handle a repeat incident Jersey Style (joke) but my daughter and wife who travel alone on business will never stay here with this policy. I received one very lame boiler-plate letter in my spam, “about your concerns” from Mr Jeffery --, the man in charge, that it would be investigated. COMMON SENSE tells anyone a follow-up call to me was warranted with his findings and corrective action taken. I was there 3 additional days, plenty of time to find me. All 3 days I was politely told I could talk to him “if you want”. Decide for yourself if this type of attitude brought change. The point Mr -- doesn't get is that by turning his cowardly head, word has gotten out to people similar to my neighbor, that this behavior at this particular Westin is tolerated, they need their business. If guests don't take charge they will look the other way. The staff are fine, but Mr -- trained employees to say he is available “if you want”. He isn't smart enough to realize his lazy inaction and aloofness leads to obvious speculation that this creepy room activity is the norm, and perhaps occurs too often to handle professionally. Mr -- has been here a very long time, perhaps too long to care about the change that I see happening. Be 100% accountable if you still choose to stay here. You must accept “call us if it happens again” and “don't worry he can't get in

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel for tradeshows in San Fran”
Reviews.Author: lindadw60
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in most of the hotels near the convention center, I recommend the Westin. You don't have to walk thru an endless lobby to get in and out. Staff is very helpful. The location is very convenient to shops and restaurants. The rooms and common areas are clean and the beds at the Westin are the BEST! Just stayed there again and had another great experience. My co-workers at other hotels are planning to stay at the Westin next year.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing; run-down furnishings, outrageously expensive and unreliable internet, corporate crash-pad atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Rob187871
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a combined business/fun trip with my wife. We wanted a comfortable hotel in downtown San Francisco, with reliable internet and efficient service. The location is ideal. This hotel is very close to many restaurants and tourist sites. There is a lot of public transportation/taxis close by. The bed was comfortable. Unfortunately, those are the only positive things I have to say. I was shocked at the run-down state of the the room. There were a couple of enormous (about three-feet wide) dark red stains on the carpet. The carpet was scuffed and so was the foot stool. There was a problem with the fridge (it was very loud and there was a lot of water in it). I could go on, but let's just say it didn't seem like a four-star hotel. My brother stayed in a different room for a night and said that his was pretty run-down too. What irritated me most was the internet service. It is outrageously expensive. I travel a lot and I don't believe I have paid so much for internet for at least five years. Also, it took at a few hours to get the internet working. I ended up on the phone to a call center somewhere because no one at the hotel can deal with internet. I couldn't use my laptop on the bed. I had to sit at the desk because the cable doesn't stretch far and there were ZERO power outlets anywhere in the room except right at the desk. It is hard to get hold of staff members. Check-in took forever and the lines were so long for the concierge that we gave up. We couldn't get through to the hotel at all by phone before checking in and we tried for several hours. The general atmosphere is of a crash-pad for corporate types. My guess is that these people are on company expense accounts and probably don't care so much about the overall quality of the experience. There are other four-star-ish hotels close by and I have stayed at a couple of them in the past. My advice is to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way!”
Reviews.Author: nellymty
Reviews.Content: We have previously visit San Francisco and this time we decided to stay in a hotel closer to MArket st so I read a few reviews and decided for this one. We got a great online price in the hotel web page. When we arrived, we were welcomed by hot apple cider and apples in the lobby, which was great because it was a cold and windy day in San Francisco. At the front desk they offer us an upgrade to th 34 floor and we took it. When we got to the room it was in a corner of the 34th floor with an amazing view! Windows from ceiling to floor and a very large room! The bed and pillows were just incredible! I could describe them as sleeping in clouds! It was really close to everything and less than a block to Market st to take the MUNI or BART in case you want to go farther. It´s a couple of block away form Union Square, Nordstrom, Macy´s, etc. The service was fantastic and the hospitality and information from everyone was outstanding. I would stay there in my next trip to San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Expected more”
Reviews.Author: jumpthenetwillappear
Reviews.Content: It was an ugly start to the day. United Airlines delayed the flight from LA to San Francisco for 4 hours. We're hungry and stuck in Ontario airport where the entire food court smelled of rotton cheese, which they apparently put on their burritos. "Jane" the UA flight person reminded me of the character from "Meet the Parents", that Ben Stiller's character encounters in the airport. Although there are no other passengers around, she insists on using the speaker phone, telling him to please step back, as she calls out non-existant customers to come forward and present their ticket, as Stiller waits, frustrated and mystified. I started laughing a little bit hysterically when I reminded my husband of the scene from the movie. He pretended that he didn't know me. The United Airlines (flight 6350, January 20) plane smells like vomit, c'mon United Airlines, heard of air freshner or even better, cleaning? By the time we landed, my husband and I both agreed to drive from now on, in our comfortable Range Rover. It wouldn't have taken any longer. And we wouldn't have been subjected to the indignities of over-zealous TSA agents. We arrived at the Westin, to face a long line at the front desk. When we finally got to the counter, we asked if it would be possible to extend our trip by a day. The man behind the desk said, "Yes, there is availablity but I don't know what your rate will be, can I help you with anything else?" Clearly, he wanted us to move along. Odd, one would think that if a hotel has availablity and people wanting to stay there, they would be helpful in making these arrangements. On our way to the elevator, the bellman moved around us and pushed onto the elevator with a full trolley of suitcases. No one had offered to help us with ours. I pointedly said to him, "You go on ahead, we'll get the next one." Customer service NOT! When we got to our room, the keys didn't work so we schlepped back down and faced an even longer line at the front desk. The same guy told us that the keys did work, we just didn't do it properly. Nevertheless, he re-keyed them and they worked the second time around. I was hoping to find lotion in the room for my bath, it's such a hassle to pack nowadays. No lotion or shampoo. Just bath gel. Our room on the 10th floor is right beside the ice machine, which crashes a load of ice every now and then during the night, waking my husband up. I'm a heavy sleeper. The heating and air-conditioning are not quiet either, whooshing on and off during the night. Because it was raining we decided to go to the Ducca bar for happy hour and were hoping to stay in for dinner. The only free table had bright spot lights trained in our eyes. I wanted a nice glass of red wine. The waiter said the wine being served for happy hour was so-so Merlot. (Begging the question, why serve it?) This is wine country, we expect more. We ordered a lemon drop and appletini. They were the worst cocktails we'd ever drunk. I complained (my husband is too nice to complain) and they actually took my drink off the final bill. We ordered 2 of the specialty drinks and they were very good -- Pomology (a pomogranite mojito) and Acai apple crisp. We decided to order brushetta, and I told our waiter we would decide whether or not to eat at the restuarant based on whether we liked the brushetta. The brushetta was delicious although the bread it came on was nearly hard enough to break your teeth. We ordered some crab cakes and an onion tart. They were okay, but not worth a trip to the restaurant we decided so we saved some calories and went to bed, deciding to go out to one of our favorite SF restaurants the following night. Because there was no coffee service in the room, I headed over to Starbucks the next morning. When I returned to the hotel, I called to make a reservation for the night. The price shot up more than $100, but the room & view are also beautiful on the 31st floor. The beds are divinely comfortable and the rooms are clean and tastefully decorated. And rooms on the 31st floor do have coffee service. I spent the day shopping while my husband was in meetings. Got a little turned around thanks to directions given by well-meaning but incorrect strangers, including a motor-cycle cop. When I attempted to call the hotel on 411, it turns out not to be listed. Spent a frustrating hour and a half, trying to find it. The other Westin on Powell street was not very helpful when I called for information, yelling at me for entering the number in my phone as they gave it to me, because it made too much noise and hurt their ears. By the time I finally got back to the hotel I wasn't happy. I went to the reception desk, where the same guy was who had checked us in was working. I told him it wasn't possible to get the Westin on Market Street through 411. He mumbled something about that not being correct. So I put my phone on speaker and dialed 411, so that I could prove that I was right. He just stared at me and didn't say anything. So I came upstairs and called the hotel manager and told her what had happened. She sent up a complimentary tray with lovely cheese and the same so so wine they were serving last night at happy hour. Tonight my husband and I are grumpy. United Airlines called to say our afternoon flight has been cancelled so we have to leave in the morning at 7:15 a.m. I wish I hadn't come on this trip. I want a little pampering when I'm away from home. We were hoping for a nice time. When customer service isn't good, it's a reflection on the management. Maybe they aren't paying their employees well enough or perhaps they aren't nice to their employees. Whatever the case, this Westin is not on our "to do" list.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WillV90
Reviews.Content: I love the hotel. Great location. Very clean. People were helpful. It was close to everything which was very good cause anytime we would want a break from sightseeing or stating or any activity, we were always close to freshen up.

Reviews.Title: “Westin on Market St.”
Reviews.Author: JGSwick
Reviews.Content: Westin OK if you spend most of your time out of the hotel. Sleeping standards are good.. Good treatment for a Starwood member. Got high floor as requested. Barely minimum room amenities on the Preferred guest floor. Would like a hotel with a pool/sauna/steam rom like the nearby Marriott. Book early to get a good price. The big hotels charge for wireless. The Westin will charge you for three connections for your Macbook, iPad & iPhone. Be careful logging in. Walk across 3rd St to Peets or Starbucks for free wifi. Just don't understand why the flagship hotels charge for wifi, and the lesser sister brands are free.

Reviews.Title: “>5mins walk to Union sq/Macys/Bloomingdales/Apple etc”
Reviews.Author: Neoklassiksoul-yahoo
Reviews.Content: I would definitely support other reviewers with regards to the Westin Market Street. Whilst the hotel is in an excellent location, 2 mins to the key shops of Union Sq. Macys, Neiman Marcus, Emporio, Levis, Gap and the Apple store and round the corner the various large shopping centers of Market street housing Bloomingdales, Banana Rep, Zara, Crumplers, Timberland, Karen Millen etc etc; There is a lack of atmosphere and flair to the old. It does come across as rather dated - not that its not comfortable - though a style renovation is due. There is a wealth of Jazz bars, clubs, and restaurants within a short distance for for a weekend trip this hotel is great. Taxi rides from the airport are around 50 USD and its around 20 mins to cross SF to the Marina or to other shopping areas such as Fillmore/Mission etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, no complaints but no excitement”
Reviews.Author: wonderfelle
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a hotel in the SOMA/ Union Square area you can usually get a good deal at this Westin (though the Westin St. Frances is a hop closer to shopping). The hotel is a solid 4 star hotel and would be great if you were traveling on business or looking to spend most of your time outside of the hotel. The rooms are clean, relatively spacious and comfortable. I don't have a lot to say in terms of service because I didn't really speak to any of the hotel staff other than a very quick check in- check out - but that fact that those were both very speedy counts for something. However, in comparison to the St. Regis down the street where they greet you by name and the staff is extremely attentive, it's just not on the same level.

Reviews.Title: “great location, awesome beds, nice room”
Reviews.Author: Samuel H
Reviews.Content: loved this hotel, great location near everything, awesome room, nice and big, bed no doubt best i have ever slept in, hotel very nice and clean ,staff friendly, gym could be better but overall fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Alex L
Reviews.Content: Great location, Great Service and great value. The hotel was clean and the price was very valuable. The Location was perfect you could walk to anywhere in San Francisco. The only problem is that the bed was not very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Business, Would Look Around if on Vacation”
Reviews.Author: AKo75
Reviews.Content: Overall: The location was ideal for business meetings in the area and overall great for business travelers. I stayed for one night on business. It is about a block away from the BART station (access to SFO and OAK) and walking distance to Union Square, Embarcadero, Moscone Center. I’m not sure if I would stay here if I came here on a vacation. Although a good stay, there wasn’t anything in the hotel that would compel me to stay without looking around. There are several hotels in the area and it depends on what I would want to see while in the city! The lobby area has two great areas to conduct an informal business meetings, have a conference call, or do some work on the computer. Check in: Checked in on a Thursday morning, and as a bonus, was able to check in early (around 10:30 AM). Rates: Through a travel agency, $159 per night not including taxes. Resort Fee: None Internet Service: $14.95 per day, did not use. Room: Stayed in room 724. The room was small and functional, with a fantastic king bed, good desk with a plug on the baseboards, great iPod docking station. Great ceiling to floor windows; however, the view looks right into another office building. Shower: Acceptable. Toiletries: Shampoo, conditioner, lotion, and body soap (Heavenly, by Westin Spa).

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in the city by the bay”
Reviews.Author: froaction
Reviews.Content: catching up on some reviews. stayed for one night in October while in town for a 49ers game. Great location near Union Square and all public transportation. Bart station right up the street on the corner, muni bus stops everywhere. Quality hotel with some good views if you are a higher floor. We did not park a car but I remember seeing parking being very expensive which is the norm in all major cities. The only bad experience I had was when I called the night before to confirm my reservation and to ask a few questions. The guy I spoke with was a total jerk. I believe he ended up hanging up on me. I called back and spoke to someone else while also voicing my total displeasure with how I was handled. Well needless to say when I showed up in the morning I couldn't have been treated nicer. One thing of note while staying in San Francisco. Quiet a few hotels are under labor disputes. I work in a labor union job and its important to me to not stay any place with a picket line up or dispute going on. This hotel was on the "yes" list for staying at from the local hotel workers unions. Just thought I would pass that along. Typical Westin and a Typical nice stay. Would absolutely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!!”
Reviews.Author: tiredtravellerCanada
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for new years and it was very nice. The location was perfect! It was minutes from great shops, restaurants and SFMOMA. The downfalls were that our room overlooked a parade and the bath tub was plugged. Service wasn't great, we tried to find a resturant on new years day and they couldn't be bothered to help and suggested denny's. We went to another hotel and their concierge found us a great place to eat and called for reservations. Had a good time, would stay here again if we ended up with another good deal, but paying full price I would pick somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Nice standard Westin Hotel”
Reviews.Author: reinventtravel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location and the room was pretty spacious for a SF hotel. You have your typical Westin amenities in the room, the room was very clean and was a tiny bit worn - but in good condition non the less. The hotel front desk is awesome, very helpful all around. We had a room with a air purifier in it which was an awesome touch, made the room smell very fresh and clean.

Reviews.Title: “1st leg of our honeymoon - a 3 night stay”
Reviews.Author: Geraldine002
Reviews.Content: Negatives: The fact that we were on honeymoon was completely ignored (we later loved san fran so much we booked a fabulous 5* hotel up on Nob Hill for a further 3 nights which made a really big deal of the fact that we were just married which put the Westin to shame!) Man on desk at check in was matter of fact and unfriendly which was a turn off Seems to be more of a business hotel Drinks in the bar are expensive Positives: Great location, around the corner from Union Square Nice toiletries Very comfy bed Great shower

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay and great staff!”
Reviews.Author: amroid22
