Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights at this lovely hotel. Stayed at the hotel with my starwood miles I had accumulated. Drove in from the airport and it was very easy to find, located a few minutes from Union Square. I am glad I booked this hotel and not the Union Square Westin as this hotel was much newer and sophisticated. Originally my car was parked in the basement hotel parking but I discovered a cheaper parking garage just opposite the hotel. In my original email to the hotel I asked for a king size room on a high floor and away from the lifts. This had been granted on check in and I was very happy. Check in was smooth, quick and efficient. And the staff were lovely throughout my stay. I was very happy with the staff right across the board, from the valet staff to the housekeeping. The concierge were very helpful throughout my stay and gave me tips and suggestions on restaurants, road routes and general tourist things to do in San Fran. They made bookings for me on all accounts and their recommendations were always spot on. My room was clean and spacious with lovely amenities one always receives in Westin hotels. My stay in this hotel was just superb and I would recommend it to anyone and everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value, pleasant stay.”
Reviews.Author: Gate95
Reviews.Content: I was in SF for a three day meeting, and stayed here because it was close to the Moscone Center. Long and short: a recently renovated, clean, quiet business hotel. Everything worked as advertised. Room service arrived in 20 minutes, and was piping hot and fresh. Not a super luxurious hotel, but very comfortable, functional and affordable. Very pleased with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence, pleaseant experience over Thanksgiving”
Reviews.Author: pdoudar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin San Francisco for two nights in late November. We were impressed. The rooms were spotless, the staff was excellent and very accommodating, and the view was to die for. Hotel is very close to china town, street cars, cable cars, the main shopping areas, and had a lot of mentioned. Recommended all the way . Only disappointment was the $50 per day to park th car, but it is a standard thing now in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the heart of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: gjacoby126
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin for a several day software convention being held in its conference facilities. The room was about what I'd expect from a four star: spacious, well appointed, and with a very comfortable bed. I received a room on the next-to-highest floor with an absolutely spectacular view of San Francisco. Looking to the left, I could see the Golden Gate Bridge. In the distance was the Bay and Alcatraz, and to the right, the Bay Bridge. Below was Market Street. Just breathtaking. Because the conference was catered, I never had the chance to try the Westin's restaurants. The hotel's expensive--you pay for that great location--and when the conference was over I stayed in San Francisco for another day or two on my own dime elsewhere that I'd found cheaper. But I had a great experience at the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Really disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: muyb33
Reviews.Content: We were so excited to stay here after our amazing experience at the Westin in Phoenix but this hotel is nowhere near that standard. We were put in a room next to the service elevators and across from the electrical cupboard so it was extremely noisy. The fan in our bathroom wouldn't turn off. They sent someone up to fix the fan and then sent someone else up to listen to the noise and agreed to give us a new room. The new room was down the far end of the hotel and was much quieter so we got some sleep. Beds were comfortable. Internet is expensive at $15. We waited an hour for our room service breakfast (was only granola and a smoothie - not too time consuming). When we called to check on it they were rude. Would not stay here again and would not recommend it to others. Location is about all it has going for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: BEYLHR
Reviews.Content: Overall it was a great experience, room was very nice and view wasn't that bad even though it was a city view and on a floor that wasn't very high. Location is perfect for shopping, it is a 2 minute walk away from the mall and all the boutiques. Lots of options for food nearby, try the burger joint around the corner, i think it was called juicy burger, amazing burgers. The tram is right outside the hotel and it takes you straight to the wharf and the pier.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views from 34th floor, but avoid shoebox room 3422.”
Reviews.Author: GreatBlueFish
Reviews.Content: Valet service is $50+ a night, very efficient considering small driveway. Check in was smooth and friendly. Both rooms were upgraded to SPG 34th floor. One room was large with sitting area, one room so small had hard time walking from bathroom to bed without banging into TV cabinet. Dual shower heads and Heavenly bed were wonderful. Not much street noise since on 34th floor. Free coffee for Gold/Plat members in bar in morning along with newspapers. Overall good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location on Market Street”
Reviews.Author: Diegodreamer
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, probably not as nice as other Westin properties, but still good. Nice room and pleasant staff. Centrally located, with quite room. Read reviews here about overpriced parked, so we parked across the street at the Hearst parking structure for half the price. Worked out fine. Enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: efpub
Reviews.Content: We spent quite some time looking for a hotel in San Francisco that would be nice but wouldn't break the bank. While some rooms can start to get up there in price, the Westin Hotel SF Market Street delivers. While reviewing other hotels in the city (including on Trip Advisor), quite a few of the grander ones seemed to be past their prime - this hotel is in good shape. We got a free SPG gold upgrade to a room on the top floor with lots of windows to look out toward Market Street and toward the harbor (north). It's quite a ways off to things like Alcatraz and the Golden Gate bridge, but you can make them out way off in the distance, which is cool -- assuming it's not foggy! Having the fog roll in an actually be below the level of the windows, between you and the buildings even across the street was actually kind of neat as well. The neiighborhood is OK, with lots of shopping, including both regular stores along Market Street and other roads, shopping malls, plus Union Square (including Karakter, which has Tintin merchandise!). There are both upscale places to eat, some connected to the malls, plus regular places like a Quiznos right next door, a 24-hour Subway restaurant and a California Pizza Kitchen right across the street, etc. There's a cable car turnaround a short walk down Market Street, or you can also grab the F-trolley even closer, which will take you right down to Fisherman's Wharf, etc. Hotel staff was nice, and helpful. Valet parkers were nice as well. There's not a ton of room in the 'drive-under' driveway to the hotel, so valet parking made it easier. Bell staff didn't know that the gas station they pointed us to on our way to return the rental car to the airport was going to be out of gas, but we're not going to fault them for that. :-) Only downside I can think of is that the room was quite dry -- could stand some humidifcation.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best nights sleep”
Reviews.Author: MrWiz1
Reviews.Content: Normally stay at st Francis, opted for market due to availability...good move, not going back to st Francis..great corner room, great beds, great bar, buffet breakfast the usual banquet...only negative was the small gym...opted for a road run instead...central location, pleasant service.good choice

Reviews.Title: “Great combination of location, service, and amenities”
Reviews.Author: laurahuang
Reviews.Content: I generally stay at Starwood hotels and the Westin at Market street definitely lived up to my expectations. One, the location is amazing if you have meetings, get togethers, or want to do some shopping downtown. Then, the hotel offered good service, it was clean, access to a gym, and checking in and out was seamless - all for a reasonable price. I'll be staying here next time I visit San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “should have made a request”
Reviews.Author: J F
Reviews.Content: When making my online reservation I was asked if I had any requests for the hotel. (not that they would be guaranteed or granted) Because I am not REALLY picky, I didn't fill in any requests.... I thought one room would be as good as another.... I was WRONG. I was given a room right next to the elevators. ALL NIGHT LONG the sound of the elevators going up and down. Good thing I had ear plugs in my travel bag. That is the only way I got some sleep. I'll never stay at a Westin again.

Reviews.Title: “If you need reliable internet or have any other kind of special need, don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: bzz77
Reviews.Content: I have never had a good experience at a Westin hotel, but figured I'd give it another chance. Unfortunately, this stay has been no better than previous ones. When I came through San Francisco recently, I stayed at a hotel in China town (SW Hotel) that is marketed as fairly affordable. I should have gone back there! It was much cleaner, better-staffed, and the internet was much more reliable than at the Westin. On the plus side, the location is great and the bed is extremely comfortable. I stayed here because I had an online meeting with colleagues overseas and when I made the booking from overseas, I chose a hotel that I knew had internet. I specified during booking that I would need a working internet connection. When I arrived at my room, the connection didn't work (this has happened on all but one of the previous four stays I've had at the Westin). Also, it costs a considerable amount. There is no one at the hotel who can deal with internet issues, so I had to call an outside company. They couldn't fix the problem and didn't call back. Finally I was transferred to a different room. The internet did work, but the room was dirty. There were nasty stains on the wall in the bathroom, on the carpet, on the curtains. The bathroom floor hadn't been cleaned. The furniture was quite run down. These are issues I have noticed on previous stays at this hotel. I called in advance to confirm my booking (a lesson learned from previous stays at this hotel) and no one picked up the phone for two days. Sure enough, there was no record of my booking. The bottom line is that this is a hotel that skimps on staff. Overall, it took about four hours to deal with the internet and booking problems. Add another half hour to check out because reception is understaffed. The rooms are just not up to the kind of standard that one would expect for this kind of hotel. There are charges for absolutely everything. The atmosphere just isn't relaxing. I'd stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: minnekid
Reviews.Content: A Saturday/Sunday stay while visiting relatives in the bay area. Easy valet parking, easy check-in, clean, comfortable room, plenty of elevators. Great location just off Market Street. There was a nice park area with fountains in the same block. (Jessie Park?) Plenty of world class shopping and restaurants within a 3 block area. All in all a good solid performance by staff. Just what you'd expect from Westin and they didn't disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T EVER VALET your Car Here!”
Reviews.Author: Ash M
Reviews.Content: The WORST part of our experience was the valet. We were told that it was $48 to valet our car! We were handed our valet ticket and a confirmed price of $48. When we checked out the price increased to $54 due to some 25% service tax on top of that. This is very misleading. When we got into our vehicle all of the mirrors and seats (both driver and passenger) were significantly changed. Again, the passenger seat which should not have been occupied had been moved and there was women's hair in the vehicle. To our knowledge there were no women on the valet staff. We decided to look over the car and we discovered that our bumper had been SIGNIFICANTLY DAMAGED. Many DEEP SCRATCHES, GOUGES, AND MISSING PAINT. We notified the Valet Manager and he pulled out this claim ticket with the outline of a vehicle pointing out that someone had marked scratches on the bumper. We were NEVER showed this ticket prior to leaving the car with valet and we did not sign any such paperwork because it was completely FALSIFIED. My bumper DID NOT have any such scratches all over it prior to my arrival at this hotel. For a price of $54 to park my vehicle I would expect the car be returned in better condition then when we left it. This hotel is deceitful and has horrible customer service and a valet department that should be trained and held accountable for their actions instead of LYING ABOUT DAMAGING a vehicle. I hope that at the VERY LEAST they pay for the damage they caused to my car.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: jdmcdm
Reviews.Content: We were there for a business conference. We arrived late evening and there were no king beds left (which is what we had requested). They went out of their way to make up for it. Two free breakfasts, free internet, and then we were moved to a king room the net day. THis hotel is very well located, we could see Moscone center out our window, very walkable. Best of all was that all the shopping was only a few blocks away. The staff was helpful and friendly, the beds as always, so nice. My only complaint was that the pillows and blanket gave off a cheap perfume odor. I called housekeeping the second night and told them, they said they would change out all the bedding, but the next night I still smelled it. My husband's only complaint was that room service does not offer any ala mode ice cream for late night desserts. It did seem odd that they don't carry plain old vanilla ice cream.

Reviews.Title: “A Saturday Stay in SF”
Reviews.Author: Tosh12345
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night at the end of a business trip because the other hotel (Hilton Union Sq) was full for the final night. We found this hotel was excellent. The rooms were excellent big, clean and very modern, although the view was uninspiring i.e. pipes and a flat roof. We had drink in the bar, which was warm and friendly. Breakfast was good but pricey. We took the bellhop on the offer to take the house car to the airport for the same price as a taxi which was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, near Moscone West, Metreon, Yerba Buena Gardens”
Reviews.Author: JC_chgo
Reviews.Content: Stayed for business. I got a high floor south-facing room, beautiful view of the bay and city. Plenty of room, but not large- it was a corner room so the windows were at an angle to the rest of the room, making a roughly triangular shape. The desk faced the windows, how could you work staring at the beautiful view. For me, the WiFi was included, but I understand it's normally $15/day- ouch. I was attending a conference at the Moscone Center, so the walk was about 1.5 blocks, very convenient. It's half a block to Market Street's streetcars and buses. The concierge was very helpful with dinner recommendations, even very specific ones- Italian family-style places, for example. The bed was, as advertised, heavenly- and I'm picky about it. I would stay here again, I hope I get as nice a room.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Excellant Front Desk and Conciege Service”
Reviews.Author: AlisonSaskatchewan
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights in this Hotel. We were greeted by Geraldine at the Front Desk who was Very Helpful and Kind. We stayed in a Wonderful Clean Room that had floor to ceiling windows, that had a Terrific View on the City. They delivered a second fridge which was very useful. The Westin beds are Heavenly, so sleeping in the hotel was easy and quiet even though we were in the centre of the city. Each a.m. we had the Fabulous Breakfast Buffet, great healthy variety, nothing greasy, and tidy looking. Our Travels around the city were directed by Franc, the Ace Concierge. He helped us with buses, The Bart, and walking travel. He was Very Wise and Efficient. He suggested Excellant restaurants and arranged reservations. Franc had many tips about sightseeing, and he was always right as to what was worthwhile to see and do. Ask for him, and than be patient and wait, You will not regret it! The gym was clean, nice equipement with T.V.'s attached. All the hotel staff were friendly from the door men to the housekeepers. The location of this hotel was Fabulous, close to excellant shopping and restaurants. So glad we stayed here rather than the Wharf or Financial district. We always felt safe walking in the evening after dinner. This is a Great 4 star hotel and I would stay here again. I always check Trip Advisor before I stay in a hotel. Stop looking for Hotels in San Francisco, just look this one You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ishiwho1
Reviews.Content: The Westin always has the most wonderful beds. I could sleep in til noon!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Updated Hotel in the Heart of Downtown”
Reviews.Author: LittleButty
Reviews.Content: Large spacious rooms with extremely comfortable beds. Updated lobby and lounge. Very helpful staff. Walking distance to a lot of great restaurants and attractions. Exceed my expectations. Only thing I could even remotely criticize was the lack of any shampoo in my room, but hardly worth adjusting the rating. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great location, great bed”
Reviews.Author: carolandmike
Reviews.Content: This is now our "go to" place in SF. The location for shopping, food and public transportation is perfect! The bed is cozy and perfect for a great sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Westin standards”
Reviews.Author: evernon
Reviews.Content: First time visiting San Francisco. The location of the hotel is very good. It is right off of Market Street where you can easily catch a Streetcar or Bus. You are within easy walking distance to Union Square, the Trolleys and China town. I had called the hotel to see about early check in and they managed to get us a room even arriving at the hotel at 10:30am. I was impressed. When we got up to the room, the safe was locked from the previous guest. I phoned down and they said they were going to send someone up right away. 40 minutes later and two more calls and we had our safe open. We went down and used the Concierge where a very rude woman gave us a rushed set of directions that turned out to be false. We went out about our day and came back around 4pm. We quickly realized why this room was available. Every so often we would hear a loud bang right next to the room. Turns out the service elevators were right beside our room and the carts would bang loudly when coming on and off the elevator. While we were in the room, a couple moved into the room on the other side of us. There was a common door between the rooms and not only could I hear her talking on the phone, I could hear the person talking to her on the phone. I was not impressed. I complained and the hotel staff upgraded our room and gave me a free breakfast. Strange to give one breakfast when there was two of us but I was back to impressed. The upgraded room had a much better view. The old room had one floor to ceiling window but the new room had two floor to ceiling windows that were facing more of the Bay. Bed was very comfortable but the rest of the room was not up to expectations. The bath room had a dual showerhead but only one of them would stay in place. The other was too loose and could not be directed. The seat and ottoman in the room had stains on them. When checking out, I went to the business centre to print off our boarding passes. You can do that for free which was great. They didn’t print however. I called the tech support number and they said I needed to talk to the Concierge. When I called the lobby, they also told me I needed to get the Concierge to print off the passes because the hotel actually doesn’t own the business centre and they aren’t allowed to touch them. Wha?!?! Went down and talked to the same rude Concierge and got them printed but it seemed like it was a pain for her. Overall, it wasn’t the worst experience or hotel that I have stayed in but for the money and because it was the Westin brand, I expected more. Its great when the staff will make up for shortcomings but a hotel like the Westin should do better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: newkindofsoup
Reviews.Content: Great location, good views from the upper floors and terrific staff. One complaint was that to pay $15.00 for internet in this day and age is ridiculous (and it was flaky at that).

Reviews.Title: “Close to where I wanted to be”
Reviews.Author: Pinky23_10
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was great. It was (at least for a walker like me) close to The Embarcardero where I like to spend a lot of time when in San Francisco. There was no pool which is a disappointment, especially since the weather was great that time. The view was pretty good from the 17th floor and I was able to see the bay and the lights from A.T. & T. Stadium at night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, clean rooms, great service*, amazing beds”
Reviews.Author: BigRedBears
Reviews.Content: My parents (for business) and I (for fun) stayed at Westin San Francisco Market Street for 4 nights at the end of October. The reservation was in my name, but my flight was getting in after my parents, so I was a little worried about issues with checking in and room upgrade (gold status with SPG). I shouldn't have as the check in process was smooth and upgrade was offered without having to request it. Hotel is close to SFO airport. It took me 55 minutes sharp plane door to hotel room door by taking BART (there is a station within a block from hotel) and 25-30 minutes by cab ($40-50). The room was nice, clean, and spacious (though a bit outdated) and perfectly suitable for business trip. The . Because of the upgrade it was located on a high floor reserved for SPG members and had a beautiful view of downtown SF with the bay and Alcatraz in the background. Beds were amazing and very comfortable to sleep in. There is a gym, which has all the necessary equipment, but it's nothing to write home about. However, Westin partnered up with Four Seasons to provide daily gym passes ($27/day). FS gym description looked awesome. There were several small annoyances, but the management fixed them all (some sooner, some later). 1) TV. Sound worked fine, but there was no video. We complained several times, and hotel promised to send an engineer to fix the problem, but he never showed up. Manager was apologetic about the problem and offered 2500 SPG points as compensation. 2) Internet fee ($15/day). Is it really necessary to charge $15/day internet fee in this day and age? I complained and the charge disappeared from the final bill. YMMV. 3) Aggressive maids. I think they started banging on the door each morning at 8am. As I mentioned before, all the issues were solved (I wonder if Gold SPG status mattered?) and I received several emails from different managers making sure everything was OK. Do choose this hotel for it's amazing location and high quality service. That said, Palace Hotel, which is next door (also part of Starwood network, but under Luxury Collection brand), offers rooms for the same price as Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: kmadams
Reviews.Content: I am a fan of the Westin brand; but this hotel wasn't quite all I expected. I booked on Priceline, and when I checked-in learned that they always request handicap-accessible rooms. The front desk upgraded me to a higher room with a better view; but left me in the handicap accessible room (despite me asking if that should be reserved for someone who needed those features). The room itself was quite small; hardly any walking room on the other side of the bed. The closet was too short to hang my pants and dresses without them dragging on the floor. Since the shower did not have a tub, the bathroom floor flooded with each shower. The staff was very friendly, from the front desk, concierge, and housekeeping staff. The room was also very clean. I got a dessert to go at the restaurant (Dulca? I don't remember the name). I was allowed to take the plate and utensils, as they "don't package desserts to go). It was not very good, and as all hotel restaurants tend to be, expensive. The tv channels were limited. I got 3 different ESPNs, but no MTV (though there was a channel with Girls Gone Wild footage...). There was a fee for wi-fi, which I find to be ridiculous for a $200+ a night room. The bed and bedding was marvelous, as Westin promises. The location was nice; with easy access to Bart/Muni/Cable cars stops. I loved the city and will return; though I may not stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Sra2001
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights--best thing was the location for easy access to city transportation. Easy and convenient to take the BART from San Francisco Airport to the nearby station on Montgomery St.—takes about 30 minutes and costs $8.10. Station for BART and MUNI is about 2 blocks away--as is the Visitor's Center and the turnaround for two of the cable car lines. The F Streetcar runs in front of the hotel, and you can take it to Fisherman's Wharf area. Best deal is to buy a MUNI pass--good for all MUNI trains, busses, and cable cars. Moscone Center and Yerba Buena Gardens are near nearby. The bed and pillows were great. Although there was what appeared to be a permanent yellow stain in the bathtub, everything was very clean and the maid was great! Staff was very friendly and helpful, except for concierge who was no help at all. We asked for a mini fridge because the one in the room is fully stocked with expensive drinks, liquor, etc.—no room to put your own things. There is also a tray stocked with extremely expensive snacks which are charged to your bill 10 seconds after you pick one up—just don’t touch!! Charge for Wi-Fi-$15 a day!

Reviews.Title: “Comfy bed, good location”
Reviews.Author: Lyn J
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Sept. 2011 when we visited SF to attend Hardly Strictly Bluegrass in Golden Gate park. This hotel is located in the Downtown/Financial district. Lots of restaurants, shopping, art and culture nearby. Valet is speedy, check-in quick and efficient, bar and restaurant on-property. Our room was on the 11th floor and had great views of the City. The staff was friendly and helpful. Buffet brunch is served on Sundays, but you can order off the menu, too. Close to public transit (BART and buses), and taxis are waiting to take you to your destination. It's best to valet your car and take advantage of other transportation in SF since street parking is very difficult to find, and parking lots are pricy... and parking tickets even more expensive. I would recommend this place to family and friends. Also, it's close to Moscone Center for business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Union Square Headquarters”
Reviews.Author: reddog322
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for a getaway to SanFrancisco. Although there are a few things that I would improve about the St Francis, like the lobby bar (I still miss the compass rose) but overall I think this hotel has the best location for Christmas shopping and taking in the pleasures of Union Square. My favorite thing to do is to squeeze into the bar at lefty odoul's which is right across the street, order a Manhattan and watch a ball game. A friendly bar in the middle of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown SF for an affordable price”
Reviews.Author: TDBOS
Reviews.Content: Downtown area for much less than others and well worth the price per room. Room was large and comfy - hotel is located right downtown and within minutes to everything. Street trolleys and BART station are within a short walk as as shops and restaurants and Chinatown. Large bar and restaurant on site with outside patio area for dining in nicer weather. Front desk and Concierge was very helpful in recommending places to see and where to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel on Market Street”
Reviews.Author: Ploosh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin San Francisco Market Street a few days ago and enjoyed great views of the city, great service, and a good night's sleeep. This may very well be one of my favorite Westins. Therooms are clean and look new; there are great views from the rooms on the higher floors; the lobby is very nice; great central location. We had breakfast in the room and the eggs Benedict were terrific! You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Not at par for the Westin Brand”
Reviews.Author: Desi_traveler_77
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Westin on Market for 5 nights for a conference, being held the Moscone Center. Let me start by saying the first lady we encountered at the front desk was extremely friendly and did her best to make us feel as welcome as possible. She even gave us 2 vouchers for breakfast the next morning. It basically goes downhill from there. The first night we were in a corner room. Extremely small room shaped like a V, with an even smaller bathroom. Although be view was ok, definitely not worth it on the lower floors. The next day they moved us to a Starwood preferred guest floor with a king size bed. The room was a little roomier, with a desk, and 42" LCD TV. The bathroom was a normal size, but no big by any stretch. The room seemed very dated, like it hasn't been renovated in about 15years. The bathroom much the same, not what I expect from a Westin charging upwards of over $300. The sad part is they only gave 2 towels, and 1 piece of soap, again not what I expect for $300 a night. The other things that I find sad is that such an expensive hotel really rapes you when it comes to parking and internet. Internet is about $15/day, and parking is nearly $50 a day, more expensive than the rental car itself. If you are smart, you will park in the parking garage across the street where the parking is $21/day. Using the 1 complimentary breakfast voucher we got, I did enjoy the breakfast buffet at Ducca. The buffet is huge with a large assortment of food and drinks. The other nice thing about the hotel is it is center to all the downtown activities. Moscone center is only 2 blocks away. There is a great breakfast place call The Grove, across the street. There are a multitude of restaurants in the surrounding area. Overall, will likely not stay here again when in SF. If it was $100-150, it would be acceptable. Westin in my mind holds a higher standard, and this hotel does not fulfill that.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Westin Market Street”
Reviews.Author: DFHS
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel several times and just had the pleasure of staying Oct. 18th-20th. The room was really nice and as always, had the floor to ceiling windows. I was on the 21st floor in a double room. The room and bathroom were quite large and the bed was wonderful. The staff was exceptionally friendly, down to the the cleaning lady on my floor. I had trouble with my room key and she kindly came over and helped. When I was leaving the room for the last time with my luggage she was down the hall. As I turned the corner I heard her call out a greeting to me. The checkin was very pleasant, the valets were happy and friendly. We had great service in the bar and lobby area. I love this place!

Reviews.Title: “Great location just don't count on the concierge”
Reviews.Author: chowdog65
Reviews.Content: Great beds and fabulous location with Bart nearby. Rooms were comfy and had a great view on the 19th floor. The downside was the concierge service. Although their food picks were often decent they were just incompetent at directions and most other types of information. Each time they gave us directions they were not only wrong but seriously underestimated walking times by a factor of 2 or even 3. They sold these poor fellow conference attendees hop on hop off bus tickets and told them the last bus was at 6Pm when in fact it was 5pm. Concierge service is supposed to be the top service source for a hotel and they were basically incompetent. Nice hotel, avoid the concierge service at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room, great location.”
Reviews.Author: ExistenceNow
Reviews.Content: The wife and I stayed here on October 21. Hotel lobby is beautiful and staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The room, however, was absolutely tiny. It's pretty much a bed and four walls, with no floor space to spare. The website advertises great views with floor to ceiling windows, but obviously not all rooms have this feature. Our room had two small dingy windows that looked out on the side of a building (5th floor). Bathroom tub wouldn't hold water for a bath. Very clean though, which is always nice. The location is amazing, but overall, for the price I payed, I think my money would be better spent elsewhere in the area that would have had the same location benefits.

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel”
Reviews.Author: igetfuzzy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week for a conference that was being held at the Westin. I have no complaints; the view was very nice, room was spacious, good maid service, comfortable bed, and very clean. I did not have a problem with the staff but then again I did not really need anything from them. The hotel is in a central location, too. I would recommend it for sightseeing as it's right on Market street and super close to lots of food and shopping. About a 20 minute straight shot walk takes you to the Embarcadero.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for sight seeing”
Reviews.Author: IwanBanens
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Westin Market Street this summer. Easy location to see all of the city. Bus stops around the corner, so you can easily travel anywhere in town. We had a great deal to stay here via priceline.com. The hotel is rather expensive for breakfast but you can enjoy that around the corner in several small café's

Reviews.Title: “Poor service in a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: jd3000
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Westin Market Street. A week before arriving, I contacted Westin Market Street's reservation coordinator and confirmed a king room for my wife and I. The reservation coordinator was very friendly in the emails, and I assumed everything would be fine. Upon arrival, we were checked in and assured it was a king room, and we left our bags in the room without inspecting it as we were in a rush. That evening, I realised that it was a handicapped-access room with a single queen bed. I called up front desk, and they said, yes, we were checked into a single queen room, and no king rooms were available for us. So, fine, we squeezed for one night. We requested to shift to a king room the second night, but only by quoting the name of the reservation coordinator was front desk willing to shift us to a king room. No apology was made as to the mistake with the reservation, nor any service recovery attempted. While I do understand mistakes happen, and hotels do get overbooked, the least I expect is an explanation, smile and apology. None of that was recieved. On a side note, the toilet in the king room was tiny. The door barely misses the water closet on closing. The bed was great, though. Also, the concierge came across as arrogant as well when asked for commuting advice. Expensive wifi and parking charges is another minus. The hotel was otherwise great, with nicely furnished rooms in a good location, but the poor service and snobbish attitude of the frontline staff was unacceptable. A huge pity, as it could have been an excellent stay otherwise. I booked my stay through travelocity, and I suspect thats why we received such poor treatment. I normally stick with Marriott as thats where my membership status is, and after this stay at the Westin, I'm not switching to Starwood.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean rooms and comfortable beds, no Internet and average service”
Reviews.Author: Kittywhite22
Reviews.Content: Location of this hotel is great - close to muni trams, muni buses, BART station, 5 min walk to westfield mall, union square, and cable car station. Beds are comfortable and clean. The ergonomic work chair was really good and didn't give me any back pain. Our bathtub clogged a bit though but we didn't bother getting them to fix it because we were here for 3 nights only. Front desk not accommodating when asked for higher floors as well as late check-out. Concierge didn't know where the elevator is for the BART station - it was really hard carrying the luggage going down the stairs to the station. Great gym area! No pool at hotel. No Internet in room unless you pay $15 a day. No wifi as well in the lobby :( We bought a flight + hotel package for our San Fran trip. I wouldn't pay regular price to stay at this hotel for an average level of service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Location”
Reviews.Author: Antiblackberry
Reviews.Content: Good standard Westin / Starwood, no complaints. Two minutes from Bart (Montgomery), 25 minutes direct from the International Airport and very convenient for sightseeing / shopping. Good selection of restaurants and bars close by. Perhaps biggest surprise was the number of down-and-outs hanging around the general area. No hassle but something to be generally aware of as a tourist exploring the streets.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: dougie-w
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Westin Market Street, and it offered everything we expected: a nice room with comfortable bedding and a convenient location close to either the Montgomery or Powell BART/Muni stations and just a short walk to the Union Square shopping area. We booked this hotel through the Travelocity Top Secret Hotels opaque booking system and got a good rate for a busy weekend: $183 per night, vs. $290 a night on the hotel's own website. The hotel had a decent fitness center, we liked the free newspapers in the lobby and were impressed with the abundance of speedy elevators. Never a wait! The only negative was the $15/day charge for Internet. I hate that high-end hotels enjoy gouging guests this way.

Reviews.Title: “Classic business hotel - good location”
Reviews.Author: the_oslo_gooner
Reviews.Content: Classic, large and modern business hotel. Lacks charm and feels a bit "cold", but contemporary elegant nevertheless. We had a nice and spacious room with floor to ceiling window. Clean and fresh! Breakfast is very good, but way overpriced. Better opt for one of the cafees around the corner. No free wifi is a bummer, and not very 2011. The only hotel (out of five) during our travel in the States charging for wifi. Location is good; several resaturants (for all tastes) within walking distance. Subway, bus stop really nearby. Ample shopping as well. We booked our stay thourg one of the "secret hotel websites", where the hotel name is only revealed upon payment. Our rate was really good, and service from hotel staff good and professional as well.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is great, parking non-existent, staff unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: Damir S
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 days in September. The check-in person Chris (I think that was his name) was very condescending and snobby during the check-in process. After he checked us in and handed us our room keys I told him that he might want to treat the next guest with little more smile and less condescending attitude. Rooms were great as you might expect from the Westin. The only parking available at the hotel itself is valet @ $55/day. Hotel staff might direct you to the parking garage behind the hotel. Do not use this as there is no way to get back up unless you take the stairs (which if you have any suitcases will be difficult). There is a parking across the street at Office Depot/California Pizza Kitchen building for $23/day which is the same as the parking behind the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre rooms but great service”
Reviews.Author: VancouverTheHair
Reviews.Content: We generally stay at Kimpton hotels when in San Francisco, but we decided on the Westin Market this trip based on a triple Starwood points promotion. Highlights: -The staff is wonderful and it was very obvious that great service is something that every employee we interacted with from check in, to the concierges, to housekeeping, to the wait staff in the restaurant, takes great pride in. -The bar lounge area is very nice and the outdoor patio area is lovely - great place to grab a drink -The location is great - many fabulous restaurants (be sure to get recommendations from the concierges - they nailed it every time), great shopping, etc are all steps from your door -As always with Starwood properties, the Heavenly Beds deliver a great night's sleep. Lowlights: -Our room was very incredibly small (not the lowest room class). If I was travelling solo on business it would be less of an issue, but my husband and I were basically climbing over each other -The bathrooms are also tiny and in need of a renovation/update - low ceilings, peeling grout, etc. Net/net: If I'm traveling solo, the small, dated rooms would certainly be outweighed by the great staff and service, but when travelling as a couple, well probably be looking at our old reliable Kimptons that offer a bit more space.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Market Street -- a whole bunch of little things irked me”
Reviews.Author: errant
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel more times than I care to count for both business and pleasure. While I may have to stay there again on business, it will never get my hard-earned money for a vacation stay ever again. While I like the location -- and it's very handy for the Moscone Centre -- it is bland and boring. The rooms are corporate and soulless. The toiletries are uninspired -- in fact, I dislike them so much I bring my own. The towels are threadbare. There was only one robe. When we called for a second one, the guy who delivered it reeked of cigarette smoke. There were dark foot prints in the tub -- I think this was an actual stain, not just a bad cleaning job. While the bed is quite comfortable and the shower not too bad, I don't enjoy staying in this hotel. This time around the concierges were this short of surly to everybody (except for one guy who steered me to a wonderful place to get a pedicure). And Jackie the bartender is very pleasant. The front door guys are really nice and seem to know their city and its restaurants. Better than the concierges! Front desk? Not helpful. We had stayed two nights, gone to another city, and then came back for another two nights. We had asked for a specific room. They ensured us it would be no problem. Well, guess what? It wasn't available because somebody checked out late and they hadn't cleaned it yet. We were checking in at 8 p.m! Frustrating, indeed. Oh, and did I mention there was no wireless for two days? In San Francisco? An hour away from the Silicon Valley? And then when it was available (spotty service) it costs $15 a day. Meh. And $50 for valet parking is an outrage, especially when it's slow.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not worth 400/night”
Reviews.Author: rami h
Reviews.Content: Nice and friendly staff but here's how my experience was starting from last night's late check-in: 1- Staff watched idly as I pulled two suitcases, a laptop case and a tote in front of them towards the elevator 2- We had called earlier that day and confirmed a king size bed only to be given a two doubles 3- They were kind enough to switch our room the next day so that's a plus and they did it very courteously 4- House Keeping barged into my room three times with less than two seconds between their knock and their door opening 5- NO ROOM SERVICE FOR LUNCH!! They do not even send up a light sandwich for you. So if for any reason you're working out of your room for the day, or simply chilling out you'll be doing it while starving! 6- Internet $15/day, no complementary breakfast, no newspapers in the morning at the door, and expensive valet parking!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient business hotel”
Reviews.Author: alank1101
Reviews.Content: This Westin is conveniently located close to the Moscone Convention Center, Take the BART in from the airport, get off at the Montgomery Street Station. Its a short walk to 3rd street on Market. Hotel is about a half a block down 3rd St. from Market Street. Rooms are modern, floor to ceiling windows.The view was excellent. Was here for a convention. Coffee maker avail in room. As a premier member, you may get an upgrade to a corner room, but that's about it. No club lounge, no available free computer to use. It does have free Wi-Fi and bottled water for premier guests. Heavenly bed I had was worn and lumpy. Time to replace the mattresses or at least turn them. Front door personnel were very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Love those Westins”
Reviews.Author: Suruns
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I always love staying at Westin Hotels. The beds are amazing! We had a beautiful corner room and 10th floor and could see all over the city. The room was clean and very stylish. The staff were over the top helpful and planned our whole stay, where to eat and attractions to visit. They have Happy hour at the bar or sit outside that was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Good location!”
Reviews.Author: nevtraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August 2009 - it was a lovely hotel in a great location, everything was in excellent order and the complementary drinks on the lobby were fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at The Westin Market Street”
Reviews.Author: dwaterman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on our recent trip to San Fran and loved our room and location. First the bad: We got there at 12 noon for an early check in and was offered an upgrade for $20 per night. I thought this was okay considering it would be a nicer room. Went to the 32nd floor and was left unimpressed. When I went downstairs to tell the hotel we were not interested and would take a regular room, the attitude changed immediately and we were told there were no rooms available until 3pm and to come back then. So, the attitude sucked but did not dampen my spirits as I was not going to be in the room anyway. So, on we went and left our bags at the hotel. The good: When we came back we were greeted warmly and had a different person check us in. She immediatley upgraded us from a 4th floor to 25th floor room with a city view. No charge either! View was amazing. Huge windows and view of the Bay Bridge and City view to the water. The room was very standard for a Westin but was clean, and very big. Those that say the rooms were small must not have stayed in many San Fran Hotels before. This was large for San Fran standards. Great bathroom and amenities, free water daily, and a great experience overall. Concierge was helpful when needed and the bar actually poured a stiff drink, Also a perfect location to hit up anywhere you want to go. Would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: emmaxoxo
Reviews.Content: Booked on short notice, actually on the day and checked in with an hour or so after booking, stayed 4 nights. Wasn’t expecting a room to be ready for us, but was when checking in at around noon. Check in lady was very friendly and gave us a room on the 32nd floor for great views. Though our room was right next door to the lifts which she first checked with us was OK, and that we weren’t light sleepers, which we weren’t, so accepted. You could hear the lifts from the room, it just sounded like high winds and didn’t affected our stay. Room was great, no issues. Wi-fi was terrible though, and $14.95 a day, which we got refunded, no questions asked. Hotel was great location, not too far from Union Square, F line and cable cars. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly as it should be”
Reviews.Author: slothlover
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the Dreamforce conference which was perfectly located across the street from the convention complex. Service and attention to detail was flawless. My room was well organized and the right size for a week stay. It was also very quiet. My only two issues were that my alarm clock didn't go off the second night and I didn't know why (still don't) and I was charged two different prices for the same bottle of OJ that I picked up in the lobby sundries store. Neither of those issues kept me from giving this hotel a high rating. The food in Ducca's is excellent as well and they even changed the channel at the bar to the sports station I wanted - they asked to do this, it was not prompted by me. I'd stay there again in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Just GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: petraleon
Reviews.Content: We are a couple at mid 30s that stayed for 8 days during August. We had a room at 23rd floor overlooking Feamy street. We spent little time at the hotel and we basically chose it for the location and the good rate. PLUS - Excellent location. We walked around the biggest part of the city and I assure you that it's the most convenient location that a tourist can find. - Wonderful view from the room looking at Feamy street all the way up to telegraph Hill. The rooms at the back have also a very nice view. Windows are from floor to ceiling which is really great. - Everything seems bran new and spotlessly clean. - Complimentary coffee and tea everyday. Nice coffee maker. - iphone dock with radio and clock. - Nice selection of TV channels. - Great and huge shower. - Reception and concierge is professional and efficient. - Opposite to a Starbucks and a 24-hour Subway sandwiches in case you need it. - Didn't have a drink at the bar but it seemed really nice and lively. - Last but not least. They upgraded our room without even telling us. NEUTRAL - Room size is a little bit on the small size. - Didn't visit the restaurant but the vegetable soup I ordered to the room was not what I expected. MINUS - The bed was comfortable but very small. - There is no pool. - Expensive wi-fi. To sum up. The hotel is more than I expected and I recommend it without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel well located in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: ORMSDT
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nicely located to enjoy what San Francisco has to offer and easy access to public transportation. The hotel itself was very nice with great beds and well sized rooms. The staff was very friendly and accommidating although we did request a two bed room but they only had singles. They did provide a roll away but still dissapointing. We did use the valet to keep our car overnight. Very expensive but they did a great job of getting it quickly when needed.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: AliO_11
Reviews.Content: I was not impressed. I had high expectations from Westin but i got a bit disappointed. I'll start with the good things: The hotel is got a very good location, close to the touristy attractions, rooms are small but clean and confortable and they have a great view. Cons: Super noizy, the walls are paper thin, you can hear everything happening on the coridor, every single door that is being opened or closed. Parking?? OMG - it is $50 for valet parking which i thought it was too much. We tried to use our SPG points to upgrade and include parking but we were told that the valet parking company it is a stand alone not belonging to the Hotel ?!?! There is parking exactly behind the hotel for $25 for 24hrs but it is closed after 11pm. Alternatively you can park at the garage on 5TH street and the's opened 24hrs and it costs $32. For internet connection (if you don't want to pay the hotel rate) you can walk to Starbucks that right across the road and it's free. Next time in SFO, we'll surely stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Great room Great View”
Reviews.Author: rockobello
Reviews.Content: this hotel was top notch and I got it for a decent deal via a mystery hotel site. The view of the city was magnificent and the hotel was clean. They charge for internet but I managed to tap into some free router nearby... :-). Loved the location and proximity to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: gt8059a
Reviews.Content: Good location to walk to sights. 5-10 minute walk to Union Square and only a few blocks to the cable car turn-around. Rooms are small, but clean. Concierge and bellman are very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marianne4
Reviews.Content: Wonderful. Great hotel, great staff, great location, Clean fresh: perfect. Elegant and great buffet. Near the MOMA, great for shopping,

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: TahitiZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin for three nights and were joined by some friends. Check-in was quick. We received rooms on the 23rd floor. The rooms at this Westin are a bit small but very clean. Bottled water and coffee was provided daily. The bed is very comfortable as in all Westin hotels. They have an outdoor patio for happy hour and a great fire pit. The wait staff on the patio was very friendly and the service was oustanding. The only downside to this outdoor seating is the amount of homeless people that continually arrive at your table. This Westin is in a great location of San Francisco, near the cable car turnaround and a short walk to Chinatown and North Beach. The concierge was especially helpful and knowledgeable about the City. When we visit San Francisco again, we will check into the Westin Market Street.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Westin -- no more, no less”
Reviews.Author: TravelinNic
Reviews.Content: This is a very standard Westin, so you'll get what you expect from a Westin when it comes to the comfy bed, great shower and bathing products, and other standard room amenities. You'll also get that feeling of a large corporate hotel with no particular soul. Guest room styling is accurately represented on the hotel's website, though some room features were a bit worn (oye, why equip hotel rooms with white-fabric armchairs unless you can commit to keeping them clean?) and the iPod docking station had a broken button. If a room with a view is important to you, you'll appreciate that this hotel building is triangle-shaped, so nearly every room faces out to a part of the city. (Many rooms at even the nicer San Francisco hotels face inward toward other rooms or a secondary roof with duct work, for example.) Front-desk staff were friendly and efficient; when a longer check-in line formed, a manager noticed and offered us water while we waited the few extra minutes. Bar staff were disinterested and did the minimum. When staying in San Francisco, this Yerba Buena Gardens/slightly South of Market area is one of the two best areas in which to be based (the other is Union Square/Nob Hill)... but note that several outstanding hotels exist on the same turf. Go ahead and stay at this Westin when you can get a good rate or just want to rely on the Westin-level standard for your trip. Don't go here for big romance or a San Francisco-specific feel.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we thought it would be, well almost...”
Reviews.Author: danieljchapin
Reviews.Content: My wife was attending a conference in San Francisco so I tagged along to see the sights. We stayed there for seven nights, which proved to be long enough. the good points: The beds are VERY comfortable. That is one of the big reasons we stayed there, we knew we would be there for a week and did not want to get stuck sleeping on a crappy bed. We have a tempurpedic mattress at home and the "Heavenly" bed at the Westin was excellent. It is in a very location if you want to see San Francisco. it is on a Third St., a stones throw from Market St., the buses and streetcars, and a short walk from the BART and the Powell and Hyde cable car turn around. It is a short walk to the other attractions in that area, Chinatown and Union Square, the MOMA and many others. The Staff was over all very helpful and professional. We called guest services to request a refrigerator for our room, and it was delivered to our room in less then ten minutes. The room was very clean and we found there to be plenty of room for two people for a week. The floor to ceiling window did give a very cool view out into the city. Now the not so good: It is in the heart of the city, good if you want to have easy access to things, not so good if you need some quiet. The room is not sound proofed so you can hear the street and it's busy all night. We could not get the internet to work. It worked everywhere else in the city, just not in the hotel. The WIFI would not let us connect and the hardline network cable would not either. Their internet and entertainment is managed by Lodgenet (they are used widely in the Hotel industry) and we called their help desk to try to resolve this issue. The person we spoke to could not help, so our ticket was escalated to a tier 2 representative and we were told that we would receive a call back shortly.....it never came. We waited for two days and our call was never returned. We called back and got no where. I went to the front desk and tried to get someone who could help and they told me that the IT person is not in the weekend. So I got nowhere with this problem. All this and they charge you 15 dollars a day for the service. (we did not connect, so we did not have to pay) It would seem that like a minor problem if it were not for three factors: My wife and I were going to be stranded there for five days due to Hurricane Irene having disrupted so many flights including ours to Boston, and my wife needed to work remotely the following week. I had an online class that I had to attend on the following Monday. The Westin is a business hotel, they should not have these kind of issues. Over all it was a good experience though, and I would recommend it if your looking for a centrally located hotel, downtown but away from the Union Square area.

Reviews.Title: “Loved room and service but bathroom was tiny”
Reviews.Author: cindyseattle
Reviews.Content: We arrived here on a Friday night around 7:30. We took the BART from the airport, got off at Powell Street and walked 2 blocks to the hotel. Check-in was quick. We got a corner room with lots of windows. Bed was super comfy and nice big flat screen TV. Only complaint about the room was the bathroom was tiny and shower/tub in our room creeked while taking a shower if you moved. All employees pleasant and helpful. About a 7-10 minute walk to the Cable Car turnaround near Union Square. Would recommend as there is a Quiznos, Starbucks and California Pizza Kitchen all within 1 minute of the Hotel and/or across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven Beds and Prime Location!”
Reviews.Author: JanzenG
Reviews.Content: My friend and I are in our twenties and this hotel was more then we expected. Our 17th floor view was spectacular. The rooms were modern and very clean. We referred to the beds as "Heaven Beds" as they were so cozy. The hotel is in a central location for access to the whole city. We felt if we had stayed right in Fisherman's Wharf we would have been so far from the many other places in the city we wanted to visit. We were very impressed and we will be recommending this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location with Excellent Views”
Reviews.Author: ItsAboutTheTravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very conveniently located especially if you are using Moscone Center. The rooms are large and well kept. The windows are from floor to ceiling offering a great view of San Francisco on the higher floors. The only complaint I have is my room was next to the service entrance so there was a lot of noise when carts were being moved in and out. Close quick restaurants near by if you need to grab a quick bite....California Pizza Kitchen directly across the street. The grove which is down a block is also an excellent restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Mallory M
Reviews.Content: We recently had the pleasure of a short stay in SF. No car hassles this trip! We took Light Rail transit ( a couple of blocks from our house) to Amtrak and caught the train to Jack London Square in Oakland. The train stop is a few blocks from the ferry landing so we hopped on the ferry over to San Francisco and got off at the Ferry Building. So easy and so much fun!! We just walked up the street to our hotel. We had purchased a night at a “4 star mystery hotel” on Bookit.com which ended being the Westin on Market. Great hotel at a sweet rate! Each room has a floor to ceiling window so you can watch what’s happening on the streets below. Our room was on the 11th floor so we had a nice view of the area and could even see the Bay Bridge. The hotel service was great, we were able to check in early thanks to Jeffrey and drop off our bags before heading up to the Orpheum Theatre (5 blocks further up Market) to catch a matinee of“Billy Elliot”. Fun weekend! I would absolutely stay at the Westin again and have already booked another stay:)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location -- very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: rbdiaz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for five nights during family SF vacation. Had two adjoining rooms for a family of five. Very spacious and comfortable. A bit annoying that maid service came every morning right around 8 am (a bit early), but that was the only negative. Location is perfect for getting easy access to mass transit for moving around city. Expensive, but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel for all”
Reviews.Author: swtravelmom
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to San Francisco and we were very impressed with the accomodations and service at the Westin Market Street hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room had two comfortable queen beds - perfect for two adults and two teens. The location was great for all the tourist activities around San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: schistosomiasis
Reviews.Content: Stayed here and got put on SPG floor with nice view. Room very clean, beds comfortable. Good location near Chinatown, shops, restaurants. Was in town for phillies vs giants game, it is about a 20 minute walk to AT&T park. Elevators fast for such a big hotel. Reading other reviews while staff was not rude to me, service is a bit impersonal given such a big hotel. Rooms were bigger than I expected. Could have stayed at the w hotel across street for $25 more (had fantastic experience there a few years ago), would still prefer the w truthfully as it is more hip/ modern but this westin is very nice, would come here again. Took BART from airport to Montgomery and walked here, but beware if you have a car as valet expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not Westin quality I have come to expect”
Reviews.Author: Seasoned_CndTraveler
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Westin Market Street for a week with my mom. It is in a pretty good location to the downtown amenities and to the transportation system. Unfortunately that is really the only thing I really liked about the hotel. I found the staff to be very rude and not willing to help. The concierge didn't give proper directions (which in turn sent us on a bit of a wild goose chase to our destination), and did not really want to look up the answers to some other questions I had. The valet and greeting staff were gruff and brushed us off when we asked for a recommendation for a quick bite to eat in the area. They never said good morning or went out of their way to be friendly. From staying at other Westins I know this isn't usually the case. As well, the men at the baggage counter were rude to my mom when she asked a quick question about the Giants. Granted they may not be Giants fans but hey, at least be a little more polite to your customers. The staff in Ducca were no better. It took 15 minutes for us to be asked what we would like to drink on our first night at the lounge. Against our better judgement, we went back to the restaurant for breakfast a few mornings later. The service was terrible, we ended up pouring our own coffee refills because we weren't given a carafe like the other tables (not sure why when they also ordered the same things we did) and the server never came to check on us. The carafe finally came when we were ready to pay our bill. The breakfast in Ducca was extremely disappointing. We chose the buffet and a lot of the food was cold, a day old or just not good (the eggs were powdered). As well, the appetizer plate we ordered at the bar was not complete (it only had about 3/4 of the items on it that were indicated on the menu). Internet cost $14.95 a day. We bought it one day, but the connection was horrible; we kept getting kicked off the system. We were also told that we could print our boarding passes for free in the business center. When we tried to however, the computer didn't recognize our airline so we had to pay to print them. When we mentioned it to the concierge, she nonchalantly told us she could have done it for us, but too bad we didn't ask. Our room was ok, but not what I expect from the Westin. There were lots of hand prints on the window, an odd big blue spot on the ceiling (it looked like shower gel or something had exploded) and a blood spot on one of the bed skirts. It was tidy but not overly clean. You could tell the floor hadn't been vacuumed under the beds or in the corners in a while. Unfortunately I wouldn't stay here again, especially for the price. I have come to expect a much higher quality from the Westin and will be thinking twice before I book with this hotel chain again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Anniversary Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: gmdalberta
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our 34th anniversary at the Westin Market Street. We booked our getaway based on recommendations from Trip Advisor and were very pleased with the result. Very central to cable cars, sightseeing and shopping. Excellent restaurants in close proximity. Very well appointed room, very quiet and comfortable. Valet parking was in line with other large US city hotel charges and very prompt. The concierge at the desk, Kim, was extremely knowledgeable about San Francisco and had extensive knowledge about a number of restaurants in the city. We had a problem with a cleaning issue with our room, but as soon as it was brought to the attention of the housekeeping manager, Susan, it was very promptly corrected. The breakfast buffet was very good and service was excellent. We very much enjoyed our stay and would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: laura11217
Reviews.Content: A quiet hotel in the middle of a very busy area. Close to great shopping and the ballpark, as well as many transportation options. You will get a very good night's sleep here.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: amylee87
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the center of San Fran. Watch out though, there are several other westins around. A bit confusing. Easy access to the city. Nice rooms and service.

Reviews.Title: “Located centrally”
Reviews.Author: dshotts
Reviews.Content: I used points to stay here so I am unaware of the cost but thought the room was nice, it was clean and comfortable. Everytime we stepped out the door they asked us if we needed directions to where we were going for the day. The outside employees were very knowledgable. Sat out back in the evening near fire pit and heating lamps for a comfortable relaxing evening.

Reviews.Title: “99% Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: otter77
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here just last week on a business trip for my company and we were delighted by almost everything on the property. Every single member of hotel staff were friendly, helpful and easy to communicate with. The rooms were quiet - the sound proofing work that has been done in this property is very high quality. Unlike any other hotel I've ever stayed-in, we couldn't hear anything other than ourselves the entire stay. The bed was comparable in comfort to my sleep number bed (an extreme rarity!). The room was beautiful, in perfect repair and spotlessly clean - albeit a little small (but this is expected in prime real estate areas like downtown SFO!). The location is incredible. The fitness area is not to be underrated... it's a rare treat to get a fitness area that's well equipped with free weights and circuit machines... all of which are in good working order and clean! Most hotel fitness areas just have a few bicycles and treadmills, this one had elliptical trainers, stair climbers and much more! I could probably ramble for a while longer about how much I enjoyed this property. Lacking was a pool of any kind and the hotel food wasn't the very best I've ever had but was certainly "good enough". Great job Westin SF Market Street! Thank you for an awesome stay.

Reviews.Title: “Too much out for your buck, will never visit Westin again”
Reviews.Author: WiebeWiersema
Reviews.Content: Having travelled across 5 states this is the first hotel that we encountered that charged 15 dollars for internet and even had the guts to ask 7 dollars for printing my boarding tickets. This paired with the parking fee of 50 bucks a day gives me a feeling that the Financial manager of this hotel is grabbing for dollars. Penny wise, dollar foolish in my honest opinion. The room was fine, the staff very friendly and accomodating, it's only the feeling that I am on fishermens warf where you know you will be ripped off. Did not expect this feeling to extend to the hotel I am staying in.

Reviews.Title: “Poor start but did improve....................a lot!!”
Reviews.Author: Dominic37
Reviews.Content: On the first night we arrived tired. Initially, we were told that we had booked a King Sized bed room but we hadn't! We were then told that they did actually have a Double Queen room available. Having been assigned our room, we pretty much retired for the evening. However, I was concerned that we had booked...................months in advance...................a Double Queen Grand Deluxe room which was supposed to come with a good view. In the morning, I questioned whether we had been allocated the correct room as we did not have a great view that we had been expecting. We were told that, indeed, we were not in the room that we had booked and that they would move us later in the day..................which they did and the room was fabulous! However, I was disappointed that little attention had been given to this prior to me complaining! The room we were allocated later in the day had fantastic views, was of good size and immaculately clean! The bar in the hotel was fabulous and the waiters in the bar could not be more helpful and would often stop and join us in conversation. Also, they were happy for our 9 year old son to join us in the bar during the evening. So, we did have a great stay here after all despite their initial hiccup in attention to detail. We did not use restaurant for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: BobLind
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 days at the hotel during a conference. I know hotels tend to be chaotic during such times, but you survive. Having said so, I will never stay at a Westin again. Sure there were good things, but that´s what I expect for $280 plus tax per night!!! My room was spacious (not the bathroom that was tiny) and had a comfy bed. But what made my stay unpleasant was the service. Or should I say the lack of it? My room key demagnetized three times, and even when they replaced it, it still didn't work. Then, before I arrived I contacted the hotel to ask whether they would receive some packages for me. They said they would do so, but they never told me that they would charge me $7 per package! I stayed at Intercontinental and Hilton hotels and they never charged me for that service. In any event, I would expect to be told if there are charges when I ask!! After complaining with staff and the manager, they didn't charge me. And I almost forgot: My room was next to the floor's service area, and the door was constantly being slammed by the staff. I guess it was bad luck to get that room, but I had no time to change room or to complain about it.... I had breakfast at the hotel a couple of days, but it was not good either. I also had breakfast at the Intercontinental during a meeting, and it was way better than the Westin. Anyway, I think there are better options in San Francisco for the same price and with better service.

Reviews.Title: “If you get a good deal book it!”
Reviews.Author: Vbiles
Reviews.Content: In the city of San Francisco this is a perfect location if you want to be out of the tourist hub of fisher mans wharf, which is only a 10 min cable car ride away. The service was what you would expect from the Westin, and the rooms were always clean and the double shower head in the bathroom was a nice touch, if you have problems getting in and out of a bath this is not the best choice. The bath is very deep and is a bit hard to get in and out of to use the shower. Over all would recommend to people who do not want to be on the wharf but still easy enough to get to.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient to everything...we recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: 4wholuvtravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from Aug 2-8 and had a great experience. We arrived late morning and our room was not ready, but we did not expect it to be. We booked our trip through Expedia and paid for the lowest double queen we could get which meant we would be on the lower floors. When our room was still not ready at 2 pm, they offered us a room on a higher floor so we didn't have to continue waiting. We were on the 12 th floor which still gave us a nice view out the back of the hotel. We chose this hotel because of some of the hotel's features and it's location. We were not disappointed. The room was spacious enough for 2 adults and 2 teenagers. The bathroom was small, but we managed just fine. The beds were very comfortable and we really like the floor to ceiling window. Our daughter used the fitness center and said each machine had it's own tv which she really liked. There is a refrigerator in the room, but you can't really use it because it is filled with the hotel beverages that they want you to buy. If you move them, the sensor will make you pay for something you don't want, so we were not able to keep our own drinks or food cold. You do not need a car to do anything within the city from this location. You can walk to shopping, restaurants, Chinatown, AT&T ballpark. We took the cable car to The Fisherman's Wharf area, and the bus system to Golden Gate Park. We did rent a car for 3 days...also within walking distance of the hotel. We used the car to go to areas outside of the city...Sonata/Napa, Carmel, and a soccer game in Santa Clara. At night we parked the car at an indoor lot across the street from the hotel which cost a max of $23/day. It is very easy and secure, so unless you are coming for a business trip where your company is paying for parking, or you just insist that you need valet parking, I would suggest you do not park at the hotel for $48...it really is a waste of your money. The concierge service was wonderful. They not only had maps and brochures for various tours, but they took the time to map things out for us, explain the transportation system, and answer any questions we had. The hotel secured our luggage for us when we had to check out before leaving for our flight home. They also made sure we got a cab to the airport. Cabs are very easy to get outside the hotel, and the rates are very good. For four people, we actually found it cheaper to take a cab places than using the cable car system! Many of the streets in the city are one way (including the street the hotel is located on)...just keep that in mind if you plan to drive yourself around the city. We never used the hotel Internet service because we didn't want to pay extra for it, but there are many restaurants near the hotel that have free Internet access, including a Starbuck on the corner, and Mel's Diner, a couple blocks await. It is a shame that the hotel doesn't have free Internet, but we were aware of that when we booked the trip. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel to others, especially if you want a great city location. There were no negative surprises at this hotel..in my opinion, it was exactly what it advertises itself to be.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Tommy745
Reviews.Content: Good value. Very clean and well run hotel, The location was right in the heart of Market St and Union Square, Grant, and other shopping and dining areas. Easy walk to China Town and short cab ride to AT&T Ball Park to see the Giants.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff...interesting location...subpar property”
Reviews.Author: TheSupers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for two nights. This hotel is located in the up and coming soma area that seems ok during the day but gets very quiet and a bit uncomfortable in the evening. I walked a few blocks in the wrong direction and found myself fearful for my life in the middle of the afternoon. The staff at the hotel was very pleasant and helpful and the lobby was very nice but once you got on the elevator and on to the floors it was liken entering another dimention. The floors and the rooms were outdated and in need of tlc which was a stark contrast with the modern sheik lobby. I think that the next time we'll be in SF we'll try a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The staff was unbelievably accommodating!”
Reviews.Author: Marci2000
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so nice, they have a wonderful restaurant called "Ducca" in the hotel. It is very unique and good food. The staff at both hotel and restaurant are amazing, couldn't have had a better stay!

Reviews.Title: “Parking fees”
Reviews.Author: gwen412
Reviews.Content: The overall stay was spoiled by the 48.00 plus tax(54.00 +) for 4 nights was unreasonable for the guests. I did not like that this was not diclosed so we were kind of disappointed. Also a view of the roof. I would expect a nicer view for all the money $$$ spent. I will never stay at Westin again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: ParagShah4
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel is terrific. Jacob and Carmen at the front desk are great. The concierge desk will provide excellent suggestions. The rooms are clean and spacious. The hotel is located in a great area with easy access to restaurants and public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Services”
Reviews.Author: SeaCliffer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Westin SFMS for 3 nights on a recent weekend (Friday thru Monday). We stayed at the same hotel about two years ago and were eager to go back as our last stay was very positive. We stayed in the Grad Delux room on the 24th floor. This time, our stay was disappointing; we're not likely to return in the future. The hotel's location on the Market Street and its proximity to Union Square and BART stations were nice, but there are many other hotels located in the same area.
