What we liked the most last time were the friendly staff and nicely furnished and VERY clean room. This time, we found the front desk staff unwelcoming and impersonal. When my wife checked in first, the person rarely make eye contact while she waited and was mostly busy with the computer! When I arrived later, I found two front desk staff talking to each other, while I waited for service. Overall, the quality of our check-in experience does not match that of a reputable hotel like Westin. The quality of the maid service was even more disappointing. On the second day, we returned to find a poorly cleaned room: - Used paper cups were placed back on the tray - The bed was made sloppily - Used bathroom floor mat was placed back on the tub For the price it charges (about $260/day for a weekend special, including taxes, and $50/day for parking), one could fare better by looking for another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: MsPRNorthCarolina
Reviews.Content: Went to San Francisco from North Carolina and stayed at the Westin in early April 2011 with my parents and niece. Made hotel and air arrangements thru Orbitz, great deal! Very convenient to exit the airport get on BART system and be only a block away from the hotel. The hotel upgraded one of our rooms for FREE, just by asking, with an excellent view of AT&T park and the water. Rooms were clean and the bed was very comfortable. Beautiful lobby, great buffet breakfast in the hotel restaurant, a little pricey but worth it! Just around the corner is the shopping district (Apple, Macy's, Cheescake Factory, etc.). The ferry building is also within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Solid performer”
Reviews.Author: AussieMark95
Reviews.Content: Overall a solid performance that you would expect from a Westin. The rooms were nice and spacious, and location was good being only a short walk from Union Square. Service was only average - highlighted by a very slow check-in. Rooms were also on the expensive side - so hunt around for a deal. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: Maryellen_11
Reviews.Content: This totally comfortable hotel is in a great location. It's an easy walk to Moscone Center as well as Union Square Shopping and the Ferry Building. Public transit is very convenient. This was my second stay here this year and I would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay at Westin SF on Market Street”
Reviews.Author: rjspunky
Reviews.Content: This will be the 3rd time I have stayed at the Westin SF on Market. Again it was another incredible stay. The location was perfect for my appointments, using the MUNI and BART Transportation mass transit systems. The hotel staff was friendly and very helpful, my room was perfect and very clean. I will be coming to San Francisco again in the next 60 days and the Westin SF on Market street will be my preferred place to stay. Thank you Westin San Francisco on Market for another great stay. Robert

Reviews.Title: “Another Pleasant Stay at the Westin”
Reviews.Author: fredsv007
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the San Francisco Westin on Market St. This was my fourth stay at this hotel, which I find to be reliable, fair-priced lodging by San Francisco standards. The Westin supplies clean, modern, comfortable rooms. They are a bit on the small side, but that is a common characteristic of all hotels in this city. As with most Starwood properties, service is excellent from the front desk to housekeeping. The Ducca restaurant off the lobby serves good food with friendly, efficient service. The same can be said of the lobby bar, though the prices seem a bit high for their drinks. Just outside the bar is a terrific garden area with tables and seating and trees and shrubs. It's a rarity to be able to take your drinks/food outside to a quiet, relaxing urban garden in this part of the city. All in all, this is a comfortable and clean hotel. The location is excellent. Just a block to BART, and a short walk to Union Square, etc. As with all downtown SF hotels, parking space is at a premium and the hotel charges a stiff fee for overnight parking. If you don't want to pay the valet costs, use one of the nearby public parking garages for half the cost and then walk a couple blocks to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: heston55
Reviews.Content: An easy stroll from hotel to main shopping area on Market Street. Like most Westins it was large, clean and efficient, yet a little impersonal. I booked a “deluxe” room, which was to be from the 8th to 16th floor, hoping to have a nice view of the city. Unfortunately we were given a room on the 9th floor at the rear of the hotel, where our view was straight into some offices. Personally, I think their “deluxe room” should start a little higher up…maybe 12+, above the level of this building. I would avoid room service as a dining option, as the food is mediocre and there are much better restaurants around the area. All in all, a nice place to stay but there are probably better options out there in some of the smaller hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CIVOG
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Westin Market Street for 5 nights. My husband has a gold starwood card, so we took advantage of his points and the stay was 100% free. We were given an excellent room in a high floor. The room was very spacious, nicely decorated, ceiling to floor windows and a king heavenly bed. The bathroom was also spacious enough, with a nice framed mirror, very clean and with plenty of fluffy towels. Location is great for touring San Francisco, very near from cable cars. At the time of booking we were not sure if we should stay here or in Westin St. Francis and I was happy with our final choice. I believe that although this hotel is still very well located (and also near from Union Square) it is much quieter than St. Francis. There were 2 complimentary bottles of water each day which was nice. I love the fragrance of the Westins lobbies, subtle but very pleasant! If I wanted to be picky I'd refer that the fabric of the sofas were a bit dirty (if you're paying the standard rate would be around $300/night and this is not admissible). I also missed the free internet that some Sheraton hotels have (Link sheraton point); nowadays, I believe this should be standard in an hotel of this category.

Reviews.Title: “the standard Westin experience”
Reviews.Author: nomadsbynature
Reviews.Content: As expected, the usual Westin experience. Check in was fast and efficient and bellman service was attentive- we had a lot of luggage and it was taken care of quickly and professionally. Room was in great shape with the Heavenly bed which is always a great sleep. Gym was pretty ok, with enough cardio machines and some weights- pretty consistent with other westins I've stayed at. Location is good, a short walk to union square and the hyde-powell cable car, a short drive to the embarcadero and ferry building, and lots of options for food nearby. overall, a quality stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location for business or holiday”
Reviews.Author: princess3016
Reviews.Content: I received a discounted rate via facebook for a premier king room, which was a good reduction on the website rate. The hotel is centrally located on Market Street and seemed to primarily cater to the business market, however, the location is great for union square and transport links. Taxi ride to hotel no more than 30 mins and cost approx $40. The check-in process was smooth and our room was on the 30th floor of the hotel. The room itself was a great size, with good views across the city. The bed was really comfortable and large. On the flip side, the bathroom was really small and did not compare to facilities available in other starwood hotels, i.e. toilet right next to the bath and the shower being over the bath. Whilst overall the room and bathroom were very clean there were some minor points in the bathroom, like long hair on the floor and a towel and a toenail clipping on the bathroom floor. There were a couple of other minor points which took the shine off the hotel, only having two starbucks teabags and one portion of coffee in the room together with the water bottles in the room being complimentary only on the first day. Add in the lack of free wi-fi or free/cheap internet in business centre and you feel a bit cheated for a hotel of this star rating. Like another reviewer, we were also almost charged for a bottle of wine in the mini-bar which we did not consume. This charge was taken off the account with little fuss by staff. Some other reviewers have commented on the noise, which is a little surprising. This is a hotel in the centre of the city on a busy street. We also heard siren noise, but not general traffic noise. Noise level is as I would expect. There was a good happy hour in the downstairs bar and a nice patio area which appeared to be frequented by both locals and guests. Overall, I would only stay at this hotel again if I were to receive a discounted rate, would try elsewhere in the same location first.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly”
Reviews.Author: TravelAddict91
Reviews.Content: The only way my stay could have been better would be to make it longer. My family and I stayed one night and the time we were there was too much running around. I really wanted to relax with a drink in the hugely inviting outdoor area and have vowed to return soon and do just that. It seems to be more of a hotel for couples or business rather than family, but my daughter did appreciate how luxe everything felt. All the staff were friendly & professional; the concierge was gracious and helpful with breakfast suggestions. The beds were truly heavenly (it was the first good nights sleep I had while on vacation in CA), firm but not too firm and the linens are obviously a better cotton and higher thread count. The overall feel was absolutely lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and very clean”
Reviews.Author: nicole1989
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a good location, easy access to the city. We asked for a king size bed and put into a small room with a queen bed. The next day they upgraded the room and we got our king, with much more room . The bed was too soft, especially if you have a bad back already. The views from our room were great, ceiling to floor windows. Thehotel overall/ room was very clean. The staff were friendly and helpful. The only crazy thing was paying $40 plus for breakfast. A bit steep considering the food was okay. The service in the restaurant should have changed hands with the cleaning crew (the maids were very friendly and helpful). It took a long time to see your waiter/waitress once you ordered. It took a really long time to get our bill, we would always have to go find someone.

Reviews.Title: “Always amazing beds and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: a_bvoyageurs
Reviews.Content: We were a little hesitant reading some online info about the area west of the hotel location (e.g., the tenderloin), but were pleasantly surprised. HUGE TIP: don't pay the ridiculous $60/night on-site parking fee. Directly across the street is a private lot above a Staples store (entrance on side alley) with a really expensive hourly rate but $24/day maximum. We saved $72 by walking across the street, literally, plus avoided the added bell-hop/valet obligatory tips. Also, the historic street cars imported from across the world run down/up market street 1/2 a block from hotel door. The $2 cost is worth it and takes about 20 minutes to reach fisherman's wharf and the super-tourist-trap-walk-on-top-of-each-other-areas.

Reviews.Title: “They did a good job”
Reviews.Author: growingyoung
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent. The rooms are large, clean and well furnished. Checking in and out was effortless. You have to ask for a room in an upper floor. We paid to upgrade, but heard other people that just insisted on getting a room on a high floor and didn't pay extra. The view is great.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Conveniently Located, Above Average, (but nothing that stands out)”
Reviews.Author: allisonfaith11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights as we toured the city of San Francisco. The first night, we were in a room directly next to the service elevator--it was very, very loud all night long. We called the front desk in the morning and they moved us to another room at the end of the hallway (and on a higher floor than we had paid for-bonus!) Our next room was very clean and comfortable. We enjoyed the large, floor to ceiling windows and views of the city, and extremely comfortable bed and bedding. This room was much quieter than our first room. Weird thing: they put a bunch of snacks and drinks in your room (very pricey ones), so while there is a refrigerator in your room, there is no extra space for leftovers or bottles of water/pop you purchase on your own. We were almost charged for a bottle of wine that we never drank. Turns out the scale in the fridge was indicating that something was moved around, while what happened is that we stuck a Diet Coke in there to cool (that we purchased from Walgreens down the street). Additionally, there was ONE complimentary water bottle for us, but never got restocked our entire stay. Overall, we did like this hotel. It is in a great location to public transportation. It was very comforable after a long day of siteseeing and walking. There was just nothing overly personal or exceptional about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodations and friendly service!”
Reviews.Author: tbelkas
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at the Westin San Francisco Market Street after traveling around different parts of CA for the previous 3 days, and it was such a relief to have our room as a brief home. I believe the hotel was recently renovated, and as much as I love charming older hotels, there's nothing like a room where everything is new and clean. We stayed on the 30th floor and had a fantastic view of the city, and the hotel itself is in a fairly convenient location if you want to spend your trip venturing around different neighborhoods. We used the SFMTA buses quite a bit to get around, and there are a number of stops very close by. Also, there's a lot of shopping just a few minutes away in Union Square, as well as the departure point for the cable cars. Parking overnight at the hotel is extremely expensive ($42 or something like that). Save yourself some money and park in the municipal garage right around the corner. If you ask the valet person, they will direct you to it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: treffy123
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business in late June, 2011. My stay coincided with the pride parade on the weekend and it was very hard to find a room in the city - I was surprised that a big hotel in such a central location had anything available. The location is great - right downtown adjacent to market street. Although nights in San Francisco can be very cool, the hotel has a nice patio with gas fireplace outside - with free wifi. The patio is right beside the bar so you can take your drink outside. My room was very large and overall I found the hotel clean and well kept. My only complaints were difficulties with the internet service - the person at front desk told me that sometimes Macs had problems connecting to their service and maybe I should work in the lobby...not exactly a great solution. The problem was resolved after spending some time on the phone with their tech support department.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Clean, Modern, and great service!”
Reviews.Author: JackieBonelli
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the King Heavenly Suite with city views and I would have to say, this was amazing. We had a great view of the bay, and were close to everything we needed to be close to! :) The bed was super comfortable, not a hotel where you need to bring your own pillow, these were super nice. We ordered room service for breakfast, and it was the perfect (tasty) ending to our short stay in the city. The customer service was EXCELLENT! I couldn't be more happy and am excited to have another reason to stay in SF so I can stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely experience”
Reviews.Author: Summer2011ER
Reviews.Content: This hotel is simply lovely! It was affordable and worth every penny. The rooms were clean and so pretty. Great service. They provided us with any extra amenities we needed like fridge, microwave etc. The view was spectacular. We got one of those corner rooms that are shaped triangular and it was such a great room. Comfy bed nice n clean. The hotel was gorgeous and was located in the best area of San Francisco. Staff was really nice too!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!! Not worth the great location!”
Reviews.Author: bulldogluvr
Reviews.Content: It cannot be denied that the hotel is in a great location, but if you don't mind staying at a Motel 6 and paying for a Westin than you will be happy here. My husband and I are SPG owners at a Westin in Maui so we always look forward to staying at a Westin. In fact we chose this hotel over the Palace and the W unfortunately. We are very easy going and have never written a complaint about a hotel so I am sorry it had to be about a Westin. The room was ok. You have to like a Heavenly Bed. The bathroom was disgusting and ruined the whole experience. We were on a romantic getaway celebrating our anniversary and found ourselves washing someone else's body hairs down the drain before we could take a shower. I realize other people have used the toilet and the shower before me, its a hotel, but its not really something I want to be reminded of when I get in there.........In addition to some weird stains on the perimeter of the tub, the tub itself had a disgusting yellow stain that filled the whole tub about a third of the way up............. do not know what this was.... I have attached pictures. Stains of any kind in a bathroom are a sure way to make anyone feel disgusting rather than relaxed and rejuvenated lol! Any hope for renewal and relaxation was gone the minute we went into that bathroom. I really don't know how they rent this room out but I guess it just goes to show you how they run their hotel and what they think of their guests. The best part is they put us in a room with a Starwood Preferred Guest plaque on the door and my husband and I jokingly said I bet these are the worst rooms in the hotel! Guess we were right.... Needless to say we will not be back, we will stay at the W next time, especially after housekeeping just walked into our room at 9am unannounced. There are so many great places to stay, avoid this one! I am sure they have rooms that don't have stains and body hairs all over the bathroom but at these prices do you want to take a risk?

Reviews.Title: “Great location but disappointed service”
Reviews.Author: BeeHYW
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the location which is next to Westfield mall. Check-in staff is friendly. However, we asked for a bottle opener to our room and the one we got was one without a lever which I could not use. Asked if we could get another one and was bluntly rejected. The concierge day and night shift staff gave contradicting advice on transport options to the airport... Overall frustrating experience....

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BrooklynCarolT
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for my first trip to San Francisco. I was able to walk in any direction, as there is so much to see and do in any direction. The Westin name is a guarantee for a good stay....the room was pleasant and clean (I had asked for a nice view since it was my first stay and the front desk certainly took care of me .... great view in fact!); the hotel staff was friendly and accommodating; the bar was welcoming. I will definitely be back! ....... I would have rated 5 stars if it wasn't for the concierge. Not friendly and really not helpful. It felt like he was forced to assist.

Reviews.Title: “great location & amazing bed”
Reviews.Author: Awa11
Reviews.Content: Very nice and helpful staff, a bit businessy at first but rooms were fantastic, stayed on the 24th floor and had an amazing view. Bed was out of this world. Mini bar was totally over-priced and the internet also should be free which was disappoining. Room service was also terrible. Very nice outdoor patio area also.

Reviews.Title: “Expected much more from a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jetset_KT
Reviews.Content: Stayed here solo at the back end of a business trip. For a 4 star hotel, i did expect better service. I was left to drag my own suitcase up the stairs with the bellman watching. What was he employed for again? They charged me $80 to park the car for 2 hours after my check out, which I would have appreciated if they informed me that before i left it with them. I was definately left disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “OK but expensive”
Reviews.Author: Anna_and_Greg
Reviews.Content: Advantages: - Nice view from the windows (but not from all) we have a room on the 12th floor (no 1202) and the view was awesome since it was a room in the corner (gives a look at two sides) - Very clean - Nice room service and reception - Super fast elevators Disadvantages: - Hotel is located close to the centre thus it is a bit noisy (noise from the street and whistling doorman call for a taxi). - Lack of breakfast included in the price but an additional paid buffet was very good (not a standard 'continental food' i.e. donut, but a real choice of food) - Be careful with the fridge there are sensors which charge you even if you move or replace the food. Check your bill at the end and in case of an extra payment for bar fix the case with reception (the do not make any problem with correction of the bill).

Reviews.Title: “your typical good quality but boring corporate hotel”
Reviews.Author: Damian35
Reviews.Content: Nothing really to say other than same same but good. If i was traveling through sanfran and wanted a decent hotel i would stay here again....but I could be in any one of the dozen boring big hotel chains....staff were good, rooms were good, food was good, location was good etc etc etc.....all good but nothing special...which is OK i guess.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced”
Reviews.Author: funkyunk
Reviews.Content: Being a gold starwood member I was disappointed about the price. We paid for 3 nights in advance$1279.32 so no refund available. Parking was $48.00 + tax= $54.56 per night, Internet was extra. PS we did get an up grade. We moved after 3 nights at the Westin to the Omni hotel on California St. for 3 nights. Rooms were 1/2 the price and as nice. Parking was 1/2 price for 2 nights.(same price as Westin) My take on San Franciso is everything is over priced. I really have issues on paying so much for parking. The rooms I can get over the price. The song " I Left My Heart in San Franciso" should be changed to "I Left My Money for Parking" Thank You for letting me vent.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Hotel in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: JonCaves
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for Union Square, SFMOMA, and with Market Street just next door grabbing the Bart or Muni to The Civic Center or The Embarcadero is easy. We'll be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, modern, clean and safe”
Reviews.Author: montegrappa
Reviews.Content: A good hotel, with a good Internet offer that made it quite good value. We stayed for 3 nights. The breakfast buffet is very good quality with a great selection of foods and very good service. The bar service is a not good. The waiters are simply not friendly and made my task of getting refreshments for our group an unpleasant task. The hotel's rooms are well appointed, clean and modern. We felt very comfortable and needed no additional assistance. The Concierge team are simply wonderful and helped us plan our walking trips around the city as well as helping us select and book restaurants. We ver much appreciated their help, which always came with a smile. We enjoyed our walks around the city. There is a diner called 'Mel's Diner' about a block away that serves good cheap food, with an ambience that goes back to the 50's. It's worth visiting. We had a dinner one night at the North Beach Italian restaurant at North Beach. Wow is the best way to describe this. Service is exceptional, wine election is fabulous and the food, well it's simply the best Italian food outside Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: vg411973
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best Westin's i've stayed at, very large, clean guestrooms that seem to be very newly renovated. The bathrooms are updated and look to be fresh and new. The hotel has a great Italian restaurant in the lobby, and the bar is comfortable but also hip. Location is good, walking distance to Union Square and many restaurants. The only downside for me was that there is no coffee shop / coffee stand in the lobby, you must buy coffee from the restaurant and that is a bit of a hassle - but other than that, the hotel is great and I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “satisfactory but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: jme3636
Reviews.Content: Satisfactory but with some problems. Checked in at 11:30 pm (2:30am east coast time) after a long flight and the person at the check in desk asked if I needed a wake up call. Said yes and asked for one at 6:00 am for an important work call. Not surprisingly they forgot and i missed my call. Understand that things go wrong but when it was reported to the hotel they said they would let the manager know - never heard from anyone and the next day i made sure to use my own alarm clock. Internet and parking were absurdley expensive, even when the company is paying

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CWFSantaCruz_CA
Reviews.Content: We were going to see the Stein Family collection at the SFMOMA, which is right down the street. Easy check-in and both rooms had amazing views. Walked to Union Square, quick taxi ride to diner on Van Ness Ave. The only complaint was we couldn't find the doorman to hail a cab, but we got one by ourselves. We will stay here again and walk to ATT ball park.. This hotel has a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience and a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ogarthegreat
Reviews.Content: I spend 5 nights here on vacation from Florida with the Wife and two kids. The location of this Westin is great. It's close to everything but away from the madness of SF tourism. Close to Cable car stop, public transportaion, shopping and playgrounds (for kids). It was a bit hard to find, and kind of cramped, but what isn't in this big City. I booked this place at $110 / night and it was a great value. Biggest issue: parking (surprise). Our Chevy Suburban was considered "oversized" and $75 / night to park. Seriously. We wound up parking in a public garage just a few blocks away for $25 / night.

Reviews.Title: “A local favorite”
Reviews.Author: MrsAWW
Reviews.Content: I'm a bit reluctant to write this review, as I don't want everyone to find out about my favorite SF hotel for business trips. But it's a big placel, I suppose there's room for everyone. This Westin is fantastic: staff is great, rooms are lovely (recently redone, I believe), the SPG rooms in particular have stunning floor to ceiling views of the bay, food is good, prices are good...and the location is perfect for my purposes. Close to my office, and if you're in town for something at Moscone, you can SEE it. Plus, you're also close to Market Street and Union Square for all your shopping needs. I am a regular. At this price point, there is no cleaner hotel, and that means a lot to me. A couple of (small) cons: they do charge for internet access. Also, room service ends at 10 PM, though there's plenty in the neighborhood if you get home late. All in all, this is a gem of a hotel in this area. I'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice New Years Weekend”
Reviews.Author: alwyscllct
Reviews.Content: This review is some 6 months in the making. Spent 3 night over New Years '10/'11 at a great rate obtained by our traveling companions who were Starwood members. Upgraded to high floor with a decent view in a "Corner" room and free internet. Room was adequate for SF in fact a little larger than the norm. Entire staff was excellent including front desk, bellmen, and particularly the Valet greater who had maps and great tips always at the ready and with a smile. Not much in the way of substantial common areas although the lobby bar was very nice. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Westin as usual, great location”
Reviews.Author: MagsAU
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for exploring the city and felt safe walking to the hotel around midnight after the theatre. Usual standard of Westin room, great beds and towels. Business Centre were very helpful. Disappointed that despite booking for three and staying three nights, at no time during our stay did the amenities reflect this - extra cups, glasses and only one bathrobe. Ordered room service breakfast one morning before an early tour. Did not recieve the complete order, was only charged for what was delivered, but we had to share the breakfast as had not time to wait whilst they sorted it out. These two issues tainted a great hotel. The hotel has unfortunatley opted for that minibar system that automatically charges you once you move an item, we noted this for the items on top of the cabinet, but not those in the fridge. Front Desk did not argue when I called and asked for items to be removed from the bill. I expect they get this alot.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value”
Reviews.Author: Kenpasadena
Reviews.Content: Haven't stayed in this Westin before, but prefer it to the grand dame St. Francis. Smaller, easier to get in and out of. Great views from the higher floors. Great weekend rate. Serviceable bar and restaurant. Hopefully, you won't pick the hotel for its bar or restaurant because there is one of the big foodie capitals of the world right outside your door. Just down the street from the W, so you can go and act cool there and stay cheaper for the same bed and shower and views at the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre. Energy sapping.”
Reviews.Author: ColoTraveler0
Reviews.Content: A monstrous, looming hotel with a cold, dark lobby and industrial-looking corridors. Low ceilings (due to strange downward protrusions and magnified by various low-hanging exit signs) left me involuntarily ducking, including in my room even though I didn’t really need to. Bed mattress well worn out. Bathroom ambiance ruined by unattractive and uninspired picture of water droplets. Soap was very neat – shaped like a leaf.

Reviews.Title: “view was amazing”
Reviews.Author: teamphiilips08
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! The view from our room was amazing since we were on the 28th floor. I was a bit dissapointed that there was no microwave and no refrigerator. so if your hungry be prepaid to pay because i odered my 3yr old son a pizza and it was 20 bucks! plus parking is $50 a night, overall it was a great place to stay and the beds were comfy.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel excellent location”
Reviews.Author: mamu268
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at the Westin. Very nice well equiped room. very comfy "heavenly" beds. I dont know what was "heavenly" about the shower or bath though! we requested a cot for arrival and had to ask twice for it to come to the room, when it arrived it was metal bars and was cold for the baby when he ended up against them in the night also its on wheels and if you have a very strong baby who moves around alot the cot could move - we have a very wriggly boy! so I wouldnt recommend the cots, if you have a travelcot take it! nice restaurant although pricey breakfast at $25 pp we enjoyed Lori's diner more! lovely lobby area, helpful concierge. and I must say Location was fantastic and the best thing about the hotel. Oh no free wifi... $14 a day pretty bad these days!

Reviews.Title: “Great Room with window overlooking Market street intersection”
Reviews.Author: manu.harish
Reviews.Content: I booked a 4 star hotel through hotwire for $40 and it ended up being the Westin on Market street. The check-in lady was very surprised at my low rate. She was very accomodating for a crib (which was at the room within 10-15 minutes). We were able to check in at 2:00pm with no trouble, and our room had an amazing ceiling to floor window overlooking the Market street intersection. The kids (ages 1.5 and 3.5) loved watching the trolley cars go back and forth. The beds were very comfortable and the location was ideal to take the cable car up Powell to Chinatown. The cable line starts at Powell and Market so you are guaranteed a seat from here ($5 each ride....kids free). We only stayed for one night, but it seems to be a great location for shopping and sight-seeing. Park across the street for $23 overnight. This is much cheaper than at the hotel (~$45?).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great city”
Reviews.Author: Foodiedunedin
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean hotel not a lot of the bells and whistles of boutique hotels but convenient to Starbucks, BART, Chinatown. Clean rooms, nice service! Reasonably priced!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience as always”
Reviews.Author: lmarie220
Reviews.Content: Each time we have stayed with this hotel we leave satisfied. From the hotel staff to the Ducca restaurant we are never dissapointed. The location is amazing which just helps this to be our favorite hotel in SF and actually of all the Westin's we have stayed with.

Reviews.Title: “bad management”
Reviews.Author: shirleymanny
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a package trip, flight and hotel to San Francisco and stayed at the Westin Market street for 5 nights March 31- April 5, 2011. We were billed and paid for this 2 months before we left. We enjoyed our visit and the stay at the hotel was good. The problem started near the end of our stay, when we were charged for bar service just by opening the door of the fridge that was in our suit. We visited the desk to explain we were only taking out things that we had bought, because the fridge had been empty until that day. We were told the charges were taken off our bill. The biggest problem came though when we returned home only to find we were billed in full again for the 5 days we stayed at the hotel. At first I contacted who we did our booking through to find out they were not the ones that had double billed us. I then called the hotel and explained the problem. It took 3 weeks 3 phone calls about 5 emails and 2 different credits to get reimburse for their mistake. In the end we gave up and excepted the fact the remaining 4.69 was not worth any more effort. The confusion of the bar fridge still was an issue it seems and putting through the correct amount in Canadian funds was a bit to difficult to figure out. Would love to visit San Francisco again but would stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Bad management - stay away”
Reviews.Author: Simon7382
Reviews.Content: I stayed a couple of days in this hotel, never again. First, I asked for a quiet room away from elevator and ice machine. I got a room next to the service elevator, which was in operation all night long, with people yelling and banging the door. After two sleepless nights I got a better room, but one where the exhaust fan in the bathroom was running 24/7, it could not be turned off, and was very noisy, at the end of its life. Beyond this inconvenience the room service and the restaurant both close at 10:30pm, if you get back to the hotel late after a long day of work you are out of luck. I have never experienced this lack of service in any hotel even at half of the $400/night rate this hotel charges. Furthermore, while the hotel offers internet access for a price BUT BE AWARE: their server infested with a nasty virus. It took me days to get rid of it.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised for a big-city Westin”
Reviews.Author: TalieJ
Reviews.Content: I am a Starwood Preferred guest but to date have not been impressed by Westins in popular tourist destinations like San Francisco. I was pleasantly surprised by this one. My husband had checked in to a regular king room then I joined him later in the trip. The check in lady was extremely apologetic that they couldn't then upgrade us to a better room or higher floor because they were sold out (btw we hadn't asked). I was expecting something tiny & dingy but the room was a good size and although only on the 9th floor we had a good view and it was still quiet. The bathroom was tiny but otherwise the room exceeded expectations. The location was great - right on the trolley lines and right around the corner from the shopping area. I would definitely book at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Giants Game and visiting San Fran”
Reviews.Author: chrisw148
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal from Hotwire.com and loved my hotel. I was in town for the Braves v. Giants series and was perfect for me as the stadium is in walking distance up the street. The staff was friendly and the room was great despite the lack of a view. I spent most of my time out and about anyway. Overall I had a great experience and will come back. Only bad thing is that there should be an area inside the hotel that provides free Internet service.

Reviews.Title: “Lodger Beware!”
Reviews.Author: bhunt15
Reviews.Content: Book the Westin on line. Bought a premire room on floor 26-39. Arrived at hotel and they gave me a room on the 14th floor. Said view was same as the rooms 26-39 so quit making a big deal. Went to room had a great view of the giant airconditioning unit on the roof of the building next door. The room ammenities and size were the same as Best Westerns. They also charged me $60 per night to park plus with no extra cost put a scratch on my car that they are not responsible for. Take video of car before you let them park it. You would be crazy to stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Heading down the coast”
Reviews.Author: trvlnman72
Reviews.Content: I did my research online and it paid off! I got a great deal from the tripadvisor 15% special, so i decided to book with them. The room was very clean and had everything I needed, including internet, cable tv, telephone, coffee maker, iron and board, and very comfortable beds and bedding...Windows that open for ventilation and the staff was very friendly...Located just a few blocks walk to central downtown

Reviews.Title: “going back”
Reviews.Author: kygregor
Reviews.Content: i am on a baseball stadium tour and started off with 2 places i have either been or didnt want to go.. so the place i didnt want to go is Oakland ( and as i found out for good reason) so i stayed in san francisco..I will say that when i go back to see the giants play this will be the place i am staying.. AWESOME location, 2 blocks from BART station, close to night life and shopping.. The staff was awesome.... as i am checking boxes if you are staying in san francisco/oakland area do NOT rent a car as parking is HORRIBLE ... and do not expect free wi fi which was a bummer

Reviews.Title: “Okay...not the best of The Westins”
Reviews.Author: yenger
Reviews.Content: My sister and I went out to San Francisco for a quick get away. We took a cab to the hotel (note there's no shuttle) cab fare was about $40 including tip (also note there's an extra $2.00 charge from the airport). When we arrived at the hotel, we had a room at the bottom floor (probably should have taken this room), but was upgraded to the 33rd floor with a great view, BUT next to the elevators. The room was very clean and the view of the city was amazing; however the tub in the bathroom was really weird. You basically had to take a giant hop just to get into and take a shower. Our tub was also clogged (yuck!) the plug in the tub was stuck, called the lobby and they sent someone up to fix it right away. What maintenance basically did was popped it open with a flat head screw driver and just lefted it as is....um what if the next guest wanted to take a bath?? The other sucky thing was the elevators right next door, it hummed really really loud all night from people getting on and off. Their elevators also went really fast and stopped really abruptly so when you got off you felt like your equilibrium was all off, this happened every time we were on and off. Only kudos was that it was within walking distances of shopping if that's what you want to do in the city (why we were there). Overall, I'd say our stay was just so-so, I expected a lot more for a Westin hotel and for as much as we paid. Pros: Hotel staff was super nice Ordered in room dining, they were really fast (spaghetti and meatballs) not bad a bit over priced - cut off time was 10:30 pm to order Great view of the city Within walking distance to a lot of great amenities (shopping, movies, ball park...etc) Hotel has a town car flat rate of $37 cheaper than a cab ride Cons: Elevator noise next to room and also ride was horrible (just saying if you were in Vegas and had a room next to an elevator, you'd never hear it) Not a lot of dining close by Daily cost of $40 - $50 for parking if you rented a car and wanted to park there Reservation is needed for hotel dining (Ducca) No spa in hotel Snacks and booze in room was pricey, nothing below $5.00 (seriously Snickers for $5.00??!?)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms- great location - but no free wi-fi!”
Reviews.Author: cayjay54
Reviews.Content: On arriving at this lovely hotel there was not a bell hop in sight. My daughter and I struggled with 2 suitcases each and through the whole checking in process and getting to our room, not a bit of help offered in any way. On the plus side we were upgraded to a better room, which was lovely and had amazing views of the city. However it was obvious that the room was not completely ready, the chair was in the middle of the room, pillow thrown across bed, used water glass in bathroom etc. When we complained apologies were profuse, we were offered another room (which we didnt bother accepting) and a free buffet breakfast was given. I also received a follow up email apologising again, and offering any further assistance should it be required, which was a nice touch. There is another Westin ( i think on union square) but after reading reviews I thought this one sounded nicer. Good location, close to union square, downtown shopping, transportation, and an easy 20 min walk to the ferry building. In fact we walked to the Alcatraz landing, and pier 39 as well as the wharf area. However we did get the cable car back! This was a lovely hotel, buffet breakfast was excellent! The only issues I had were the lack of help with luggage on arrival and no free wi-fi in room which we had everhywhere else we went.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful, efficient, personal staff with great views”
Reviews.Author: shellbeachkathleen
Reviews.Content: I stayed for four nights with my daughter who has a broken leg. The entire staff that we interacted with tried to help and accomodate my daughter's needs, i.e., offering a room with a walk-in shower, bringing a shower chair up, seating us at a table in the dining room that allowed her easy access, helping her get in and out of car, etc. The extra effort shown was personal and kind. Great staff and facility.

Reviews.Title: “The best spot in town”
Reviews.Author: SteveCNP
Reviews.Content: We had reservations for two nights, We arrived at 11:30 am and was checked in right away to a great room on the 31 floor with wonderful view of the bay and ATT park. The fitness room was fantastic had a great work-out. Great location for shopping just a block off of Market St. We had dinner at the restaurant in the Hotel and it was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel, a bit far from the action”
Reviews.Author: TravlinSaz
Reviews.Content: Nice place but a bit far from Pier 39 and surrounding area. We walked back from Pier 39 and were absolutely knackered afterwards, so would recommend a taxi or trolley ride instead. Perfect location for Union Square and shopping if that's your thing. Hotel staff were pleasant but impersonal, food was pricey so ate out instead. Nice pedestrian area to the rear of the hotel, all in all a pleasant stay but not wowed by it considering the price. Cost about $90 to park the car there for a day and a half, would recommend using the parking lot across the street instead.

Reviews.Title: “Super location, close to city transit”
Reviews.Author: ednacloud
Reviews.Content: One of our main considerations when choosing this hotel was location and we were not disappointed. We were determined to use public transport as much as we could so this hotel is ideal. It is just a half block or so from the BART at Montgomery so great for getting to and from SFO International Airport. Many transit options around the corner on Market Street too. We ate in the hotel's restaurant one night, good food and service but nothing remarkable for the price. The ambience wasn't great somehow. The adjacent bar area was much more popular, we should have eaten there instead. The room (a Grand Deluxe) was perfectly nice. Heavenly Beds are always great. The replenishment of amenities each day varied though (as another poster commented recently). We had mouthwash on the first day only. Body wash not always replenished. Bottled water also only on the first day, not replenished after that. Heavenly towels some days, but not others. The cleaning standards were just fine. I'm sure if it had been an issue they would have dealt with it. We had to swap rooms as the first one had a fault with the air system that kept waking us up. The desk staff dealt with this quickly and the replacement room we moved to was fine. There were errors on our account on checkout because of this room change; these too were quickly rectified. The hotel does seem to be keen to resolve any issues before they become problems. Like other travellers, I feel that being charged extra for internet access these days is a dinosaur from the past. That said, it worked just fine and was a reasonable speed. We used the business centre, which was fine too. Just a little thing, we noticed that they pipe their signature scent (same as the bathroom toiletries) through the lobby. It did seem a bit overpowering at times, something to note if you are sensitive to such things. Would definitely stay there again, on the whole a positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfy bed, but small bathroom”
Reviews.Author: eng2mksd
Reviews.Content: I stayed on the 12th floor for 5 nights and had a corner room which was huge. I had floor to ceiling windows on two sides and it let in lots of sunlight. You can see the city around, mostly buildings. The location is great for walking to shopping, transportation, the Moscone Center, and plenty of coffee and Walgreens around. The bathroom is the only drawback. The toilet and bathtub room are so cramped you cannot get more than one person in there much less one and shut the door easily. The sink is fine because it is out in the open. The hotel staff are very friendly and I slept great!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome view, large room”
Reviews.Author: SoreLegs
Reviews.Content: Floor to ceiling window, up high, view up the bay... Wow... Asked for a high room with a good view when checking in - we were close to the top. Walked in the room and the view was amazing... NB if you suffer vertigo - get a much lower floor - or close the blinds. Hotel location is great, eight near union square, trams are 200 metres away. This was a great pitstop for 2 nights on our whirlwind tour of US & this hotel was comfortable & friendly. 5 stars because I ignored factoring in the service (or lack of) from the lounge bar in lobby. NB all other staff were amazing. But we usually are happy with ebbs & flows of happenings. Not demanding, just wanting good service but realise not everyone can be 100% all of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Good Enough for a Quick Stay”
Reviews.Author: VancouverCDN_travlr
Reviews.Content: This was a serviceable hotel - the rooms, while slightly dated, were spacious and clean. It was well-located, within walking distance to all the attractions at Union Square and close to the cable car. Housekeeping was inconsistent with replenishing amenities. On one day, they didn't replenish at all and for two girls with long hair, that was a big no! I also, unfortunately, got my wallet and cell phone pick-pocketed at a busy part of town and the hotel staff were not extremely helpful. I probably wouldn't stay here again, unless that rate was rock-bottom and only if I was passing through San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Clean place, prime location and good value!”
Reviews.Author: luckytraveller1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin with our two preteen kids and enjoyed it thoroughly. We had booked a room with two queen beds. The linens were fresh and clean. It's a walkable distance to the embarcadero district where a lot attractions are. It's also walkable distance to the Fisherman's Wharf. We parked at the garage right opposite which was fairly reasonable. Overall it was a great experience staying at the Westin. Definitely good value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, excellent staff, not so good hotel”
Reviews.Author: colinl
Reviews.Content: Located close to everything that you might be visiting SFO for, convention center is just a couple of minutes walk. Shops and transport are also close by on Market St. We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights and had a few problems that were all well resolved, but the problems were a real pain. The first was across the hall from the elevator and an electrical cupboard. The room had a very loud electrical hum, I might be sensitive to sound, but this was very loud. We had to move rooms twice to get one that was did nto have this problem. Then this room had broken wired internet access and poor signal for wireless, after a day of messing about it could not be fixed. So we moved room again. We then sent an email to the manager saying that things had not been good for us, this opened up the full customer service machine at the hotel and they went out of their way to get everything perfect for us. Really good solution, nice room etc. So if you have problems here ask to speak to the manager and they will resolve it to your satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: LMCJR
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Westin San Francisco Market Street with a small group of clients who were attending a congress. It´s ideally located in Downtown San Francisco, only 5 minutes walking from Moscone Center and Union Square. You will reach easily all major atractions eather by public transport or walking. The hotel itself is good with very nice staff and facilities. The room is very spacious and the only con I found were the beathroom wich needs renovation. Bed and pillows are great and will ensure a good night of sleep. The breakfast is magnificent with plenty alternatives, fresh juices and fruits. The bar and restaurant Ducca is one of the best in town and it worth a visit. Clients were satisfied with the choice and we can say Westin Marked Street is a good 4* hotel in San Francisco. Will definitely recommend for other clients.

Reviews.Title: “Improved since last time I was there”
Reviews.Author: ccgworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: This property has made improvements since I was last there. Aside front he room not being ready upon arrival for a few hours on a Saturday, the overall experience was good. The woman at check in for elite level Starwood guests was a bit fake and insincere. I'm used to that from my global travels, so I ignore it. Rooms was clean. Great view on a higher floor. Bathroom is a bit small and the towels were horrible. I can't stand small bath towels and that's what this hotel uses. I also think they could use some fabric softener in their laundry. There was free coffee in the room which was great. Wifi is for a fee still (14.95). And a large safe in the closet. The rooms that have a connecting room also have an issue in that you can hear the people in the next room like they are in your room with you.

Reviews.Title: “Just What We Were Looking For”
Reviews.Author: Jon M
Reviews.Content: I got a sweetheart deal for this hotel on Expedia and was glad that I did. The hotel is so convenient, right next to Market Street and near MOMA also and the Moscone Center. It is one block away from major transportation routes on the bus and BART. The front desk personnel were friendly and efficient, all business. I like that. The hotel lobby was busy and uncluttered, as was the front area where taxis pulled in and out. If you drive to the hotel, don't park there and pay fifty dollars plus tips, you should instead turn left on Stevenson Street right after the front of the hotel, and drive down the alley and take the first left into that parking garage where you will only pay twenty five dollars for 24 hour parking. It's clean and very cheap for the area. We loved it. The room was very clean, and she upgraded us to a Starwoods Preferred Room, on the corner of the building. It was very quiet, and so modern and attractive. We had a fabulous view and the bed was very comfortable. The amenities were great! I would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to SF. The only problem with this hotel is that it is close to Market Street, and there is a lot of questionable activity on that street, so just try to avoid that and you'll be fine. It close to Union Square and all the shopping too. For the price this hotel can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Service at its best!”
Reviews.Author: JohnGaltOK
Reviews.Content: Thank you for a great trip to San Francisco! Everyone here was incredibly nice from checking in, to recommending restaurants, to flagging down cabs. The recommendation to bump to the 25th floor was well with it! Thanks again for running a quality hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Starwood Preferred Guest Room was Fantastic with One Exception”
Reviews.Author: Norcaltransplant
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the 25th floor - where the seemingly newly renovated Starwood Preferred Guest (Gold or Platinum Members) rooms are located. Had a room facing Yerba Buena gardens with two queen beds. Rooms were very nice, clean, spacious with high quality furnishings and beds. Very impressive, especially compared to higher end Starwood hotels. On my last day someone checked into the room next door which is adjoined to my room via one of those doors that locks (but can open to connect the two rooms). I could hear EVERYTHING the neighbor was saying on their cell phone and they weren't even yelling. This could have been a major issue and the doors (or walls) need more insulation. Other than that, a near perfect stay. Oh, the floor to ceiling windows make for an AMAZING view throughout the day.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay here if it was the last hotel on earth.”
Reviews.Author: Christopherguzzi
Reviews.Content: If I could give this hotel 0 stars I would, but it's not an option. This hotel treated me and my wife unfairly on so many issues it would take me too long to explain it all. The food was over priced and terrible, the valet service wait took 20 minutes or more and the people getting your car expected a hand out every time, the internet coverage did not work and the charge for this service was expensive, I had to wait 5 minutes or more every time I required service at the front desk, the rooms were tiny, and my biggest complaint was that they charged my room to the wrong credit card even though I gave explicit instructions which card to charge the room to and they refused to remedy the situation when I tried to address it. At one point the credit department wouldn't even return my calls when I tried to escalate the situation to a manager in an attempt to resolve the situation. Suffice it to say that I will never stay at this hotel again and will tell anyone thinking about staying there not to. The only reason this hotel is in business is that it is downtown San Fransisco and people booking stays there do not know any better.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service, good location!”
Reviews.Author: PiaAiko
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Hotel because of its location, and also because we wanted to accumulate spg points. The whole service was very bad, first our online reservation requests weren't meet; we asked for a King bed and we were placed in a double bed room, with a very poor view of the city (other of the perks they sell in their page). When we asked ot be moved to a King bed room, they gave us another Double Bed Room with a better view, but next to the elevator, so sleeping was not easily acomplished. The worst part was the cleaning! They never cleaned the sink, or picked up the towels left out the bathroom, or the robe or anything in gerenal. In general the service was very bad, the staff was unpolite and quite indiferent.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Aroset
Reviews.Content: We had a beautiful room, great view and a perfect location! The price was right and the staff was very helpful. We would definitely stay at this hotel on our next visit to SF.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: DannyRoman
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located, one block from Market St where you can ride troley and buses, close to China Town. The check in was fast and courteus. The room was more than expected, contemporary decor. The bedding was incredible comfy. The breakfast buffet was varied and included many oriental dishes.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel in easy to reach location - nothing extraordinary - no free Wifi :-(”
Reviews.Author: joe1968
Reviews.Content: We booked through priceline and got a corner room at the upper floors with view to the bay for our two nights Saturday to Monday (hotel was pretty much booked). I'd rate this hotel average as there is no pool, jacuzzi or Sauna but we liked the location (why I give 4 Points). Westin Standard refering to "heavenly-beds", bath (tub) and ammenities, room equipement (huge flat Screen TV), ottoman, coffeemaker etc. As usual 4* hotel do overcharge for parking (only valet) and bar (glass of wine 10 bucks!) We missed at least a free Wifi connection in the lobby as the surounding pubs, restaurants (Starbucks) nowadays offers - seems that the management hasn't learnt yet their lesson... Overall I'd recommned this hotel and come back for the same rate (winning bid $90)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, a bit Noisy”
Reviews.Author: prettyon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the heart of it call. The hotel restaurant is only ok, but your within walking distance of a lot of options. It is a big city, so be prepared to bring your ear plugs. Rooms are a bit small, but have about everything you will need.

Reviews.Title: “Awful for business”
Reviews.Author: Melshesh
Reviews.Content: I have had to stay here a few time and at least they are consistent, it is always a bad experience. Noisy rooms, bad service, slow elevators, so so beds. The fact it has a decent rating here makes me question trip advisors quality. Lots of better hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay...”
Reviews.Author: padilladora
Reviews.Content: We just checked out of the Westin Market Street, I was not impressed. Seems this Westin has not been updated as others. The room we stayed on was on the 21st floor but nothing special about it. Room seemed outdated for a Westin. The location was the best figure during our stay in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: joycegal
Reviews.Content: Got a package travel deal online for the President's Day weekend which also happened to be during the Chinese New Year celebration/parade. In fact the parade passed right by the hotel! Only downside was the $40 cab from the airport. On our way back, we took BART for $16 for the 2 of us so this would be my advice if you have small bags. The room was as you would expect from Westin - heavenly bed and all. Nice flat screen TV, great towels, etc. The location really can't be beat! You are just a few blocks away from shopping, restaurants, attractions. We were able to walk to the Wharf and Westfield shopping mall downtown. Other neighborhoods were <$20 cab rides away. There is lots of cheap public transportation everywhere...we just happened to be lazy that weekend.

Reviews.Title: “My Trusted Destination in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: slacker_express
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Westin Market Street San Francisco several times and have never been disappointed. This time, I was there to attend a week-long conference followed by a few days of leisure with my teenage son. The location is great for anything happening at the Moscone Center (a very short walk). I prefer to stay in this part of the city (close enough to Union Square) and take the cable cars or trolleys to the Pier (I'd rather not stay at the Pier). I have found the hotel to be consistently clean and inviting, and the staff have always been friendly and accommodating. The rooms are clean with that nice Westin aroma and beds! While the hotel is some distance from the airport, I have had no problem either using the public shuttles (e.g., Super Shuttle) or the subway (BART). I had no problem bringing my large suitcase to the BART station which was a couple of blocks away. The hotel will also offer transportation, which I have used when traveling with several work colleagues in years past. The Westin Market Street will continue to be my first choice when visiting San Francisco for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: amorace
Reviews.Content: Everything was great. I could walk to many things in the area.

Reviews.Title: “All good, but for one problem ...”
Reviews.Author: 2Travelers2go
Reviews.Content: I echo others comments about the overall experience at this Westin -- Great location, rooms are spacious, beds are super comfy, linens are good, service by staff was fine. The biggest problem I had was my room - it was located right next to the elevator shaft and these things were NOISY! I am not a light sleeper by any stretch, but the noise from the elevators awakened me on several occasions during my week's stay. My room number ended in "16" so imagine they would have the same problem on each floor if the numbering runs the same . Watch out for those rooms and avoid getting stuck with one especially if you are a light sleeper. I did tell them when I checked out and they apologized and said they'd make sure I was accommodated on my next visit. Since it's doubtful I will ever stay in this hotel again, as I was there on business, it didn't really mean much. I suppose I could have complained early on but I did like the view from the room as it was up high. Overall, it was a very pleasant stay but for the late-night elevator noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a great city.”
Reviews.Author: Denyson
Reviews.Content: The Westin San Francisco Market is just perfect located just between Market Street and Moscone Center. Everything is perfect like the internet speed connection, rooms, service, TV and breakfast. The front desk service must be improved and faster.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous hotel conveniently located in a beautiful city.”
Reviews.Author: Stere0
Reviews.Content: Everything was wonderful. Extremely helpful staff. This hotel is within easy walking distance of the BART station, muni streetcar, cable cars and Union Square. Room was quiet, clean & nicely decorated. Great TV. Bedding was very comfortable. Double shower heads provided heavenly shower experience. View from upper floors is spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Execllent Service”
Reviews.Author: csnie
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly, the service prompt, and the waiters at banquest were professiomal, courteous and friendly, far above the usual service. The convention food was very good, but it could have been hotter. Rooms were about average size for the class of hotel and a bit above average for San Francisco. Like most San Francisco hotels it is on the pricey side. It has a good location and we would stay ther again.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, noisy, dirty”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a business trip for 2 nights. I usually stay at Westin's and was never disappointed - usually the rates run above average however room and service are worth it. Not at this hotel. It's expensive (around $250/night w/corporate discount), and the rooms are as average as it gets. My room had a dehumidifier that was on all day/night. It was noisy and started breaking down in the middle of the night. I also found hair in my tub - even after it was cleaned! I protested about this but to no avail. All I got was an "I'm sorry". I also kindly replied to the usual email sent out by the chain after your stay to describe the experience and never heard back. I'm not anti Westin, but i advise you to not stay in this one when in San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at my favourite city”
Reviews.Author: mLambert059
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at Westin SF Market Street. We had previously stayed at this hotel several years ago when it was owned by a different hotel. It was such a vast improvement from the previous hotel at this location. When we checked into the hotel around 4 pm, the staff was very nice in offering us an upgrade to an suite only a couple floors from the top because of my husband's SPG gold status. That was certainly a nice treat. We had an awesome view of downtown and it was quite a view at night. The room was very spacious and the bathroom was more than adequate. Although we only stayed there for a night, it was a night that we would always remember. The hotel was within close walking distance to shops, SF MOMA, Metreon and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: kl1118
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 days, the location is ideal, right next to Chinatown, and to most of the major places in SF. You should not drive in downtown SF, but walk. Just watch out not to go too far after hours, as tenderloins is just a few blocks down. The Hotel is overall good. Clean, nice staff. Though our bed sheets had a blood stain on it, which is a negative. The blanket is a bit hard, so not too comfortable for sleep. The TV is nice. The Restroom is overall clean. IF you are looking for a place in the heart of downtown, this is the place. Easy access from the freeway. I think it's a bit too pricey for the size of the room. But then again most hotels in SF are quite pricey as well

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and City View”
Reviews.Author: KeithLucy
Reviews.Content: A 5mins walk from Union Sq, Macys, Bloomingdales and the famous cable car only a few blocks away. Fabulous hotel in an excellent city. Great serive, clean comfortable rooms. friendly and helpful concierge who offered numerous maps and suggestions for around the city. Check out "Lefty O'Douls" just off Union Sq for food and drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Beds”
Reviews.Author: lindadw60
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Helpful staff. Comfortable rooms. Clean and housekeeping is top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Roadrunners93
Reviews.Content: We spent Christmas in San Francisco and the Westin Market Street was a great find. It was close to everything -- Ferry Terminal, Chinatown, North Beach, etc. For something just a bit further afield -- Castro and Fisherman's Wharf, for instance -- there were transport options galore. Plus, the hotel is only 30 minutes and $8.50 away from SFO airport on the BART! The Hotel was very very nice. The room decor was modern, clean, crisp and airy. The room was really roomy considering that it's right smack in the downtown area. The bathroom was a bit "standard issue" but still more than serviceable. One of the best features was the coffee-maker in the room. There's nothing quite like a hot cuppa that says "welcome home" from the chilly December SF weather! The service overall was good. The PC in the lobby unfortunately was not available for guest use during our stay. That was a really minor problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Place”
Reviews.Author: JetSetter5492
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was phenomenal, definitely a huge plus. The front desk was helpful and the concierge gave us advice for everything. They recommended great places to eat and helped us book our tours. Would definitely stay there again. The one complaint, I wished wi-fi was more reasonably priced. $15+ / night seemed pretty steep but maybe that's common in San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Rooms just ok”
Reviews.Author: Watson72
Reviews.Content: Great location right downtown next to a lot of shopping and restaurants. The room I stayed in was rather small, but it was a corner room and had decent views. Hotel check-in was fast and they let me check in early which was nice. All in all a decent but not luxurious place to stay while in town.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent clean rooms, nice view, and great service.”
Reviews.Author: MrMatthew
Reviews.Content: This hotel has quickly become my favourite in San Francisco. I've stayed here many times and over time it has proven itself to have reliably great service, excellent clean rooms, comfortable beds. There is nothing I can complain about for this hotel other than the price of WiFi which is a big issue for all Starwood hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Quality is not a 4 star. more like a 3.5 star”
Reviews.Author: HESUS318
Reviews.Content: I recently visited San francisco and scored a room here off of priceline. I am a starwood preffered member did not get an upgrade. Parking was about $50 bucks a day which i feel is standard i guess. As i stepped into the lobby it had a nice scent with fresh flowers. The lobby was very clean and the staff was very friendly. So check in was smooth and i was on my way to my room. I was located on the 5th floor with the view of an Alley. For a nearly empty hotel i would of thought an upgrade would of been courteous. But the view didn't bother me that much. The rooms were on the small side. Ive been to Le Meriden, Hotel Nikko, the Marriot down the street and they are probably double the size of the room. The rest room was very tiny with an awkward design. The shower was yellow all around the tub area which was disgusting for a 4 star hotel. Overall i would praise the location because its pretty central to everything. But i wouldn't pay more then 80 bucks to stay here. The Value just isn't there.

Reviews.Title: “thank-you thank-you thank-you”
Reviews.Author: no-bckpckng-plz
Reviews.Content: very central, 1/2 block away from bart, and only 2 blocks away from union square. booked a manager's special which was for rooms between floors 1 - 7 and was generously upgraded to the 33rd floor with a view of alcatraz, golden gate bridge and union square. only 1 minor problem...could hear the elevator going up and down all through the night...lucky me...earplugs; however with such a beautiful view and for the price i paid...i am not complaining.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL EVER A+”
Reviews.Author: kirstibabie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here about a year ago and it was by FAR the best hotel I have EVER stayed at they went above and beyond to give us great service they also gave us a complimentary upgrade so we got the 31st floor. I would recommend this to anyone who is traveling to SF you won't be disappointed! They even put an extra mini bar in our hotel room for our drinks! Now thats what you cal service! Thanks Westin on Market Street for making my trip amazing!!!!!!! I will be staying here again when I go back to San Fran!

Reviews.Title: “A safe bet for Union Square location”
Reviews.Author: TravelbugX50
Reviews.Content: Booked for Westin Saint Francis Union Square on the internet site,but did not book myself,arrived by taxi from SFO was informed by the reception of the wrong booking and we were not the first one today to make this mistake.Reception was very nice about it that we feel not a fool. No wonder the rate was much lower. So took a taxi again to Westin Market Street,a three block away. Hotel itself does not look as grand. Look like a 3 star plus business hotel on an off street.A little on the less side of service level.Besides the good value for money,do not expect a full four star ambience and feeling and room niceness and service. Location is central and most union square address are within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Pay attention to your guests”
Reviews.Author: packfan2
Reviews.Content: In town along with 40,000 others for the Kraft Bowl at AT&T Park. Quite a celebratory occasion. The bar and restaurant closed around 11 Saturday and Sunday--game was on Sunday. We received and Irish coffee and Keoke coffee without any cream--just black coffe and liquor--they claimed to have run out. . . Many of us were hungry after the game, but had to go elsewhere for a quick bite. Valet departure on Monday took 45 minutes. Location is ideal and rooms are clean, comfortable and fairly spacious. Not a fan of the mini-bars with the scales and automatic charges.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed, noisy”
Reviews.Author: JuneauGirlNevada
Reviews.Content: Upon checking in, the front desk clerk said "you booked through Expedia?" No I booked through hotels.com. It wasn't a bargain at $150 a night. The room I was given was extremely noisy, right by the elevator and you could hear the elevator all night long. Front desk wasn't helpful. Like other Westin's I've stayed in, the beds are wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if you get the right rate.”
Reviews.Author: Vegasvet
Reviews.Content: I've got a stunning rate of 109 USD per night plus tax while the standard rate would have been 189.00. On top of 109.00 or 189.00 whatever the hotel charges you a 48 dollars per day for the parking !!!! Outrageous !! Do yourself a favor at park around the corner on Mission street for 32 per day. Nice rooms and mattresses,I really like the Westin style. WIFI was extra at least at my rate,I really hope for 189 per night you would get that for free....

Reviews.Title: “Will be returning to Westin Market Street our next trip.”
Reviews.Author: weddinghoneymoon2011
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Westin Market Street. The location was prime...walking distance to lots of shopping, Pete's coffee and Starbucks, and variety of food choices nearby. Our first day in San Fran we walked to the Ferry Terminal and had a relaxing afternoon with lunch on the patio, some window shopping at the market and wine tasting. The rooms at the Westin were clean and comfortable, service was good. The restaurant in hotel restaurant was a little bit pricey but conveniently located when we needed to have dinner at 10pm at night after a long day of sightseeing. We visited early August and it was unusually cold. 13degree celsius. I had to go buy extra sweatpants and a jacket from the Nike store to stay warm. Speak to the people, they said it doesn't start getting summer warm weather until September...Indian summer. The extra clothes came in very handy on the Hop on Hop off city bus tour and our trip to Alcatraz. it gets pretty windy on the island. We also rented a car and spent 1 day in Napa. The wineries are great...V. Sattui is a must visit. Definitely do a deli lunch and some wine tasting there. We did a lot during our 3 day trip...can't wait to go again. And we will definitely be staying at the Westin Market Street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay & Wonderful Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: llbc885
Reviews.Content: I am so surprised and the negative and various types of reviews. We booked two rooms for 4 nights over the christmas holidays. Check in was quick, friendly and they bumped us to the 27th floor. Wonderful suggestions for restaurants. Comfortable rooms and a fantastic location at a very good rate. I can't say enough. At our final check out my daughter asked the front desk where the drinking fountain was and the clerk graciously handed her a bottled water, she was so surprised. We will definitely be back. My ownly issue was while we were there the business center was closed so i couldn't check email but that's it.

Reviews.Title: “Overall stay was good, but.....”
Reviews.Author: mathildaproost
Reviews.Content: A room above the 4th floor (view of hotel roof directly outside the window as well as surrounding buildings) would have been much nicer, after all aren't we here for the views? The bathroom was tinier than Tokyo hotel bathrooms. Also, the outrageous parking fee of $50/night was quite the shock. Granted I expect to pay when staying at 4-star hotels, but then I expect a better hotel experience. This visit didn't quite live up to those expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I lived at the Westin--”
Reviews.Author: dstrosnider
Reviews.Content: We love San Francisco and Staying here makes it even better!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing customer service! Will be coming back!”
Reviews.Author: Onenewsgirl
Reviews.Content: I wish I could speak to the quality of the actual hotel, but as I had to cancel my trip I can only comment on the customer service at the San Francisco Westin. I booked 5 nights here in the beginning of October for a stay during Christmas time. Through the Westin website I found a great rate that required prepayment along with no cancellation or modification. Just fyi, the rate on the Westin site was better than Orbitz, Travelocity, Hotels.com, etc… so it's worth the time and effort to double check the hotel's website before booking. Well the day before we are to leave for San Francisco, my partner injures his back throwing some kids around on the bed. At first it seemed as if it was just a strained muscle but as the night wore one it was clear he was not going to be able to travel, he could barely get out of bed to walk around! I cancelled all of our reservations (air, car, restaurant) but when I got ready to call the Westin I recalled my reservation was not able to be cancelled or changed. But I thought perhaps I could just move the reservation a few nights… possibly if my partner's back felt better we would still make it for part of the trip and extend out a few more days… maybe someone would be in a kind mood as it was the holiday season. I ended up speaking with three different people before I talked to Justin the front desk manager. First, the 800 number customer service agent… she tried to adjust the reservation but was unable. Very nice and advised I call the hotel directly. I then spoke with someone from the hotel's reservations desk and she also attempted to change my booking with no luck. She suggested talking to the front desk directly. When I reached the front desk they passed me over to the manager. He couldn't have been more pleasant. I told him I was aware that my reservation was pretty much carved in stone, but that perhaps they could just modify it somewhat so I wouldn't be stuck with a large bill for a hotel stay that never took place. Justin went beyond that and offered me a full refund. Not once did he nor anyone I spoke with from Westin ever say my reservation absolutely could not be changed. No one had a "too bad" attitude, in fact just the opposite, everyone made a sincere effort to help even though it was quite clear from my reservation that I wasn't allowed to cancel or change it. To be honest I was not expecting this at all.
