I'm not sure they would have been so helpful had I booked through a third party site, as I've heard many stories citing that hotel staff is unable or unwilling to make certain changes when reservations are booked through alternative sites so I'm glad I booked through Westin.com. I am sad I missed out on staying at the Westin but most certainly plan to book here again when I go back to San Francisco. Thank you for your kind holiday spirit Westin San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Great base to explore the city”
Reviews.Author: paroncider
Reviews.Content: We only had a couple of days to explore the city and I'm glad we opted to stay here. This has none of the tackiness of Fisherman's Wharf and there's great shopping and cable cars nearby. The rates were reasonable and the rooms We had a car with us, but only needed it when wanting to travel outside the city. If you want to avoid the valet parking at the hotel, there's a very reasonable alternative across the street for $21. The only downside to our room was we didn't have any armchairs, just the single desk chair -- although there was plenty of room for some! As there were two of us in the room, we had to sit on the bed. We didn't have time to sample the hotel's amenities, such as restaurants or gym; we were out exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Comfortable Rooms”
Reviews.Author: tepp
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to the BART station and easily accessible from the SFO airport. Rooms were recently updated with comfortable beds and modern bathroom. We had a room on one of the top floors with a great view, but it was located close to the elevator and there was some noise from the hallway. The hotel is walking distance from many stores, cafes and restaurants. We were disappointed that the hotel did not offer 24 hour room service.

Reviews.Title: “Top quality Westin”
Reviews.Author: MadisonsTravels07
Reviews.Content: I'm a big fan of Westins in general, and this one is top notch. This is my second year staying here for a conference at Moscone, and I plan to keep staying here in the future. The service is consistently excellent; the staff are knowledgeable, helpful and actually pleasant to interact with. The location is excellent. And the rooms are quite comfortable, have a great view and are generally quiet. My one issue this year is that my room didn't feel 100% clean, but I think I'm just being picky. Last year, I had to get a heavy box of items from my hotel room to the convention center, and planned to catch a cab around the block because the box was too heavy to carry that far. The bellman rolled my box on one of the Westin carts all the way to the front door of Moscone so I didn't have to have the hassle. It's that kind of service that will keep me coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in all of SF.”
Reviews.Author: BigJackNY
Reviews.Content: We saw a great rate on-line and it was matched by the person we called. The hotel is big and busy but every person said hello and made us feel welcome. The location is walking distance from most everything we like and luckfully we did not bring our car as parking is $54 dollars per day. The hotel has very little in the way of food offerings but we ate at CPK across the street and there is sweet liquor store right the left when you walk out the door. We did have a burger from Room Service and it was cooked perfect and got there fast. Worth the $24. The water pressure in the room was a little on the weak side but it made me feel green using less water. The wi-fi was not free but I was able to use google to search for free. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, convenient to Market Street and close to BART”
Reviews.Author: halldlee
Reviews.Content: I had a very nice stay at the Westin. It's just off Market street and within walking distance to lots of shopping and dining. A car isn't necessary if you're taking the BART train back and forth from the airport. The staff was courteous and friendly and the room was very comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “So near and yet so far”
Reviews.Author: Mishia55
Reviews.Content: I am trying to write this review with an intermittent internet connection which I am being charged $14 a day for. This hotel has a lot going for it but it fails on so many levels when it comes to service. From the very rude valet to the lack of attention to detail: 1. Torn do not disturb sign that keeps falling off the handle and which house keeping keeps placing on the desk in the entry way yet never bothers to replace. 2. A mini bar that's not refilled - same goes for the shampoo and conditioner bottles 3. Not enough plugs for connecting computers, ipods etc near the bed 4. Unplugged power bar in the desk which makes it seem that the coffee machine is broken 5. In room guide that someone's kid decided to use as a colouring book and finally .... the terrible internet connection! I understand that the points mentioned above might seem petty but when you're staying for more than 4 days they start wearing you down and you just get frustrated by it all. I've stayed at many a Westin in my time and this hotel doesn't deserve the name. If it wasn't for the heavenly bed I would have checked out long ago.

Reviews.Title: “In the action...”
Reviews.Author: NG_Travel
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the westin... Quick check-in/check out... Comfortable bed, magnificent view of SF...Quiet hotel. no noisy housekeeping in the morning and a good gym...Starbuck cofee in the room...The location is great, close to the action and close to the BART (Montgomery) station...

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a criminal for asking for a quiet room... On Thanksgivings Day...”
Reviews.Author: tripuna
Reviews.Content: Probably one of my worst experiences in 3 decades of traveling. Upon arrival I requested a quiet room with 2 queen beds. The room I was given was right next to the elevators and electrical room. Also the fan in the bathroom never turned off, probably to muffle the elevator noise. After the first sleepless night, I called downstairs for another room... I was then given the choice of either another room across from the elevator (a connecting room) or a room on top of the external ventalation fans... I asked to see the front desk manager... He proceeded to give me another option... On the 4th floor... As I opened the door, I notice the previous person had not checked out yet... Good thing I am not a thief... I went downstairs again, only to be given another option of the room directly next to the gym... All the while, I was pretty much being yelled at by the front desk manager... He kept saying he wanted to see my confirmation to see what class of room he should give me... Appparently he was very offended by the fact that I prepaid thru expedia... When I finally had my tantrum (after 4 pleas for a quiet room) he told me that he would be happy to check me out and put me out... I was horrified... This all happened in front of my 10 year old daughter... She was so nervous all day... Thinking we would not have a place to sleep that night... I travel often for business and pleasure, within US, Europe, Mexico and Asia, but this was by far the worst service I have ever experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for exploring the city”
Reviews.Author: RTWCPT
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great located in the city center. Frindly employees and the rooms are very clean. If you luck you get one with a stunning view. Friendly reception and the concierge knows his city. Also the Hotel Restaurant is hip for not only hotel guest. Definitely a place to recommend for exploring the city and for shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Well rested!”
Reviews.Author: AMperson
Reviews.Content: I slept very well. The staff were friendly and the place was clean. The beds were comfortable and the little extras made it the perfect place to stay. The clock radio was even an iPod charger.

Reviews.Title: “Excellently located luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: kmalho
Reviews.Content: I've travelled to San Francisco many times while working for a software firm headquartered there; while also visiting the city on a number of occasions on road trip vacations. This hotel, from my experiences at others in the city, is the best for both vacation and business. On this occasion it was a family road trip with members of family having never visited either San Francisco or the USA. So the location was great, very near shopping, Union Sq and other tourist attractions. What I particularly liked about this hotel was the locality to a variety of restaurants and convenient stores. California Pizza Kitchen is directly opposite, Chevys is 2 blocks down, a liquer store next door & CVS round the corner. Two down sides - 1. Car parking is extremely expensive. For the full-size SUV we had wouldve cost us $45 a night. I knew this prior to travelling to SF so dis a bit of homework on parking lots on the area. I found one 3 blocks down for $15 a day with in/out privileges. 2. Room sizes can be a bit small for 4 people in a two queen. Otherwise an excellent hotel with great service from all the staff throughout.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok...”
Reviews.Author: SeriousSDTraveler
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I at the Westin Market Street based upon availability. The Oracle Conference was in town and rooms were scarce, but we secured a reasonable rate online for a weekend getaway. Upon arrival (using BART), the evening staff kept giving us poor directions when we dialed for help arriving at the hotel. After roaming the city on our own after a late night flight, we found the hotel with no thanks to the front desk. Upon our arrival, we were booked into a room next to the housekeeping corridor. So we woke up early each morning by the sound of rolling carts just at the headboard of our bed. The onsite restaurant was a convenient selection for breakfast, though a little pricey. The concierge was helpful when we wanted to take a city tour via bus. The stop was conveniently located at the fire hydrant just outside of the hotel. (Cars overflowed on the street and valet area) not leaving much area to stand and wait. But the real surprise we found was at check out on Sunday, when we had charges for parking a car, when we didnt have one. We had to wait for the front desk to call to valet to verify that we didnt have a car. We already knew this because we had to take BART (public transit) back to the airport with no directional help from the front desk. We got the charges taken off, but it wasnt cool being charged for something without verifcation that the charge was even valid. The location was great and convenient, but the experience left us wanting more from another weekend trip to San Fran...

Reviews.Title: “Not opulent but a great location just off Market, good value too!”
Reviews.Author: Montza
Reviews.Content: Why stay here? If you want an affordable name-brand hotel that is as the label describes it at a reasonable price - the Westin on Market is for you. The Market/Third area is the perfect place to stay, just a short stroll from the shops @ Union Square and a few blocks from the ever-cool South Beach area. You'll find this is much more fun than staying in the financial district - even if you're on business. The room was rather spacious - Big screen LCD TV with heaps of channels inc. HD, great view and very comfortable bed... Very well maintained, clean and tidy. The bathroom was a bit of a let down, tiny and combined bath/shower a little frustrating. Not much in the way of amenities - not even a robe (maybe too many get stolen!)... It might not be the jewel in the crown of San Francisco hotels (and there are hundreds to choose from), but it is just what I was after. I would put the rating at 4 stars and would definitely stay here again. Tip: Ask for a room away from the elevators. My colleague had some excess noise from the lift-well and changed rooms during his stay to get a better sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel a bit dissapointed with the service”
Reviews.Author: mich408
Reviews.Content: The Westin Marketplace has all the trappings of a great hotel, they just consistently lacked in the service department. My stay was paid with using SPG points, maybe thats why they didnt feel the need to go out of their way? Front desk was cold, unfriendly, put us in a room that was basically a closet (I guess all the rooms ending in 22 are like this I was told later). After asking for a regular room they did accommodate us quickly. We ate at the restaurant for Sunday brunch. The quality and the taste of food was delicious ($23 per person) but we had to seat ourselves and get up to pour our own drinks. One day they ran out of newspapers at 8am and told me to go buy my own at the 7/11 down the street. Disappointing as it was pouring rain and they had no umbrellas to offer me. On the positive side the place was very clean, the beds very comfortable and the views from the top floor amazing. Internet is an additional $14.99 per night unless you are platinum spg member.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kindredspirits
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 restful nights here beginning Oct. 20th. The hotel generally was OK, the rooms were nice typical Westin rooms and the location was very good. The entrance area and lobby was pretty dull, it seems as if they spent more space and time designing the bar area (which is hidden from the lobby by an imposing wall) which left the entrance area unfortunately barren and cramped. The staff for the most part were more cordial than congenial compared to most places that we have stayed, although there were some nice exceptions through the stay with morning greetings and a doorman opening the door, but these were well received anomalies for our stay. Also, we only approached the concierge once, early in the trip, and was so put off by the interaction that we chose not to visit again. We were the only ones there, there were two attendants available, and our questions were pretty basic, primarily regarding the Muni system. That was very disappointing. All the above were minor detractions for us, and when Geraldine at the front desk provided assistance by obtaining a different room for our last night we were most appreciative. In fact, it was one of many highlights of our overall trip. You always hear about 'one bad apple' ruining things, but one good apple can help obscure those things mentioned above. Very nice. If you are planning on staying here, here are some specific tips: Try to get a room on the highest floor possible if you enjoy great views. We stayed on a lower one, then the higher one and the difference is amazing. Many Muni connections are less than a block away, including the retro F-line streetcars that cruise up and down Market Street, and take you directly to the Wharf. Bart is a couple of blocks, depending on where you exit the station. (The Montgomery station itself is a couple of blocks long!) Having a good game plan here will save lots of walking with luggage. The hotel isn't on Market itself, it's about an 1/2 block off, down 3rd street. We found the location to be excellent. There is a nearby Starbucks, and a little French Cafe just around the corner to get you going in the morning. Also, directly across the street is much more affordable parking. Be aware though, there are 2 garages across the street. One offers 24 hour parking for $20 while the other one claims to be $21. The $21 rate ends at 6am(regardless of when you enter) and begins again to charge at a rate of $5 per 20 mins. You may think you're getting a deal, but...... I forget the names, but the better one is the one with the large "P" sign that you actually park your own car, keep your keys and pay the attendant on the street level before you return to your car. Parking in SF is expensive, we only rented a car for our day trips to the coast and Napa and used Muni for everything else. It's very easy and convenient. One final tip....if you do rent a car, either rent a car with a navigation system or bring yours from home. You will greatly appreciate it as SF is pretty difficult to navigate on our own. Enjoy San Francisco, it's a pretty amazing place!

Reviews.Title: “A fair but not great hotel in the center of downtown San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: DrMitch
Reviews.Content: I spent four days at the Westin. Hotel is about 33 stories and is located just off Market street in the center of downtown San Francisco. The city is small and can be walked easily but being in the center is that much more convenient. The entry is ordinary. Check in was under staffed so took a little longer than it should. Bell station was also under staffed. Staff were polite. Room was nice. Bed was very comfortable. Beautiful view of the city through a floor to ceiling window. Desk area was well set up for serious computing. However, be aware, that like other expensive hotels there is a substantial fee to use wired or wireless internet (best going down the street to Starbucks and getting the service for free). Internet is free for platinum members but not Gold members (I have been an SPG Gold member for years but cannot recall any special perks that come with it). There is even a charge to print out an airline ticket in the business area (I logged on via my Blackberry and printed the ticket at the airport rather than paying such unreasonable fees). LCD TV with HBO and many channels. Had Starbucks coffee in the room. Bathroom was spacious enough. I had room service and ate in the restaurant. The service was very good, the food was also very good but the assortment was limited. I paid $234/nt internet rate. Overall, nothing particularly special or annoying about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, terrible service”
Reviews.Author: kazoo9191
Reviews.Content: We arrived for a conference in downtown SF. The hotel lobby was dark, the bellmen didn't volunteer to help us into the lobby, we had to approach them to store our luggage, as our room was not ready. We went to get something to eat, but the restaurant was closed, so we went to the bar, where we were told we could get sandwiches and snacks. We sat down at the bar only to find that they quit serving at 2pm (it was Sunday), and it was now 2:05pm. So we went across the street to get a pizza. We did eat at the restaurant one evening. The waiter came up to us and told us all the things they didn't have! I almost closed my menu and left to go get more pizza! We had a salad and gave up after that! Our room was very nice, no complaints about it. We found it quite comfortable. We came back from a day of wine tasting the next day with a case of wine, however, and had to get our own rolling cart out of the lobby to get all of our stuff back into our hotel room. Not one bellhop offered to help us! So we rolled the cart upstairs to our room! And piled our luggage on it the next day (it was still outside our door)!!! The lobby is dark, dreary and needs some work, and the bell hops are terrible if you need help with luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Westin”
Reviews.Author: laurengucsb
Reviews.Content: While we don't live far from SF, we've been spending most weekends looking for an apartment in the city so as I was arrived on a late flight Friday night, we decided to head up and spend the night. We've stayed at many of the Starwood hotels in SF, but hadn't stayed here before, but if the price is right in the future, this will be our new spot. We arrived late and left our car - which is a big downside of the hotel, $54/night parking, which I have to say, is probably about right for hotel parking in the city, but still ridiculous. I forgot to turn in the public parking lot which is just around the corner and will probably charge you half as much. Although check in took a little while, the guy came back telling us he was upgrading us to a suite. We have a lot of Starwood points, and were using them this time, so often we get upgrades, but we were thrilled nonetheless, especially since we hadn't gotten a suite upgrade in the past. The room was actually a handicap accessible suite so there were certain differences, but nothing that bothered us. There wasn't a tub but that wasn't a problem for us. There was a large sitting area with double couches, TV, desk, etc, then a good size bathroom and a separate bedroom. The beds are always good - i think we'll buy the heavenly bed for our house when we finally move. We ordered room service for breakfast the next morning and it was very good, although I would say that for the price, they skimp on the sides. There were about 3 potatoes, one strawberry and half a fig. Everything was good though and the bacon was excellent. It came very quickly. Not much more to add here as we just stayed the one night, but the location is great for Yerba Buena stuff, as well as market street shopping and you can walk to the embarcadero. We're actually staying at this hotel again later this week/weekend so hopefully it will be a good experience again.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Westin service”
Reviews.Author: SoCALcanuck
Reviews.Content: Great location and all the usual Westin aspects. I arrived very early on my arrival day and the front desk was very accommodating and helpful in getting me into a room as early as possible. Only issue I had was the WiFi was weak in the rooms and if it was free I wouldn't complain but paying 15 bucks a day for it is a joke.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: ocdemo
Reviews.Content: It is rare that you get this kind of service these days but on our last trip to San Francisco my wife, who is six-months pregnant, slipped and fell near this hotel. Jose Luis who works at the Westin happened to be outside enjoying his break. He ran over and helped me and my wife and my hysterical three year old who was worried about her mommy. He helped us to the carport, ran to get bottles of water and then got a wheelchair after my wife fainted. He helped us inside and helped calmed our daughter down. He retrived bandages for my wifes knee which was bleeding and even got one for my daughter who insisted she was also hurt. He was calm and professional and very friendly. Kudos to Mr. Luis. He should be employee of the month at least. I asked my meeting planner to switch my upcoming staff retreat to this hotel because of him. Thank you Jose, My family loves you.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mm003007
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on our honeymoon and really enjoyed it. We were treated very nice by everyone especially the front desk. The only complaints we had was the noise outside and the outrageous price's in the mini bar.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful views”
Reviews.Author: dedicated-doctor
Reviews.Content: we stayed on the 27th floor and the view was magnificent. I read other reviews about the service but cannot comment since the short interaction at check-in and check-out was "short" and professional. I would definitely advise. The beds, bedding and pillows are excellent

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...Classic Westin Style”
Reviews.Author: vass33
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location in downtown. You can hail a cab easily and get to any part of the city in no time. There is a great outside area where you can have a drink by the fire pit and a nice lounging area (with the coziest chairs/sofas) in the lobby where we would go to relax after a long day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with Spectacular Views!”
Reviews.Author: Moyockian
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. I got off the BART and came right out to Market Street where the Westin was located. The staff was extremely friendly; especially Rich. I stayed on the 19th floor facing the Moscoe Conv. Center. You could see the rolling hills and the bay in the distance. The bed was comfy and the room was clean. I never noticed any noise in the hallways. The elevators were fast and the hotel bar area was nice. I reccommend sitting outside around the fire pit in the evening. Wish that they offered free internet. That would be the only negative.

Reviews.Title: “Nice views but terrible service”
Reviews.Author: alphabetsoup2010
Reviews.Content: I am an SPG Platinum member and have probably stayed in 40 different Westin properties around the world, and this is one of the greatest disappointments. The infrastructure is good - great views, decent rooms, good location and the trademark Westin white tea scent everywhere - but the service is abominable. The doormen are rude; the front desk staff are inexperienced and snarky (if someone from the Westin is reading this I'd be happy to provide more detailed feedback); and the folks on the telephone are curt and unhelpful. It's a real shame to see a hotel that has all of the "hard infrastructure" right squander its potential with careless and poorly trained "soft infrastructure" - i.e. human resources that leave a bad impression with guests. My advice: invest more in front-line training that emphasizes listening skills, a problem-solving attitude, and standardization in service operations.

Reviews.Title: “The best business hotel of 2010”
Reviews.Author: Captain_Starwood
Reviews.Content: Terrific room: -immaculately clean -large -wonderful toiletries -fantastic Westin Bed -Great view of the city -easy check-in/check-out. Free internet for SPG Gold. -nice workout room

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: Aventurer321
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for just one night but definitely enjoyed my stay. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. gave me some great recommendations on places to get food in the area. Had breakfast at the hotel restaurant with my colleague before our meeting. Food was delicious, a bit pricey, but good. Woman in the business center was an absolutel lifesaver! When my laptop wouldn't work she helped me put together my presentation and get everything printed out in time. Loved my room. Very spacious and clean. Super comfy bed. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive for bare bones room and service”
Reviews.Author: ddw99
Reviews.Content: Despite costing $300 per night, the room felt like a cheap motor inn. The bathroom had a shower only (no tub) and a small sink with very little counter space to put your toiletries. My room was noisy - continuous sound of the elevator , TV in the next room, traffic, phone ringing at 4 am. Internet and parking will add extra $60 each day. Prominent and tacky display of candy bars labeled "feed the body, nourish the soul" with the warning that if you remove one, it will cost you between $4-5 (plus 9.5% tax) and will "appear on your hotel account within 10 seconds". I have stayed in several other hotels in SF which were much better. I chose the Westin this time because it was located near the convention I was attending but would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location but beware car parking charges ...”
Reviews.Author: Saffyhound
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a central location. Rooms to a high standard and the service was excellent. Special mention to the chap originally from Manchester who helped with the luggage - very nice to speak to you. Only two downsides: (i) parking - there's no car park and you must use public parking or valet parking, the latter will set you back about $50 a night; (ii) no free wifi -what is it with some hotel chains that don't offer this? There's a Starbucks over the road if you need wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bed, Small Bathroom”
Reviews.Author: SwimAndSki
Reviews.Content: The Westin San Francisco Market Street is a comfortable hotel located just off 3rd and Market Streets with easy access to Moscone Center, downtown attractions and shopping. The hotel is relatively new and still feels fresh. There isn't much of a public space indoors except for a couple small lounges but there's a great outdoor bar and patio with fire pits and heaters that's a perfect place to grab a drink after a long day. As with every Westin, the Heavenly Beds are clean and comfy. There is a nice desk and flat screen TV in each room. What surprised me most is how small the bathrooms where. It's the typical sink, toilet, tub/shower combo crammed into a small space near the room entry. Many hotels have the same design but I was surprised that since this is a newer property, more attention wasn't given to the bathroom design. It's always frustrating when you have to close the bathroom door just to be able to move around. There was also no furniture in the room other than the king bed and desk chair. I would have expected another chair or sofa in a modern hotel room. In summary, the Westin was clean, the service was good, the beds were comfortable but I was disappointed that the rooms weren't bigger, especially the bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice, not only for business travel”
Reviews.Author: jtkJakarta
Reviews.Content: Despite the location close to the Covention Center and business district, it's also a good choice for leisure travel. Union Square and Chinatown are within easy walking distance, Fisherman's Wharf a bit farther but subway stations are close by. Good shopping on Market Street and around Union Square. The hotel is well maintained, very good service. Had a big room with a decent view. Parking in the building is expensive, but right across the street is a public garage at half the cost. Will certainly stay there again if travels bring me back to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Another great Westin”
Reviews.Author: klumein
Reviews.Content: My wife and I like the relaxed, comfortable atmosphere at Westin, and choose to stay with them regularly while travelling. The Westin Market Street did not disappoint! Hotel staff were friendly, the room was spotlessly clean and well appointed, and the location can't be beat - close to all sorts of public transportation as well as number of museums and high-end shopping centers. In particular, I would complement the reservations staff, as they managed to get us a good room the same day we were arriving (we had booked at another hotel that we ended up being less than happy with, and decided to switch mid-vacation) for a reasonable price. Thanks you guys! Also, the concierge was able to secure us a really nice rental car on a Sunday morning for a trip up to Napa, with only a 1/2 hour notice. Again, great job! We will definitely come back here our next trip out to the Bay Area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: alpriest
Reviews.Content: From arriving and being given my room key within a minute, to the concierge who recommended a great restaurant (5A5) and bus routes to get around the city it was a great place to stay. I was lucky to be given a room on the 35th floor and the views were fantastic (although not of the bridge). The room was large, clean and had a huge and comfortable bed. Only complaints would be: no free internet ($15/day and it was slow), and the TV was incredibly slow to use. Great location for Market Street shops, china town, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in San Francisco! Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: traveling_cj
Reviews.Content: Everything from the start was great about this hotel - me and my husband got the reservation for reduced price at hotels.com, check-in was very fast, service very friendly, not even mentioning getting free upgrade for higher floor corner room with beautiful city views. The room was very clean, the only complaint would be lack of enough space for keeping the clothes (especially if you arrive with 3 suitcases). The bed was great and the room was not noisy (and this is the most important for us, so we definately would notice if there was some noise from street or other rooms). We did not try hotel's breakfast (was not included in our deal) but it is not a problem as the hotel is surrounded by many restaurants, bars, starbucks across the street, etc (on Mission St or Kearny St). Location is superb, walking distance to Union Square, Chinatown, convenient Bart station, few blocks from Powell Street (cable cars that will take you to Fishermans Wharf, Crookedest Lombard Street and many other). If you have a car I recommend using parking on 5th and Mission St (2 or 3 blocks from the hotel near Yerba Buena) that is much cheaper. I really recommend this hotel and would stay once again. I tried Parc55 before and was disappointed (outdated, noisy). Don't look no furthter - Westin on Market St is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clear hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lyalius
Reviews.Content: Nice service, expecially loved bath supplies with nice smell Clean room with heavenly bad Location in the center, was easy to get on central Market Street It was nice to have a balcony but it seems that american hotels doesn't have it at all or have very rarely

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!! Stunning!! Wow!!”
Reviews.Author: AMoraleda
Reviews.Content: Working and living within a 45 minute drive from San Francisco, it's not everyday that you get a chance to be a tourist in your own local backyard. Sometimes it's fun playing "tourist" in San Francisco. This weekend, James & I had the opportunity to do just that. We saw Wicked at the Curran Theater. We made arrangements to stay in the city and thanks to Justin, we had the 'hook up' at the Westin on Market & Third Street. The view was breath taking! OMG, it's stunning. Needless to say, we had a great time. Sometimes it's fun playing "tourist" in San Francisco. This weekend, my best friend & I had the opportunity to do just that. We made arrangements to stay at the Westin on Market & 3rd. From the valet staff to the housekeepers, all were courteous and friendly. However, there was one person who made all the difference throughout my stay, thanks to Justin Seeto, we had one of the best times in San Francisco. Upon arrival, our room wasn't ready so we decided to go for a late lunch. Justin asked for my phone number so he can contact us when our room was done. I was very, very impressed with the follow through! Having worked in hospitality, I'm always skeptical with the level of service. However, Justin made me feel at ease. Our room was a corner room at the 34th floor. The view was breath taking...it's stunning. We didn't want to leave just because we loved the view so much. The room was very clean, the bed was very comfortable, and the amenities were vey nice. We had to leave for the theater, but I was excited to return to the hotel that evening. When we returned to the room, there was a chilled bottle of champagne waiting for us. It was such a beautiful surprise! Needless to say, champagne and the view made for an amazing end to the evening. Overall, I would not only recommend this hotel to travelers (it's close to public transportation and shopping), but I would definitely go back. Next time you find yourself at the Westin Hotel on Market & Third, please say 'Hi" to Justin, tell him I sent you! The hotel is very lucky to have Justin. Justin, thak you for making our 'staycation' one of the best vacations...ever!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay - once I got past reservation nightmare”
Reviews.Author: scv83
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend at the Westin Market Street. Location, service, and room were all wonderful. We arrived late on Thursday and were immediately upgraded to a room on the 32nd floor - checkin was effortless and took just minutes. Would definitely stay there again. However ... be warned of the reservation process. I made our reservations in June. Various internet sites were all around $142 per night. I called the hotel directly and was quoted a rate of $199. When I asked if they would match the Expedia rate, I was quoted an "internet rate" of $142. The reservation rep told me I could make our reservation at the $199 rate, and as long as I prepaid it 48 hours before arrival, I would still get the $142 rate. When I called the hotel two weeks before arrival, I was given every excuse for them not to honor what the clerk had quoted me. They told me they would "check the tape" on the conversation, which took three days. When they did call me back, I received nothing but a huge run around and a bunch of lies about what the conversation was between myself and the reservation clerk. I asked them to play the conversation so we could both hear it -- and was told very conveniently that was not possible. Very disappointing, because it was too late to find another hotel at a good rate. What was most irritating was they lied. I wish they had just told me outright they would not honor what the clerk told me. Regardless, once I got past that, we had a good stay. The fresh fruit in the lobby on Saturday was greatly appreciated -- it would be a nice touch to have that every day. Kudos to the door man and the concierge staff -- both were extreemly helpful. I just wish the reservation staff were at that level.

Reviews.Title: “Great central hotel - heavenly beds”
Reviews.Author: chrisweger
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in downtown San Francisco. Friendly and helpful staff. Very good location for downtown shopping trips. We arrived with a car, but did not use the rather expensive valet parking - the hotel staff gave us the tip to use the public parking just inside the same block (use Stevenson street, just after the hotel entry, much cheaper for long term) Great sights nearby: SFMOMA is not to be missed. Definite plus: the super comfortable beds - heavenly!

Reviews.Title: “Great, conveniently located hotel”
Reviews.Author: dna7575
Reviews.Content: The rooms are huge by San Francisco standards and the hotel is conveniently located. Plus, the hotel and rooms are contemporary, which is also rare in San Francisco. I'd highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Treated terribly for a 4*!”
Reviews.Author: SteveCasa10
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights (Fri and Sat) at this hotel. The hotel itself is in a great location and very nice. Definitely 4* status. We checked in on Friday night (long day of traveling) and got a room with an additional door (connects to the room next door). Keep in mind the door has about 1/2'' clearance at the bottom. Our neighbors were very loud - it felt like they were in the room with us. We wanted to get a good nights sleep so we called the front desk. They sent up security but that didn't help. We called again and another guard was sent up. Still didn't help. We finally called again (It was already very late) and had to ASK to be moved to another room - they never offered. They couldn't move us until the morning - fine. We slept with the TV on to help drown out the noise. They tell us to bring our bags down in the morning so we do. The next morning, we bring our bags down and then they tell us to bring them back to the room. Lovely. We finally got moved and FINALLY had a nice nights rest. That was problem #1. Problem #2 was on Saturday morning - NO HOT WATER! We had to take a cold shower. What 4* hotel doesn't have hot water? We talked to the front desk and they didn't even apologize for the inconvenience or offer any sort of compensation. Terrible service for such a well known hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for those who are traveling solo or with family”
Reviews.Author: lovehotels82
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with the Westin San FRancisco Market. I had looked at other Westins and felt that I had made the best choice. This hotel has an outside dining area for lunch and a beautiful garden area where one can sit and read or people watch. Because they allow pets it is fun to visit and play with others if you are not traveling with yours. The rooms are large and well laid out. I had two chairs that faced the TV so that I did not have to lay on the bed as in many other hotels. The staff is excellent and very aware of your needs. I did not mind dining alone for many meals. The restaurant seated me at a lovely table and the wait staff came by to make sure all needs were met. The food was good and the menu was large enough to eat several meals there with out running out of things to order. I was very impressed by the front desk and there kindness and friendliness towards me. I stayed 7 nights and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, nice hotel, bad customer service!!”
Reviews.Author: sonalifirehouse
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes on this hotel for the price and name..yet I was dissapointed by the front desk service..almost runied my trip..When we checked in there was Rosalyn at the front desk was friendly yet didnt do her job. Reservation was under my name and i tried to give my friends name to add to the room just in case we seperated yet had to remind her three times.The worst part was she gave us a golden key card holder with checkout time at 4pm and I verified with her and she confirmed it. when it came to the checkout date we recieved a bill and when I went down she was there and she said she was going to correct the mistake on the room service. When i double checked with her about the checkout time she said it was a mess up because the hotel was busy and we had to checkout at 1PM. now we had already booked a tour to leave and be back by 4pm. We called supervisor Jojo and he let us checkout at 4pm. When we came back to the room the key was deactivated and had ro go down again to activate it..nobody told us that we had to reactivate after 12pm for the late checkout.Then when we finally came to checkout Rosalyn didnt correct the room service although she said she would.So its like we had to repeat ourselves so many times because someone isnt doing their job or being careless..If they would it would be a great hotel for sure..

Reviews.Title: “Great location and views”
Reviews.Author: sfogviper
Reviews.Content: My brother decided to join my family at the last minute on this trip, so I had hoped to get a room with two beds at check-in. I looked online right before I got to the hotel and it appeared to be booked, so I wasn't surprised when they weren't able to change my room type. But they immediately offered a free rollaway which worked out just fine. When they gave me the room keys, they told me one of the rooms had a great view. Boy, they weren't kidding. Top floor (36) with a corner room facing northwest and southwest, featuring panoramic views all the way across the city. The only drawback? A queen bed instead of a king. But it was worth it. The only negatives were a little noise in the bathroom from a fan that sounded like it vented directly to the roof, and occasional hallway noise (the corner room was at an intersection with two other rooms). Everything else about the stay was pure Westin - stylish décor, heavenly bed and shower, courteous service. And the location is perfect. I hope to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: jeralde
Reviews.Content: No major complaints. Several website state this property has a pool when it does not. The concierge implied I had misread the website saying "it sorta does and sorta doesn't". This irked me. Not all of our rooms were ready by check-in. The location was good, but will try a different hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Easy access to all the tourist sites”
Reviews.Author: DLannigan
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel in an excellent location with easy access to all the major tourist hotspots The room was typical of a city centre hotel and was very comfortable with great views of the city.Be careful not to eat the goodies in the basket though as they make a hefty charge for these together with the contents of the mini fridge The Concierge was very knowledgible and guided us to the Golden Gate via the local bus route. Slightly disappointing was that they wanted $15 per day for internet access

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE! Highly Recomended”
Reviews.Author: AyeshaZB
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited San Francisco for the first time and this hotel was as good as it gets! It was far beyond my expectations and I was blown away by the suite itself, the views of the city from the hotel, the lobby, the courteous staff and the location. The Westin is located conveniently near a bus stop and is in downtown San Fran. Union square is walking distance. There are so many restaurants and shops within a 5-10 minute walk. Even a HUGE mall. Couldn't have asked to stay at a better location as first time visitors. The suite was breathtaking. The views from our 21st floor suite left me in awe. The room was immaculate, the room had two large flat screen TVs, an amazing dual shower head in the bathroom, clean, fluffy towels, the most comfortable bed with the softest sheets and complete privacy. The staff was courteous and the luggage service was very handy since we had a late flight out of San Fran. The concierge service was extremely helpful as well. The young lady behind the counter helped us book the tours we thoroughly enjoyed throughout our trip! She helped guide us in picking the tours that best suited our needs and above all, picked us up RIGHT in front of the Westin. The Ducca restaurant's breakfast buffet is truly to be enjoyed. The variety of hot food, breads, pastries, fresh fruit, salmon, bagels, cream cheese, soups forced me to go back for seconds. The orange juice tasted fresh squeezed, the coffee was hot, and perfectly brewed. All in all, the Westin made our first trip to San Fran a very memorable experience. I'd highly recommend it to friends and family and hope to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ninga12
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a good location. Only negative is a $15 daily charge for internet. Hard to understand why any hotel still charges for internet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel stay in San Francisco!!! Highly recommended!!!”
Reviews.Author: TAN024
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this hotel !!!.The room was as clean as it can get !!! The view from the room was excellent !!! The heavenly bed is the most comfortable slept in from any other hotels i have stayed in san francisco. Also each room has starbucks coffee which is perfect. The staff is very friendly and attend to every the small needs. Hotel is at a very convinient location from downtown and anywhere i needed to get. Room service is great as well. I will definately stay at this hotel again, totally satisfied with my stay!!! Very Satisfied with our stay, couldnt ask for more.!

Reviews.Title: “Good spot, nice play”
Reviews.Author: widetraveler5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin at the end of June. Great location, easy to get to wherever you want to go. A bit loud outside, especially with a room facing 3rd Street. Not pleased with the adjacent restaurant, just off the hotel lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and remarkable stay”
Reviews.Author: atif08
Reviews.Content: This is easily one of the best places that I have stayed in. The hotel exceeded my expectations in every possible level. The staff were very friendly and cordial. The rooms were very spacious and clean, the elevators were super fast. the location of the hotel is phenomenal and makes it very easy for a tourist to carry out their daily events and sgith seeing. We booked a tour of the hop on and hop off and the bus stop was right infront of the hotel. I would recommend this hotel to you all. It is a great place for a very good price with remarkable customer service. I would give it a thumbs up and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Really liked the Westin”
Reviews.Author: MartinAdrogué
Reviews.Content: I spent a couple of nights at the Westin, prior to a corporate event. It is a classic business hotel, with a nice contemporary decor. The property feels really new and well kept. My room was quite big, the bed was great and there was a huge window with a view of Yerbabuena Gardens. The bathroom was also nice. The location is very good, steps from Market Streets and a couple of blocks away from Union Square. The only drawbacks: no free Internet and no room service after 10.30 pm. I have stayed at the Hilton Union Square before and I really prefer the Westin. It´s newer, smaller and not much more expensive. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The wonderful greeting at check in made my stay feel great.”
Reviews.Author: AndrewAM
Reviews.Content: Although travelling had worn me down that day, I was immediately refreshed by a warm greeting by Ms. Hart, who let me know how much she appreciated me picking the Westin to stay. She was very polite, answered all of my questions, and it set the mood for the rest of the stay. My three nights there were great because I had a wonderful view of the city (I could see Union Square from my room), and I used the hotel's gym that was always fully stocked with towels and complimentary headphones. I will definitely be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “A Westin in name only”
Reviews.Author: KirklandWashington
Reviews.Content: You'll get a good rate, it is clean and it is perfectly located close to BART, the Muni, Union Square, SFMOMA, Moscone and great restaurants. That's the good news. The bad? I have never experienced a more incompetent staff at a hotel of this stature and I stay close to 80 nights per year in 4 start + hotels (W, Westin, Sheraton and Mariott). During my stay, the security staff allowed a bag lady to walk right into the elevator with me and another guest and choose the floor of her liking. When I reported this to the front desk, they did not ask for details (floor and description) but transferred me to the night manager who never answered the phone. The next day, the maid did not fully shut my room door after cleaning it. Finally, when I needed to arrange airport transportation, the front desk clerk claimed only the concierge, who had departed, could do this. She found a night manager who, to quote the front desk person, "can maybe make this happen". Choose the W down the street or the older more upscale Westin St Francis off Union Square. This place is a disaster. It appears to cater primarily to European tourists and conventioneers, both of which expect lower service.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't need a car stay here...”
Reviews.Author: Family_Guy_407
Reviews.Content: Hotel is extremely nice, very convient to most stuff but parking is like $50 a day. Yikes. I think some other folks mentioned the lofty parking prices but they are probably the highest I'd seen in the city. I was there for 4 days and left the car parked the entire time and just decided to walk everywhere. Everything was reasonably close. The longest walk was the Prime Rib restaraunt which it was late so I took a cab back. My office was about 10 blocks and the warf probably another 5 blocks or so. The room was a good size, the bed was comfortable, clean and very hip. The restaraunt was reasonably priced for a swanky hotel. The bus boy kept reminding us when the they closed. Guess he didn't want us holding him up... Our waiter was great and the food was pretty good. I'd definately stay again but I would just take a cab from the airport and walk everywhere or take a cab. Less hassle and cheaper in the long run.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely stay here but definitely park elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: clrh2ofl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on the 4th of July and drove in from the suburbs. I did a little research and found that hotel parking was nearly $50 a night but located the Hearst Garage (literally across the street) for $20 maximum for a 24 hour period. This alternate garage was safe, clean, but closes overnight so you might be stuck without your car in the event you need it while closed. Check in was smooth and the room was clean and comfortable. With regard to the whole Heavenly Bed thing, believe the hype -- easily one of the most comfortable mattresses you will ever sleep on. The room size might be small to those accustomed to larger, suburban rooms but such is the norm for even the fancier hotels (like this one) in dense cities. Nonetheless, it was not a problem. The bottom line is that if you find this hotel for a price you are happy with, STAY HERE! You will be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful concierge made trip a success”
Reviews.Author: RockyN
Reviews.Content: The Westin was a comfortable hotel in a very good location to get to all destinations. Great coffee shop around corner. We were very lucky to use the services of a professional, helpful concierge named Carlee. She made our vacation complete by giving us tips on what to see in Napa and Carmel and obtaining a rental car for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay...Service great...!”
Reviews.Author: BCCanadaLisaCanada
Reviews.Content: To start off, I arrived at the hotel in the morning (9am) and the staff booked my wife and I in a room right away. That has never happened to me before, hotels usually say to come back at 3 to check in. The staff directed us to some great places to eat and gave us great directions to get to them. We stayed on the 14th floor in a room with a great view of the city. I would stay again for sure. Keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, spacious and clean room, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: UrsulaN78
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, spacious and clean room, fantastic location. My favorite hotel in San Francisco. Very professional and welcoming stuff. Reservation staff were very helpful with my reservation. Room they reserved for me was really nice - could not ask for more, with amazing views. Will definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was nice, staff could use improvement”
Reviews.Author: work2hard11
Reviews.Content: Had reserved and paid more for a room on the upper floors after reading the trip advisor reviews. Upon arrival, the front desk seemed flustered in an attempt to find us a room with a king bed that we reserved. Came back with a story about being booked solid and offered us one on the 9th floor. When we stated that we had paid for an upper floor to get away from the street noise, seemed annoyed and "would check with his manager to see if there was anything at all that they could do for us". Miraculously, we ended up on the 31st floor with a king - really, I thought that there were none available?!? And I am a Starwood Preferred Guest.....how would they treat a non SPG customer? The concierge was disappointing as well. Sent us to the wrong place twice to return our rental car and upon calling for assistance again, pretty much stated that there was nothing that they could do for us as it was the car rental web site that had not been updated. Checked it out upon our return to the hotel and the car rental web site was accurate. Not the type of service that I expect or had experienced from a Westin previously. If I wanted to be treated this poorly, I would have stayed at the Red Roof Inn and saved ourselves some money.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Review-but just Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: HPXC
Reviews.Content: I am a Starwood premier member so I try to stay at a Westin or at a Sheraton if I am not staying at a Four Seasons. So in keeping with that I booked a stay at the Westin San Francisco Market Street. I was greeted very freindly by Doorman and a bellman took our bags, from our rental car, but was down hill from there, the person at the front desk said I was in a room on the 36th (top floor) but by the elevator, she said she would move me to the 30th floor away from the elevator, I prefer the top floor but figured she knew best. When I went to my room we were right by the elevator on the 30th floor!?! Our bag never made it to the room, we waited and finaly after about an hour I called the "service express line" and asked when my luggage would be brought up and was transfered to the bell desk with out anything said (rude), the bell desk then asks me what my bags look like!?! They advertise 24 hour room service on their web site but it is not 24 hour room service. Breakfast 6 to 10:30 am, NO lunch service, and Dinner from 4:00 PM to 10:30 PM. I called at 10:00 PM to order desert and was told they had only ice cream for desert, even though their menu had 6 desert items listed. Thje mini bar in the room is automated so if you touch a softdrink or candy bar you are billed immediatly. Problem is they don't make that clear. I had to ask Housekeeping to come to our room to verify we had not taken anything from the mini bar after we got the bill the night before check out that had billed us 100.00 worth of mini bar items we did not consume but moved so we could put soft drinks we bought at 7-11 into the ice box. The service express was not helpful in getting this straighten out. On check out day when we returned to our room, before check out time our key was turned off and would not unlock the door. We had to wait 20 min. security to come and let us in after checking our ID's. Valet Parking was 54.00 per day. I will never stay here again, one of the worst Westin's I've stayed at, but will never again.

Reviews.Title: “unimpressed”
Reviews.Author: NYTraveller2011
Reviews.Content: Previous reviewer was on....was on the 34th floor, very noisy near the elevator. Could hear the vacuums running before 9 am. Rooms were clean. Beds comfy. Staff was courteous. Am sure there are cheaper places that are just as clean & comfy without so much noise! And I'm from NYC!

Reviews.Title: “not impressed”
Reviews.Author: gold-prospector
Reviews.Content: restaurant menu very limited.With 2 year old grandaughter,not 1 dessert on menu.NO cocktail service on patio.Sitting on patio constant stream of homeless asking for money.Would take alot for me to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive for the services I received”
Reviews.Author: dexter9999
Reviews.Content: Was really disappointed in my $400/nite room. Small, 1 king bed and a desk with a chair. Wireless internet is horrible (as noted in many reviews), use the cat5 wire on the desk if you can. Works much better. When I checked in, I was told they had two queen beds in my room even though I was supposed to have a king. I was then told the room with the king was near the elevator. I took it any way and was 5 rooms away from the elevator. The service elevator was closer, but never heard it. I also hate the snack system seen in many hotels that totally rip you off if anything is touched. In this case, the snacks are on top of the dresser. ex. Reese’s Peanut Butter cups $4.00 plus a 20% fee on top of that. Small bottle of water from the fridge cost me almost $6.00 Come on...I know lots of hotels do it, but it's insulting. After paying over $900 for the 2 nights I was there, the best they could do for me was to move my checkout time from 12:00 to 1:00. Best experience I had was the guys at the valet stand. Very helpful every time I left/returned to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pickylady_1
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference and stayed at the Westin. I have asthma and told the hotel that I cannot have feather pillows. They accommodated every need and more. The room was immaculate. They placed an air purifier in my room as well to make my room as allergy free as possible. I cannot thank the management and staff of this hotel enough. In addition, the view was amazing! I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Corner Room and SCRATCHED CAR!”
Reviews.Author: cessnajockey
Reviews.Content: After a LONG drive, we checked in at about 9 p.m., valeted the car and went to our assigned room - a TINY corner room. So much for SPG upgrades. The wait staff who brought our room service confirmed that this was one of the SMALLEST rooms in the hotel. After getting nowhere with the front desk staff on duty that night, we decided to check out the following morning and move to the St. Regis, a sister property to the Westin. Upon checkout, there was an awful series of deep scratches in the driver''s side door of our Grand Cherokee that were not there when we checked in - the car was flawless upon arrival. It looked as if some one had rubbed it hard with a key chain. Of course, it is then revealed that Westin doesn't park the cars and is not responsible for them - The Westin front dest manager on duty said that the separate company who handles the valet would conduct an "investigation' and determine if they were at fault. Nobody ever admitted fault or paid for the damage - it was my tough luck. I wouldn't stay at this location again - the St. Regis or the Meridian are FAR BETTER options if you want to stay with the Starwood group of Hotels - they have better rooms with better views and FAR superior service.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you check your statement on checkout!”
Reviews.Author: JWC1978
Reviews.Content: Precursor: I have been a Gold Starwood Preferred Guest Member since 2006 and I stay at Westin Hotels frequently. Cleanliness: During our stay the room was cleaned daily and we were provided fresh linens and replacement soaps in a consistent and timely manner. The hallways and lobby also appeared well kept. The windows overlooking the promenade could use a good Windex by housekeeping. Location: I was in-town for a conference and this was one of the recommended hotels. The hotel is located in the financial district. During the week the streets were very busy and the hotel was within convenient walking distance to buses and other ground transportation. We also stayed through the weekend and the area became very quiet. The hotel is in a good location if you have business in the area but the hotel would not be my first choice if I was visiting San Fran on holiday. There are a lot of comparable hotels in closer vicinity to the attractions. Rooms: We stayed in a Gold Starwood Preferred Guest suite. The room was what we expected for a Westin Hotel room. Service: Front desk was very friendly and professional. Management could revisit the concierge desk. The gentleman that assisted us with our weekend excursions was not friendly, at all, and gave us the impression we were bothering him. Either he was clearly in the wrong job or he was having a bad day. Value: I used Starwood Points for the week which I believe was 10,000 points a night. The weekend rate was $129.00 which was a terrific rate against comparable hotels. The discounted weekend rate is likely because of its location in the financial district which becomes very quiet on the weekends. Sleep Quality: Bed was very comfortable and thermostat worked fine. Overall: I would "consider" staying at this Westin San Francisco Market Street again but I am not completely sold. I think I read somebody's review, prior to staying there, to put an additional set of eyes on the bill before checking out. I was also warned by the front desk person to double check the statement and sure enough there were multiple charges made to my room from the restaurant, parking garage and Internet service. It was a bit ridiculous. The front desk person removed the charges but I was still charged for parking later on. I did not even rent a car. I put it on my AMEX so they are handling for me but I think management should definitely have a discussion with Accounting as this could be a detractor for future travelers considering a stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room - Noisy Location”
Reviews.Author: CMFM
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice Westin property - the staff are wonderful, professional and helpful. I have passed this hotel many times when visiting/walking around downtown San Francisco and I was looking forward to staying there for a recent business trip. Regrettably, the street and guest noises kept me from enjoying hardly any sleep which really impacted the next day. Room was small but beautifully decorated with plenty of room for a one person/one night stay. I had requested a higher floor away from elevator, ice machine, etc.(online and in person) The front desk person assured me that the 14th floor should be high enough to avoid the noise (wasn't) and I was away from the elevator. Long story short, went to bed at midnight, but guests coming in afterward using ice machine (right across hall) and slamming their doors (why oh why can't people close their doors nicely?). Then, at 4 am the garbage pick up in downtown SF started up. Up and down every street in the vicinity. I know this is NOT in the hotel's control, and I don't know that a higher floor would have helped. But thicker windows and wall insulation would have. It was wretched. If you are a heavy sleeper or are comfortable with wearing earplugs I would highly recommend this hotel. It is very nice and the location is among the best for SF visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Wont Be Staying at a Westin Again__Expedia Travelers Beware”
Reviews.Author: Rosebud_McKinney
Reviews.Content: I am writing this sitting in the hotel right now. I travel to SF 1 - 2 x's a year, staying 5-7 days for business. This will be by 3rd year in row to stay at this Westin--but I will not be returning after this. Normally I book through the hotel direct, but recently my company set a mandate to use Expedia Corporate for bookings. At check-in I was told I would be on the 6th floor. The hotel has 35 floors so I requested a high floor for views--where I normally stay. It was explained that since I booked with Expedia, that I would have to have a lower floor. Being a Starwood preferred guests; I mentioned I should have a complimentary upgrade. The a lady at check in said the best she could do would be a handicap room on a higher floor but it has a queen bed instead of my King reservation. I reluctantly took the handicap room. Upon entry I was disappointed in the hospital/urine smell, no bath tub, and very limited counter space (not even enough for my toiletry bag). However at this point, I was so tired and the desk worker was not in a helpful mood, I decided to move my room tomorrow. The next morning I noticed the room did not have an ironing board. I requested one and it took almost 30 minutes to have it delivered, making me nearly late for my meeting. After lunch my client decided to stop by the hotel lobby for an informal work session. The wi-fi fee is $15 a day--since I had already signed up, I asked the front desk for the promo code for free wi-fi for my client. I was told non-guests were not allowed use of the wi-fi. So I said, "Okay let's try this again...let's say my husband needs Wi-Fi and I have already purchased it, how do we get him a code?" The desk worker said "your husband' would have to buy another wi-fi access. She further explained the fee is per person, not per room. "So let me get this straight, in addition to the $500 for the room, the $100 for parking, and the $75 I have already paid for Wi-Fi, you want me to give you even more?" I thanked the lady for not being helpful and walked away. I was baffled by the lack of customer service that I was not use to at a Westin. After 8 hrs of meetings, I came back very tired thinking a nice bath would be nice--but oh yeah--my room doesn’t have one. So I requested a room change again. Again, I was told I would have to move to the lowest floor since I booked "with Expedia". It was like I had been blacklisted--every time they looked my up and saw I booked through Expedia, suddenly I became someone they didn’t want to help. I truly felt snubbed by each of the 3 desk workers. Customer service is important to me and this hotel has opted to treat certain guests differently so for that reason, I will be checking out and not returning.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: KatieM13
Reviews.Content: We arrived early to San Francisco and we were not only allowed to check in early (11:30am), but were able to upgrade to a room on the 33rd floor with a MUCH better view. It was beautiful! We only had a few days in SF, so we were out experiencing the city most of the time and not in the hotel. The beds were extremely comfortable and everything felt very clean. Nice big flat screen TV and plenty of space in the room to spread our luggage out. GREAT LOCATION!! One surprising perk was that I loved the smell of their bath products! The gym was a little small for the size of hotel, but I went in the morning @ 7:30 and was able to use the equipment I needed. The only negative thing I can comment on is that I thought the towels were pretty uncomfortable...very scratchy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: casadedadas
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend getaway with my husband. We booked using our Starwood Preferred Guest points (great reward program!). The room was standard Westin fare, nothing too exciting, but clean and comfortable. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Chris the concierge helped us time after time with great recommendations. The hotel is easily accessible from Bart (that is the one place where a concierge did steer us wrong. Luckily we followed the directions offered by a homeless woman, whom we tipped. If we'd followed the woman who I'd spoken with at Westin, we would have gone the wrong way. Make sure you have very clear landmark directions...not just "walk forward," as there are several exit points from Bart.) We easily walked to Nob Hill, Union Square, and spent no more than $10 on cab fare. Make sure to explore the MLK tribute behind the waterfall at the neighboring Moscone Center. We'd certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Westin in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: randomlytraveling
Reviews.Content: I always stay here when traveling to San Francisco. This is a nice hotel with convenient access to the financial district and quick taxi service to other tourist areas. The rooms are always clean and are spacious enough for a family. My only suggestion is to request a room that isn't against the elevators. They run all night and might cause some people some lack of sleep. That seems to be my only caveat to this place and I would recommend this to anyone looking to visit San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “Standard hotel with some nice perks”
Reviews.Author: gotmilk8
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin for three nights while at a conference at the Moscone center. I got a special rate of $156 per night which included free wifi. I'm an SPG gold member and was upgraded to a corner room on the 25th floor without having to ask. There was one guy at the front desk who acted like he couldn't be bothered, but the rest of the service at the hotel was great. Their fitness center was free, and had a nice amount of equipment with treadmills, ellipticals, and stationary bikes. There was a full set of dumbells and some other weight machines. Not enough to really get a whole workout in, but definitely enough to tide me over for the time I was there. The hotel is in a great location, about three blocks from the Moscone center, and only about a block from some great food at the Metreon. There's always a lot going on since it's centrally located, and there's great shopping on Market Street which is only about a block away also. I'd definitely stay here again, especially if the price was as reasonable as it was for the conference.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience, highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: drussell64
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Westin San Francisco, and enjoyed my stay immensely. The staff is friendly and courteous, and the hotel is conveniently located to the Moscone Center and Union Square. The rooms are spacious enough - rooms in the city tend to be quite small, of course - and the hotel itself is gorgeous! The bar is outstanding, and is a great place to complete a business conversation. Highly recommended! Make sure to get over to the Tadich Grill! Best food in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Very spacious & confortable rooms. Very rude bar staff though! Fantastic concierge”
Reviews.Author: Eire27
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. We had never visited San Francisco before. Hotel in a nice quiet location. Lots of shops and restaurants nearby. Can walk to Fishermans Wharf but would take good half hour. Open top tour bus stops outside hotel. Hotel is next to bus stop and tram line. Good location for Union Square. We had asked for a room with 2 queen beds and our request was met. Massive room with mini bar and another fridge. iron, hairdryer etc all in room. Big flat screen tv. Had 3 brilliant nights sleep, beds so comfy. Nice clean bathroom with adequate toiletries. We did not eat in the hotel it seemed a bit pricey but we went to the bar one night and as it was near closing time the bar staff were very abrupt with us when ordering a drink and very rude on turning away some customers who had arrived at closing time. The tone taken was uncalled for. I would stay in this hotel again. Oh AMAZING concierge also

Reviews.Title: “Good location but watch your belongings - dangerous lobby”
Reviews.Author: FalconTx
Reviews.Content: Pro's: Good location in the financial district. Nice room. Prompt service from housekeeping when we asked for extra towels. Con's: Outrageous charges for internet access. Housekeeping barged into our room at 8 am the morning we were leaving, without even knocking. Worst of all, left my jacket in the lobby bar for about 3 minutes (forgot it, then remembered it when we got up to our floor on the elevator and returned immediately to the lounge). Jacket was gone (there were some dodgy people drinking their Starbucks in the bar at 11 pm - kind of odd). Staff told me to talk to security and "ask them to watch the video." Security said (multiple times) that there was "nothing on the video." No explanation as to whether that meant the recording devices didn't work/weren't turned on, the cameras in the lobby and lounge are just for show (don't really work at all), they didn't watch the video, they couldn't make out anything on the video (if so, what's the point?), or someone on the staff stole the jacket. Checked with management, concierge and housekeeping multiple times, but jacket was never turned in as "lost and found." The jacket can be replaced, but I would keep a tight grip on my belongings and loved ones while in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Westin”
Reviews.Author: amyandandrew
Reviews.Content: Was upgraded to an end of hall suite. Very large, nice furniture and the service was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: beachtravel
Reviews.Content: A Westin, is a Westin, is a Westin... and I happen to think their beds and linens are comfortable so they are my "go to" chain. Upon check in it was going to be 48 to park (which I knew) and 15 extra for my "oversized" vehicle (Chevy Tahoe) which I wasnt expecting. ugh! A sweet guy mentioned to me quietly that there was a parking garage right nearby where parking for 24 hours was only $25... perfect. THAT's the kind of help I appreciate! :) The hotel was comfortable, clean and we had an incredible view of the financial district that my kids got a huge kick out of. Our room service breakfast wasn't cheap but it hit the spot and their pancakes off the childrens menu got rave reviews from my boys! I love their cofeee and we were all happy. Upon checkout, they offered to hold my bags until we were finished sightseeing for the day and did it with a smile. Their $100 rate on travelzoo made this a great bargain... we were out of there for $200 with the room, breakfast and parking... cant do too much better than that in SF for four people in a room. (One mom, three kids.)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: CMinch
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in Easter 2009 arriving Good Friday for 3 nights before flying to New York with the family. We travelled with a 3 yr old and 1yr old, and decided to go for a room with 2 Queen size beds, which was great. The beds were very comfortable and the room was nice. We also got a "Kids Club" Pack which had bath ducks for the kids which was nice. The Hotel was opposite California Pizza, which was nice for meals, and walking distance to most other things. San Fran is a great place to explore, and the Hotel was a good enough location, and comfortable, especially for a young family.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, can make small improvements”
Reviews.Author: ninac4116
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin hotel and was not disappointed to its integrity on comfort. The heavenly beds were ridiculous comfortable. There were few things I did not appreciate. For example, I called 3 times to ensure I would not receive a corner unit, and what do you know, I got a corner unit on the 14th floor. Upon reading other reviews I learned to stay away from corner units as they are akwardly shaped and have tiny bathrooms (the bathtub and toilet just barely touch and when I sit on the toilet my leg touches the toilet paper dispenser). The corner unit is V-shaped. Despite being so awkwardly shaped they did a great job designing it and making it functional. Also, the restaurant there is called "Ducca" and they have a Ducca channel on their TV which advertises Happy Hour from 4-7pm. We got there at 6 and they told us they no longer offer Happy Hour at those times, only 4-5 pm. Furthermore, the first concierge we encountered was blonde lady that knew her stuff and planned the day out for us perfectly. The other 2 days were not as great. Another concierge staff named Yvette was not very friendly or warm and made me feel stupid for wanting fine dinging during lunch hours. The other concierge Scott said "ummm" more than having any feedback and did not give us proper directions. All in all a good stay and good location. We walked everywhere. The fitness center was great with new machines. We got a great rate at $105/night + tax. The front desk attendant Jennifer was exceptionally professional and helpful. Parking and internet are very expensive ($10 internet, $50 overnight parking). The rooms are comfortable, but I definitely hope to get a standard shaped room next time.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice, comfy hotel; close to Moscone”
Reviews.Author: PamDon
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Westin Market St for a recent conference that I attended at the Moscone Center. - check in was super fast at ~2pm - great room (small, but it was just me, so no problem) with bay view on the 32nd floor: comfy bed, huge HD flast screen TV, nice bathroom with 'green tea' scented shampoo/cond/lotion, USAtoday each morning and Sunday NYTimes in fitness center on Sunday; Starbucks coffee with in-room single cup brewer. - nice bar with lovely wine-by-the-glass choices. I did not eat in the restaurant (Ducca), but they had a nice outdoor seating area with fire-pit. - room service (used once) was fast and polite - fitness room had many machines (bikes, treadmills, elliptical trainers, wieghts), but was busy at 6am! - taxi stand was always available (including at 4am! for trip to airport) - Starbucks 1/2 block to the left and Peet's 1/2 block to the right! - I got free internet because of the conference, but the regular charge is $14.95, which is similar to most other hotels, I think. I cannot think of one negative thing to say! Enjoy, P

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful room, great rate, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: socalgranny
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Westin downtown - 50 Third St. We booked for a bargain rate online but were upgraded upon checkin to a room on the 29th floor with wonderful views over the city. The hotel staff were very helpful. The concierge printed out the boarding passes for our return flight. Looked up some info online. The room was clean and spacious. It was decorated in a relaxing theme of bamboo in pale greens and beiges. The bed was very comfortable. They have a wonderful lounge called Ducca with half priced drinks at happy hour. There are many things to do within easy walking distance. Try the Dim Sum feast at Yank Sing!
