We parked around the back at the Jessie Street garage for only $25.00 per night since we did not need the car during our stay. The only downside is the $15.00 for internet access. You will be glad you stayed at the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: sosweho
Reviews.Content: On my second visit to the Westin Market Street, I received a complimentary upgrade to the Presidential Suite as a SPG Platinum...so of course I was happy with my room! Sweeping views of the City, and more space than I honestly needed! The hotel is in a great location near the Muni and BART and often offers rates that are quite reasonable! It was everything I have come to expect from a Westin--so you will know what you are getting--with larger rooms than the Palace or W nearby...

Reviews.Title: “Solid choice”
Reviews.Author: Glam_Gal79
Reviews.Content: The room was really cool and had lot of nice stylish touches. It was a shade on the small side which is not ideal for people with kids. The staff was really friendly and there seemed to be some happening socializing going on downstairs. My one grief is that they charged for every little thing, including wireless internet access (now free at many hotels), using the computer for a few minutes to print out the e-ticket, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Traveller20203
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not worthy of the Westin name. Sheets were stained. Bathroom was dirty. wifi connection was terrible AND expensive. Complaints about wifi and the dirty room fell on deaf ears. One excuse after another, but nothing done to fix the problems. They charge $45 a day for parking. The rental car only cost us $150 for the week, parking at the hotel was more expensive than the price of the rental. You're better off sleeping at the Greyhound station or on a park bench. I dont mind paying for quality, but I expect to get what I pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Good Conference Hotel”
Reviews.Author: richvabrew
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Westin for a conference and the location was great for shopping and going to the Moscone Center. The front desk was very accommodating to my requests. I stayed on the upper level of the hotel and the view was incredible (try to get a room on the highest floors.) Overall, the hotel was clean and comfortable, there wasn't anything really outstanding about it. Yes, the Westin beds are very nice. I didn't order room service or use the restaurant, there were way too many other places to eat near by. If you want a drink after checking in go across the street to Daves.

Reviews.Title: “double charges”
Reviews.Author: emet854
Reviews.Content: Basic Hotel in Sf, but double-charged me for the stay and was a pain to get it resolved. Multiple phone calls, etc. etc. Felt like I was dealing with a car dealer.

Reviews.Title: “San Francisco Westin review”
Reviews.Author: JeanetteD3
Reviews.Content: I never wanted to leave. The girl at check-in gave me a special room, and when I entered, it truly was special! All glass walls overlooking the city - beautiful view. The room was beautiful, food was delicious, service was great, bathrooms were impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate Westin property”
Reviews.Author: Seven_Continents
Reviews.Content: This is a typical Westin, recently rebranded and soft renovated from a non-SPG property. There are some things that bother me in particular that I'll list in case they help you make a decision, they are minor quibbles in a general sense. The training at the front desk encouraged the person who checked me in to use terms like "you've been upgraded to one of our best rooms with a garden view". In my case that was going from a room on 15 or higher to something like 25 or higher on the Mission St. side of the building instead of one of the city views. The garden view is Yerba Buena which is 1/2 a block of grass. My first room was on 27, a connecting room with a loud ventilation fan in the bathroom that didn't turn off with the lights. I asked to be switched and was again given the best room spiel and given the same type of room on 33. It seems that the bathroom ventilation fans never turn off so you'll have to remember to shut the door if you are sensitive to it as I am. This was a different but still connecting room which I try to avoid. Funny how I had two connecting rooms in a row while a previous poster couldn't get one even after requesting in advance! Everything else was nominal. Location is great whether for a tourist or conventioneer. Bathroom is small, you can't sit without your leg against the tub if you know what I mean. Housekeeping was fine, everything worked as indicated. There didn't seem to be any bell help at the entrance after 6pm and the setup of the entrance means you have to skirt cars to get to the main entrance. As I said, mostly quibbles but sometimes annoying to a frequent traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Great starting point to see all of Beautiful San Francisco!”
Reviews.Author: TommyRo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is less than 1/2 hour from SF airport. When we arrived the valet met us and took care of the parking the car. However, this was at a fee of $48 + tax per night, $54. You do have in-out privileges, all you need to do is call down to the valet office and they have the car waiting...every time I called the car was there. The valet attendant gave me directions when I needed them. Check in was a breeze and I was offered an upgrade to a higher floor. It seems the higher floor you are given the more expensive the rate. We stayed on the 25th floor and had a nice view overlooking St. Patrick's church, the Metreon and the convention center. There are views of the Bay Bridge from other rooms on the same floor, be sure to ask if those rooms are available. The concierge gave me information on where to go for a quick breakfast within walking distance. We ate at Mel's diner - great food, fast and not too expensive. We took a 3 hour jeep tour, through "jeep tours". Our driver, Paul, took us to the Wharf, China Town, Telegraph Hill, sea cliff, the Golden Gate Bridge, City Hall, The Castro district and more. My family of 5 had the jeep all to ourselves and it cost $210. Well worth it. The hotel was clean and the staff very customer service oriented. Although the hotel was full of visitors, it did not feel to cramped. It would be nice if there was free wi-fi available. Internet service is 14.95 per day. There is a business room where I printed my boarding passes free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “great price, great location, staff very friendly”
Reviews.Author: musiqueetcirque
Reviews.Content: I booked this room through Hotwire for the last weekend in January. Had tickets to go to Wicked. Not knowing San Fran, I took a chance and booked a 4 star on hotwire in Union Square after researching on Trip advisor. This is the hotel we got. I was hoping it would be central. It was fantastic. About a block from the BART, so we took that from the airport, got out at Montgomery, and walked a block and half to the hotel. I had emailed the hotel after booking and requested a King bed and possibly an upper floor if possible. They emailed me back promptly and said they would put in the request for such but couldn't guarantee anything. When we arrived, they told me we were in a King, corner room on the 5th floor. So slightly bigger than a regular room. It was a very ordinary room, but the Westin beds are always sure to be comfy at least. And after all what can you expect for $90/night? The staff were all very nice, and one night we stopped at the concierge desk to ask about movies, and what was playing. There were two staff there at the time and they were both very helpful and friendly. We were searching for movies on one of the staff's phones. The location was fantastic, just a half block from Market street, and so central. I can't say anything bad. They have free wine tasting from 5-7pm, we didn't make it to any of these, and didn't try the restaurant..

Reviews.Title: “Arrogant Staff and dirty restaurant”
Reviews.Author: flanar
Reviews.Content: I made our reservation by phone, directly to hotel (didn´t get special rates avaiable at hotels.com and others), because one of the rooms needed a special bathroom - with the shower separated from the bathtube, and we needed the two rooms conected or very close. When we arrive at the hotel, unfortunately, computers were not working, but the woman at the reception desk was doing her best. (Sorry don´t have her name to compliment for all the good job she was doing). After some dificulties with the manager to understand we had special needs (he wanted to give us rooms in different floors at that first night), the recepcionist gave us an upgrade to the highest floor (wonderfull view) for both rooms and we could get a room in front of the other. The bellman was very friendly (Jamal), and so all the others at the bellman desk. Unfortunately, I can´t say the same for the concierge desk, all them are very arrogant. They make you feel unconfortable to ask informations, usually they directed us to the computer at the buseness center to get what we need - information about hertz openning hour at the SFO, f.e. Hotel lobby area is very croweded, with lots of business people and those attending meets there, at the conference center. The worst part of it is the restaurant Ducca. We ate there twice at dinner and once for breakfast. The oriental guy supposed to put water on our glasses, many times fulled the glass more than possible, sreading water at the table. The same with the olive oil, he spread oil at the table too, not because he fulled it but because his movements were too terrible. One day we got breakfast there. When we´ve just seated, the waitress asked our order, so we said we would like to see the menu for options, and she looked at her watch for a long time and said breakfast time was about to finish. My husband asked her what was breakfast hours (we had already confirmed it at the reception desk before entering the restaurant), and told her we still had twenty minutes and it would not take longer. After she brought the juices, coffee and bread basket we ordered, she asked if we would charge to the room, and gave us the check. It can´t happen in a hotel like this. Staff must be more polite, she could have said the same (that we didn´t have long time for breakfast ) in an elegant way. Now, the grand finale: The day after, we were having dinner at the restaurant and I saw a mouse!!! It appeared, took something at the floor and desappeared. I was so astonish... I told the waiter very quietly and he was not surprised, he said he would ask someone to take care of it. Just that, normal face: it seemed to us that for him it is perfectly normal to have a mouse at a restaurant . Maybe we were talking about Rattatoille!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay at the Westin”
Reviews.Author: DAL504
Reviews.Content: The Westin off Market is your typical Westin - comfortable and plush and oh that Heavenly Bed! The rooms are quite large for San Francisco and very comfortable - they had flat screen TVs and very comfortable beds. The bath is also pretty spacious and the new toiletries are much nicer than the old Westin bath product (though the soap is very oddly shaped). The workout room is big with lots of cardio machines and everything was in good working order. The hotel is very convenient to the BART (Powell or Montgomery are a few blocks away in either direction) which was nice for the early morning flight! While it is off Market, there are a few restaurants beyond the hotel nearby (a CPK across the street) and not to far from the Metreon and the stuff over there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SpiderBoy
Reviews.Content: Located in a great part of the city near Union Square, new Westfield and major transport hubs. Service was ok, condition of the room was good and Westin always delivers a very comfortable bed. Positives: Short walk to Union Square (shops/restaurants) and key transport services (trolleys, trams and trains). I have not attached a photo to this review because the photo on the Westin website is actually correct. Negatives: Not enough staff. Cheaper than the Westin St Francis (best rate was direct thru Westin on Market) but further from Union Square. Good value for the rate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hydepark
Reviews.Content: I was pleased when checking in to find the front desk person Jennifer welcome me to the hotel for the 1st time. I was surprised when she gave me a room on the 22nd floor. When I made the reservation, it said I would get a room on the 4th to 7th floors. From the 22nd floor (which is not the highest, 36 is), you can still get some stunning views of San Francisco from one huge floor-to-ceiling window. The room was connected to another room, which is something I don't like, but at least the connecting door was close to the main door, and not in the center of the room. The Internet was way too expensive, $14.95 for a day. Didn't touch the minibar after a notice said the hotel would start charging after 10 seconds if the minibar was touched. Was happy to see there is a safe in the room, I can leave my laptop there. And the bathroom had plenty of towels. It's a nice hotel. I wonder if some employees at this hotel were ever affected by the recession. When I asked what was the cheapest way to get from the hotel to the airport, the concierge told me after discount, I can take the town car for $45. After the financial crisis and recession, the economy may be improving but that does not mean people have money to throw away. If I can take Bart to SFO for $8 and arrive exactly where I want, without any more walking, why would I be interested in paying $45? What I expected them to say is, "we can get a cab for you" for $23. Seems like some were not affected by the recession or else they would know even staying at a fancy hotel, people are looking for the best rates and not splurging like before the crisis.

Reviews.Title: “Great everything”
Reviews.Author: cchalifour
Reviews.Content: Great location, great hotel, great room, great Beds. We stayed 5 nights with we just loved our stay. Its our standard.

Reviews.Title: “Westin hotel San Fran”
Reviews.Author: UrbanK
Reviews.Content: Modern hotel in superior class, ideally situated for sightseeing the city. Within walking distance of China town, Union Square and close to Pier 39. Great rooms, good breakfasts and nice restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: jbg7
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two wonderful nights at the Westin on Market Street. We arrived at SFO from LA around 8am and used the BART to get into the city centre. It took around 30 minutes and you can either get off at the Powell or Montgomery Street stations. The Westin is about half way between both stations and is about a 5 minute walk. I would recommend the BART as an alternative to a shuttle or taxi. Not only is it fun and adds to the adventure but its also easy to use and follow and is totally safe. Because it was early morning when we arrived at the hotel we were originally hoping to have our bags placed in storage until we could check in. To our surprise the very friendly staff member allowed us to check in early as well as provide us with a 2pm check out time. We were on the 24th floor which provided us with superb views of the city and alcatraz. The room itself was great and very spacious. One thing I would advise is be careful of the mini bar fridge. Don't bump or remove any of the items because there is no time delay on the products and you end up getting charged. Once again the friendly staff member at the front counter was only too obliging to remove the charge from our account. There is a gym on the 4th floor which is complementary. It is well equipped with weight machines and cardio equipment. We didn't eat at the Restaurant or use room service. The Westin is right in the heart of the city centre and is only a 5-10 minute walk to the trams and shopping centre. The F line tram which takes you to Fishermans Wharf is less than a 2 minute walk. We have nothing but good things to say about the Westin and its staff, accomodation and location. We highly recommend it to others. The only negative I have which does not involve the Westin or SF is United Airlines. We flew with UAL from LA to SF. All I can say is this airline sux. Their customer service sux, their timeliness sux, their staff are rude, arrogant and unhelpful. In general their overall performance is pathetic and also sux. I do not recommend this airline to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Simple clean reliable hotel, but that is about all”
Reviews.Author: MrMatthew
Reviews.Content: There is nothing wrong with this hotel, although that is to say there is also nothing wonderful about it. It is new and clean and the rooms are nice. It is convenient enough, although not is the best location. What this hotel lacks is class, style and character. It is simply a modern functional hotel which does its job well as a hotel. I will stay here again but only as a backup. It won't be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful experience at the Westin Market Street”
Reviews.Author: Carmel_Concierge
Reviews.Content: I live in Carmel, Ca and find my self in San Francisco about once a month. This was the first time I have stayed at this Starwood property. My favorite parts of the city are the Marina and North Beach area, so I don't usually stay downtown because of the hoards of people it attracts. That being said, this hotel blew me away. The staff at the front desk were so polite and helpful. Since I am a Concierge myself I tend to pay extra close attention to the level of service that is provided by hotel associates. I stayed on the 35th floor with a panoramic view of the city skyline, Alcatraz Island, the Golden Gate Bridge and Union Square. The beds at Starwood property's are always comfortable and the rooms are modernly appointed with I Homes and nice flat screen TV's. Be careful of the mini fridge honor bar. When you pick up an item it will auto charge your account even if you put it back in. However, again the front desk staff was awesome with removing the charges and it explaining how the system works. I never drive in the City, I always park at a BART station and take it in. You save yourself the irritation of driving and save $50 for overnight parking - a win, win. Being a Concierge in the Monterey area and a contributer to (--)... I am always imperesed when I find a property as well run as the Westin Market Street.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot go wrong with a WEstin”
Reviews.Author: AScott_9
Reviews.Content: Great location, clean, smells great (like a Westin), got a view of 3rd street, corner room. Floor to ceiling windows :) Travel to SF a lot for work and always like it when I find a deal hear.

Reviews.Title: “For me it was a WOW”
Reviews.Author: dandan1978
Reviews.Content: Sometimes you have one or two experiences that stays with you for the hole staying and sometimes for a long time. I must admit I am a fan of San Francisco and been there several times. Last time I had the chance to visit SFO was with my girlfriend to celebrate our 1st year together maybe not a romantic like Paris or Vegas but we are both a City persons. Along with all the exitement when we came in the room, wine, fruits, chocklates were waiting for us (when I had booked the hotel in the website I add a remark that I would like to add this feature in the remark with an additional charge) . Room was clean and was kept like that every morning, tbh I cannot expect something less than that from this hotel (and price which is above average maybe) but have a cool location (near by union square). The whole week was a great escape for both of us and certainly gave us a great start for our 2nd year together :-) I booked the hotel in easyclicktravel web site, I usually see affordable prices there and also good experience with this site for first time. Happy new year, San Francisco :-)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: LizzyKav
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of our Honeymoon, it was an amazing end to our trip. The hotel is only a couple of minutes walk from a BART Station in each direction. The Westfield shopping mall is less than a 5 minute walk from the Hotel and is a must visit. The location is great and the hotel is fab. Our room was in a corner and was huge. The bed was so comfy and overall a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: mwdoug
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin (Market & 3rd) for 4 nights (Dec. 6 through 10). Overall we were very satisfied. The room was fairly large and very clean, with a nice view, and the famous Westin bed was as advertised. The price was extremely reasonable at $131.50/night (plus taxes) and the location excellent. We ate in the hotel restaurant once and weren't disappointed with the food or service. We thought the heat was somewhat loud, but that's about the only negative.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms, Mediocre Staff, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: BeachMax
Reviews.Content: The Westin Market Street is about 4 -5 blocks from Unions Square where the Westin St. Francis is located (a much, much older hotel). The hotel is located across from the SFMOMA and other museums - right on the BART line. All the rooms except for Suites are idential size; "Standard", "Deluxe" and "Deluxe Grand" are idential - except for Floor of the hotel => higher floor numbers with "Views" are Deluxe or Grand. The views are NOT great from most rooms - don't bother paying up. Also, DO NOT get a room by the elevators - or near the lower roof top generators - way to noisy. They tried to "Upgrade" our Deluxe to Grand Deluxe by the elevators - we passed! Pros: Super Cheap Rooms - we paid $149 per night for a Deluxe Room Great Location / Modern Hotel Very Comfortable Beds Flat Screen TV Cons: Mediocre Staff - not the Four Seasons or St. Regis (but its $200 per night cheaper) No Night Life at Bar/Restaurant Poor Common Space Smallish Bathrooms Average to Poor Views in most rooms. Overall => at $149; the bed is great and so is the location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but can do much better in the heart of San Fran.”
Reviews.Author: TravellingGirlnj
Reviews.Content: A bit disappointing... Requested a king/queen - was given a room with 2 doubles. The heating unit was extremely loud in the bathroom. Sounded like a fan was on. Concierge was not helpful with any questions we had. The only good ting in my opinion was that it's a few short blocks from Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Given free upgrade to the most amazing room!!”
Reviews.Author: mark4fi
Reviews.Content: We arrived after a stressful drive in rush hour San Francisco traffic to a beautiful, modern and tranquil hotel right in the heart of San Francisco. We were greeted with a free upgrade to what can only be described as possibly the best hotel room in the US. Huge floor to ceiling double aspect corner windows looking right over San Fran, the suburbs and Alcatraz, the views were breath-taking. Helpful and curteous staff and a lovely restaurant although it is a little pricey! If you're looking for a central hotel at a reasonable price then this is the one for you.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: ben2k
Reviews.Content: I had 7 nights in this Westin. In the beginning I thought 5th floor will be really noisy for a SF downtown hotel, but it relatively quiet. Of ourse you hear the fire fighters when they do their regular tours in downtown. But this is also applicable for > 30th floors. The rooms was stylish and roomy. There even was a healthy stepper thing located next to the floor to ceiling windows. Nice, clean bathroom as well. The bar and restaurant are also nice, but rather expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great home base to explore the city”
Reviews.Author: DenL42
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location applies in real estate and in travel, and this hotel has a perfect location to explore San Francisco. It's right around the corner from the downtown shopping district, Union Square and Chinatown, and my wife and I were able to hoof it to Telegraph Hill, Fisherman's Wharf, Japantown, the Painted Ladies and Lombard Street (though be prepared: this city's huge hills are NO JOKE). Being able to walk everywhere is a blessing, considering the outrageous charge of nearly $50/night to park a car here. The hotel itself is nothing to write home about, really, but the rooms are adequate and of course have the Heavenly Beds that make Westin worth staying at. The first room they gave us was small and had a terrible view, but we were quickly upgraded when we asked for a better view, and we could see the bay and the sunrise from our next room. I would recommend this hotel mostly for the location, though if you're expecting something really luxurious for the price you pay, you probably won't get what you're looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Nice business hotel in the center of town”
Reviews.Author: OilIsle
Reviews.Content: Convenient for the convention center and central San Francisco. Really a standard Westin - nothing to particularly complain about, but nothing memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Excellence with a tinge of uncharacteristic unfriendliness.”
Reviews.Author: stedtwall
Reviews.Content: Always a fan of Westins, W's etc, the Starwood chain. However, several people at this particular location provided less than the welcoming hospitality that I have come to know. They were not terrible in general, but in comparison to the calliber of service from this chain, they were sub-par. Primarily, this was the front desk as bar tenders, baggage handlers, an droom staff were superb. However, this is a nice, clean, beautiful hotel in a very convenient and central location. You won't have anything fantastic right outside your doorstep or have a neighborhoody feel, but you are centrally located with ease to get to many major attractions. Blocks to shopping, Union Square, the financial district, BART transportation and a longer but acceptable walk to the Embarcadero and Ferry Terminal. Prices can vary drastically at this hotel so when you get a good deal, it can't be beat but often, there will be better values. The W down the street was a far more enjoyable experience. The bed is amazing as always, the room was slightly smaller than typical, but this IS San Franciso so it was quite ample. The room staff was responsive, extremely friendly and diligent. Concierge was also amazing both before my arrival and during.

Reviews.Title: “Vanilla kind of place, but great location”
Reviews.Author: NewEnglandLadybug
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference in the end of May. The conference facilities were great, but as for our room, on the whole I'd have to say it was just vanilla...The beds were comfortable but not over the top, the bathroom was CRAZY small. We called to ask for a fridge for our room to keep some wine chilled and it took a few calls before we got it. Would have been easier if we could have just temporarily moved the stuff in the minibar fridge out but they have one of those sensors that charges you when something gets moved, so we didn't try it. Our room was on the 23rd floor, which provided some interest for my young kids....watching fire trucks approach the area from 10 blocks away, watching the fog roll across the city, etc. As for location, it is tough to beat. My husband and kids joined me for the trip even though I was attending conferences for most of the time, and they had the cable car terminus, union square, and the Yerba Buena park all within a 5 min walk. A BART station is also right nearby. We also took the F cable car down to the market at Embarcadero. The food stands there are amazing -- just too bad it isn't open for longer hours. For anyone going to a convention at the Moscone center, it is 1 block away. We ate twice at restaurants that were within walking distance of the hotel and had been recommended by the concierge. I thought both were uninspiring. We had thought about eating at the restaurant downstairs but the menu was rather pricey and their prix fixe menu (one night a week) only had 2 choices for entrees, both red meat which I don't eat. Best meal the whole trip was our burrito run into the Mission!! Two separate notes...our conference "rate" offered by the organizer was about $150/night higher than the rate I booked the room for online. At the rate I got, I think it's an OK value, but no one should pay >$200 for a room here. It's just not that nice and I'm sure you could find better easily. On a final up note, we had a late flight home and the front desk was very accommodating about holding our bags until our departure to the airport at 6pm. We had asked that they have a cab waiting to take us to the airport when we returned from sightseeing shortly before 6. Instead of a cab, they had the hotel "driver" take us for the same cost as a cab. Town car instead of a taxi and a super friendly and safe driver.

Reviews.Title: “OK for business”
Reviews.Author: dk011
Reviews.Content: I'm just back from business having stayed at the Westin. The location is good for business and especially conventions as Moscone is a 5 minute walk. If you're there for pleasure its an OK location with Union Square about 10 mins walk. Its a good hotel and the service was fine but ask for a room away from the lifts. The noise that comes through the air conditiong ducts in these rooms is pretty loud. After one night they moved me without fuss, though. My only other gripes, and these are universal, is the price of wifi $14.95/day and breakfast - $25 for a buffet?

Reviews.Title: “Great base for City stay”
Reviews.Author: BoltonAnnB
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a very nice room, tastefully decorated and extremely clean it wasn't the biggest room we've ever had but was The bathroom was nice and modern with fluffy towels and good quality toiletries. This is quite a big, busy hotel we were never disturbed by other guests or traffic noise etc. The bed was extremely comfortable and had great pillows as well. The use of the internet was expensive $15 for 24 hours - noon to noon the following day, we found free internet at Coffee Bean & Tea Leaf shop about 5 minutes walk away. We booked with Expedia and felt we had good value for money for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Strong potential, good location, some serious lapses at check-in”
Reviews.Author: annw
Reviews.Content: We are bay area residents who stayed here while on business for the day and going to dinner and the theater in the evening. Location adjacent to Yerba Buena gardens, off Market Street, near several major museums and public trans, is quite good. It's a stone's throw from the Four Seasons which is substantially more costly. The decor is modern and well done; the room was of modest size but very well kept up and tastefully decorated; comfy bed, in-room Starbucks. Excellent black-out curtains; noise level on the 8th floor was minimal, suggesting very good construction. Amenities included essentials (soap, lotion, shampoo). Sufficient towels. There were 3 electrical outlets and an Internet cable plug-in spot on a strip on the very compact-sized desk. I must comment on check in, which was **dreadful**, unless you like to stand in line for an hour with bags. There were at least 100 people in front of us with two reception people working the desk. The young staff (concierge) tried valiantly to make nice, handed out bottled water, said, "Everyone arrived at once; were you all on the same bus?" (Not exactly.) And the line was half way across the lobby every time some of our party checked between noon and 3:45 when we finally gutted out the line. My husband tried to check in earlier in the day, and they said, "no, after 3 only," but later while we were clearly annoyed in line, came by and asked us if we had done "pre-check in." What? We would have had you offered in that morning!! In fairness, there was a marathon in town that day, but if you know you have 1000 people checking in, you need to have the foresight to add staff or stagger the hours you are checking people in. After an hour or so a couple more people were finally added to help check in. I would recommend this hotel but only with the caveat that you sort out your check in time and ask about "pre-check in" when you make the reservation. Also if you have a car, avoid the high hotel traffic times for valet service because I heard people in line complaining about the bottleneck there (was not a problem early in the a.m. however).

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite place in the US”
Reviews.Author: AMJohnsen03
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time in San Francisco. We stayed at the Westin, Market Street. The rooms were spacious, clean, and the service was great. There were so many attractions to see, and things to do, I can't name them all. Alcatraz is a MUST DO! We were there for like 4 hours. It is fairly easy to get around the city, on public transportation, if you are staying down town. We were there for 4 days and did not need a car. There are all kinds of neat little restaruants tucked in different neighborhoods, of the city. Be sure to ask where you are staying for suggestions. All in all, I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fraire
Reviews.Content: The Westin Market Street is a very nice 'upmarket' hotel in an excellent location in San Francisco - a quick walk to Union Square and public transport on Mraket Street to just about anywhere We ( family of 2 adults + 2 kids, 5 and 13) had a large, bright and very clean room - on the 7th floor I think - and the beds were wonderfully comfortable. Bathroom was a little dark, but spotless and we had a bath , which was nice for the little one. Check-in was smooth and the girl at the desk who dealt with us was extremely pleasant, as were all of the staff we met there, including in the restaurant. This was a pleasant surprise given some of the remarks made on this site. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel - Starbucks is just up the street if all you want is a coffee and pastry- but we did have a very good , if rather expensive, meal at "Ducca". My only complaint would be that our room was right next to the service elevators that rumbled noisily up and down late at night and early in the morning. I presume that our room allocation was due to the fact that we had got an absolutely fantastic rate on Expedia, which I imagine gives the hotel some scope to allocate better -placed rooms to those paying the full whack. All in all our stay was very pleasant, and if we're ever back in SF ( it's a long way from France!) and get a similar deal, then I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place if you get a decent deal”
Reviews.Author: SpoonAmerica
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my gf for 4 nights. I had no complaints, other than the usual hotel issues you would have for a place that costs $90/night. Beds are as always very comfortable and nice as with all other Westin hotels. But why do the shower/tub drains never drain properly? It's not just this hotel but with ALL hotels that I've visited in the past 2 years. I have no idea. If you get a room for $80/night or better, I say this place is good. Anything above is iffy. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the best part of the city”
Reviews.Author: nunontherunn
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay for 5 nights at this Westin hotel - Great location- A short walk from the ferry building and embarcado aswell as the city center. We were upgraded on arrival to a delux room with great panoramic views of the city near the top floor at no cost. Although slightly on the small side the room was clean and nice- The bed was really comfy and the in room starbucks coffee maker and huge plasma TV were great bonuses! Staff at the hotel were also really helpful and friendly. Hotel restaurant was also great - One of the best meals we ate in SF! Great Hotel - Would definatley stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It was fine for one night”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl078
Reviews.Content: They had lost my reservation but managed to squeeze me in. The staff was nice and helpful. The room was on the small side but comfy. One caveat. They claim to have 24 hour room service which actually ends at 1030 pm. so if you check in late and want to eat, they will give you a pizza delivery menu and suggest the store next door foe beverages or cold snacks. All the other restaurants in the immediate vicinity close early also. The bed was the best I had on the trip. It's close to the Moscone center, shopping and museums. It was fine but not anything I'll be rushing back to. The room would suit a solo traveller but if more than that, probably be tripping over each other

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed by outrageous fees and lack of concern for guests”
Reviews.Author: cdntravel_lovr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights after a long drive from LA. The moment we arrived the valet greeted us by telling us that there was a $45 parking charge (+tax!) per night and that valet parking was the only option. Only later did we discover that there is a public parking garage right across the street. Approx. $50 for parking per night seems like highway robbery to me, no matter what city it's in, or how nice the hotel is! The staff at the front desk were courteous and the bellman was pleasant. The room was nicely decorated and the beds were fairly comfortable. On the first night of our stay however the guests next door were partying and drinking which turned into screaming and hollering in some type of domestic dispute at around 1am. I was on the verge of calling the police when I called down to the front desk at 1:30am. No one from security ever showed up and our noisy neighbours finally quieted down around 2:30am. When I complained to the front desk the next morning nothing was done. They simply blamed it on "unruly guests". The walls between the rooms are thin so noise travels well, and the heavy metal room doors also slam loudly which echoes down the hall anytime a guest leaves their room. This hotel has the typical overpriced minibar ($5 for a can of soda?) and they also charge $15 per day for wireless internet. In this day and age that's just poor service. If the cafe on the corner can offer free wireless, so can the Westin. There is a convenience store next door that sells soda and snacks so skip the minibar and save yourself from the price gauging. In the end we were highly disappointed by our stay, feeling overcharged and undervalued as guests. I'd skip this hotel and find somewhere where they offer your amenities for free and care about their guests concerns.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room, ok service”
Reviews.Author: Flagship_Traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a 'Premier Room' at the Westin Market Street in San Francisco. Upon driving up to the lobby, there was no one to help with the bags or door and navigating through the revolving door with luggage was tricky. Had to wait several minutes at check-in as the two attendants on duty were busy with other customers. Room was clean, spacious, and well maintained. The view was spectacular since the room was on a high floor facing the Moscone Center, Yerba Buena Gardens, and the Metreon. Location was excellent, right off Market street and convenient walk to union square and extended walking distance to Giants Stadium and the piers. Paid a 'starpicks' special rate, which made the room fairly reasonable for its location and quality. Overall a pleasant experience. The hotel meets standard Westin comforts, decor, and service, with an excellent location for exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing..............”
Reviews.Author: yummychunk
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 8 day trip to California, 4 of which were spent in San Francisco, at the Westin on Market. I am a 57 yo female, and I was traveling with my brother, 61. We arrived at 3pm, and was told that the rooms were not ready...okay...no worries....we went to Starbucks and sat there for an hour, came back, and were given our two rooms...my brother's was still dirty and unmade, with someone else's luggage in it. My room had no safe...the bolts were in the closet, but the safe was missing. Okay...again no worries...At 11pm that evening, the elevators were going non stop and making horrendous noise, which was right on the other side of the bedroom wall. I called downstairs and asked about it. They said they shut them off at midnight. They DO NOT...Next morning, went to see the manager and requested a room change. This I had no problems with, the desk clerk was excellent, and made sure I was moved to another room. I did find the diningroom staff at breakfast to be somewhat less than congenial, they seemed put out when asked for something, such as cream for the coffee. We did purchase these rooms through Expedia, and I don't know whether that is the reason we were given the poorer rooms, but I think one should be treated as well as the next guest, no matter how the rooms were procurred. At the end...we just returned home today, and I received a phone call from my brother...he said he was billed an additional $200 for the mini bar which neither one of us touched, or moved because we know that these are very sensitive. I honestly don't think I will ever stay at another Westin because of the experiences of this week......Go down one block to 4th St and do yourself a favor and stay at the Marriott!!!

Reviews.Title: “This is how a Westin should feel”
Reviews.Author: gahlisary
Reviews.Content: Don't stay at Westins too much, last was New Orleans, but I like how the brand's hotels are all very consistent in both design, service, and location. Like New Orleans, this was a recently remodeled hotel (formerly called The Argent), but had been given a pretty thorough Westin makeover. The lobby rooms are totally Westin-ized, with very comfy Heavenly beds, clean-lined furniture, stark white walls, large flatscreen TV, and upscale bathroom. Actually the rooms are a very good size for a hotel like this, definately wider than usual. We were three guys, and were able to fit a (very comfy) cot into a room with 2 double beds, with plenty of room to spare. Over the course of 3 nights, this was actually a very comfortable layout. Bathroom shower pressure very good, cutains were effective at blocking out light from the sun, and the closet was nice with upscale wooden hangars. Bathroom amenities were Westin's Heavenly Bath brand, but didn't include a liquid body wash, which surprised me (used the shamproo instead). Towels were plentiful and very fluffy. As for the rest of the hotel, didn't use much of it. Had a drink one night out on the terrace of Ducca, the hotel's restaurant. Was surprisingly quiet, thought the place would be more of scene. Restaurant furniture was pretty chic and the restaurant's terrace was a nice amenity. One of the other guys ordered room service breakfast, which came very promptly, and he was satisfied. I had a package dropped off at the front desk with just my name on it, and the hotel had it sent up to the room which was nice. All in all, very pleased. Only one thing I would comment on was they put us in a room next to the service elevators, and you can mildly hear them race up and down the elevator shaft at certain times. Thought about asking for another room, but thought the moving process would be more of an annoyance than the light sound. All in all, would be happy to return.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location, Nice Hotel - can't go wrong!”
Reviews.Author: AssociatedPress
Reviews.Content: I travel to San Francisco frequently, about 2-3 times a month, so I know most of the hotels in the SOMA and Embarcadero areas. My most recent stay was in the end of August for four nights at the Westin on Market Street. First, the location is central, within walking distance to Union Square, San Francisco Centre, Ferry Building, AT&T Park, and to the public transportation systems (BART, Muni, and cable car). If you take the BART from either the San Francisco or Oakland airports simply depart at the Montgomery Station and walk about two blocks, and the hotel is right there! The check-in was also pleasant, the lady at the front desk upgraded me to a Starwood Preferred Guest room upon check-in, granted, I gave her my SPG card as well, but it was nice that she did that for me even though I didn't ask. *WORD OF ADVICE* Be nice to the front desk folks, it can payoff for you - they can either give you a crappy or nice room. The room itself was nice, spacious and clean and nice view of the SOMA district from the 29th floor! I also used the fitness center at the hotel, and thought it was nice too ... I would have to say their fitness center is better than the Hyatt Regency's or Le Merdien's ... the gold standard is still the Marriott on Fourth Street. I also dropped by the Ducca bar for drinks and appetizers and they were good - no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Nice comfortable hotel...”
Reviews.Author: nicktan_69
Reviews.Content: Affordable 4 star hotel, large rooms, great beds, in the hot spot, good service,

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay, Great Room”
Reviews.Author: CanadianBoys
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights on the top floor, corner room, SPG member premium room with views of Union Sq,, Alcatraz, Coit Tower, Financial District and pretty much anything worth seeing. Floor to ceiling windows were great and I was up at 6 am when the sun was up to see the xuty come alive and watched the lights at night. The room was great, bed comfy and sheets good (200 thread count only though). The bathroom was very nice and the shower large enough for 2 people easily. The only glitch was that on our first night the room safe was not available as it was being serviced and did not arrive until the next day so we left our valuables with security who issued a luggage tag (a little disconcerting) as front desk do not have a hotel safe. The safe arrived the next day. Hotel staff were aloof as others have said, not unfriendly, just aloof and could have made an extra effort to smile and greet guests. The hotel was very busy including meeting rooms. We found the lounge areas even more impersonal so passed on having a drink there - opting for a few places nearby and there are many to choose from. The location of the hotel is great and this hotel does have some great weekend rates from time to time. It is a solid 4 star business hotel and suitable for weekend getaways. In my opinion is is not great for families with small children as there are no facilities for them and none nearby. There are better choices on 7th Street for families. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: SFCA09
Reviews.Content: Very beautiful hotel, but very horrible customer service. We were part of the wedding held in the hotel. The public parking right behind the hotel (which is public but the hotel HAS access to) closed the doors at 11 pm (Note: No signs of the hours of operations were visible). Not only we were not able to pick up a car (because of the city “laws”, however as we found out later they had access to the gates) but we were not able to stay in the "Boardroom” which was reserved for the bridal party only until 2 am, because this was our only option for the reason that there were room available in any Hotels around. Nobody can tell me that the room with just a table and a sofa is needed at 3am and people in our situation can not just stay there because there are no other options. They kicked us out of the room and let us stay in the lobby until 6 am for the parking to open doors. Very disappointed!!! You will get what you paid for, but NOTHING extra. Hope no major things would go wrong when you stay here, no help is coming!!!

Reviews.Title: “A modern business hotel but also good for tourists”
Reviews.Author: JJH1
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights on vacation in San Francisco with my with and daughter at the Westin. It was the peak of tourist season (or so it seemed) and all of the public transportation and the restaurants were packed with out of town visitors. The concierge service at the hotel was exceptional given the near constant line at their desk and provided helpful informaiton and even got us a good deal from a local rental car company that delivered it to the hotel and allowed drop off at the airport for only a minor fee. The room was adquate for the three of us, the bath was very average but was clean and had lots of towels and other amenities. No free internet. The place looked pretty packed while we were there but it never seemed to impact the service. All and all a good place to stay. Not near the main tourist areas, so be prepared to walk about a mile to the embarkadaro or take the historic street car line, also city bus service and cable car is only a short walk. Lots of coffee shops and small restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Market St was FANTASTIC and Great Value”
Reviews.Author: jmooreirtrad
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at Westin Market St for 4 nights. Great staff and inviting lobby. At check-in the desk clerk told us that the room that we had been assigned was more about the view than the size, with which I was fine. We arrived to our room on the 21st floor and a BEAUTIFUL view of the city! The room was lovely, clean, modern, comfortable. Large LCD TV, starbucks coffee, wonderful linens on the King-sized bed. Great location, with plenty of restaurants and shopping within walking distance. Be sure to have breakfast, lunch or dinner at Cafe Mason! Only two small complaints: 1. housekeeping forgot to give us washcloths on one day and coffee supplies on two days. Both were promptly refreshed upon request. 2. we experience a bit of problem getting our keys to work, a problem that the desk clerk told us on checkout was probably related to a low battery in the lock mechanism. Outside of that a WONDERFUL experience! We will definitely return to the Westin Market St!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: morenachica
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in aug 14th. , The hotel was nice and the location was perfect. The rooms were nice and clean and the bathroom was nice. Nothing special about the hotel but the views from the top floors were incredible. I do think the prices of room service, misc. prices - internet and local phone calls and etc.. were a bit too high.. We didnt use the internet or phone and etc.. because of the prices, but be aware if you do.. If anything I think the prices of those costs should be lowered. But besides from that it was a good hotel. I would stay there again..

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Location!”
Reviews.Author: LAW1558
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I stayed here with another couple for a quick 3-day get away. Value rating is based on Hotwire rates. We were within walking distance to AT&T Park and all modes of transportation (BART, MUNI, F-Line Trolley, cabs). There was a Starbucks right across the street (an added bonus for us caffeine fiends), as well as a deli next door, a couple bakeries around the corner and CPK across the street. Drug store and 7-11 also within walking distance for last minute needs. We were on the 14th floor, so some sirens could be heard occasionally, but nothing that interrupted our sleep. The room was clean and the bed "Heavenly". Bathroom amenities were high quality. The staff at the front desk were helpful and nice, guiding us out-of-towners on the best ways to get where we wanted to go. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Beautiful recently renovated hotel in a terrific location”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoFito
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took a weekend getaway to San Fran on Sep 2008, I found this 4 star hotel in Hotwire and bought it without knowing which it was, so it was a pleasant surprise that it was a Westin; but there are many Westins... when we arrived we were amazed to know which one was it, the hotel is centrally located in the Financial District on Market street. We were within waking distance from Union Square and Chinatown, we were across the street from the Moscone center and the Yerbabuena gardens, and also a few blocks from the cable cars, as well lots of other attractions. But the best part was our room, and the hotel premises. We were on the 20th floor with a terrific view to the Financial district, to my favorite the Hobbart Building. The room was recently renovated with flat panel TV new bedding, drapes, carpet, furniture, it looked like it was never used before. The staff is professional and friendly, and this is a big city! . And I could get a great rate from Hotwire, about 100 dlls per night where hotels cost btw 250 and 300 a night. We didn't dine in the restaurant but it seems to be pretty popular.

Reviews.Title: “Really a nice deal”
Reviews.Author: esox_ch
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 2 nights and it was really nice. The bed was awesome, a large TV is available etc.. The hotel is really in a busy place (you can do shopping around Market Street or go at the AT&T stadium to see a baseball play without having to move your car). Unless you really want to spend $45 a day, don't use the valet parking and just use one of the (many) public parkings there are within walking distance, where you will spend $15 a day. The only drawback : Internet is not complementary and will cost you $15 / day

Reviews.Title: “clean, comfortable, calm, and well-located”
Reviews.Author: mindynate1
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay. Clean hotel and room. Very accommodating reception desk. Comfortable bed. Nice basic nature/ natural decor. Got a deal through the internet for less than $100 a night. One young male concierge seems stuck on himself and another failed to call me back. Other than that, we were very happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: AllisonCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Nelson at the front desk was very welcoming. The staff was excellent, and the room was spacious, fresh, and well stocked with the standard amenities. The view of the SFMOMA, Yerba Buena, and other city landmarks was gorgeous. Room service was very prompt, and the food (breakfast) was good. Very convenient to SFMOMA, other museums, and Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service and Nice People”
Reviews.Author: SDEddie
Reviews.Content: We liked the location of the hotel. The prices were reasonable, the service was good, and the room were nice. I really liked how close it was to Union Sqaure and SF Musuem of Modern Art. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: susanne01
Reviews.Content: Myself, my husband and our 14 year old daughter stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in july...it was lovely, great location, minutes walk from union square and the cable car ( a highlight but queue at bottom of union square for a good seat), large room with great view of the streets, elegant lobby, nice bar and helpful concierage..... Didnt like the fact you had to pay for internet access on your laptop though.. It has a californian pizza kitchen accross the street and a Starbucks too... Booked it on Hotels.com for 80euro for roomrate..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, San Francisco in general is great!”
Reviews.Author: whogirl22
Reviews.Content: The service in general was good, however the food restaurants could e improved (both quality of food but specially the service) The room was good in general the service was good too and the views from the top floors were absolutely incredible! The location was perfect, right next to Union Square! Amenities were ok but i think it could use with a pool or spa. Anyways, in general the hotel was pretty good and you can reach all you need to see from the hotel's location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: CATrvl08
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a great location close to coffee shops, convenience stores and shopping. Check-in was quick and our room on the 27th floor had a great view of the convention center and gardens. The car valte takes a bit of time to come around and is $48/night. The health club is well-equipped and very well air-conditioned. Room service was quick and tasty (large portions). We had the breakfast buffet one morning and the price is around $24 a person, but you have plenty of options to choose from. The only word of caution would be the showers which can be very slick and there is no bath mat provided. If you would like to test your bone density its a great idea to hop in and out of the showers. The bathrooms are nicely appointed. Overall a great stay. I would definitely stay here again next time I am in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay”
Reviews.Author: TuffLilCritic
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 4 days, and it was the best stay from all of the hotels we stayed in, worth the money, it had a big bathroom, good bedroom, great view, and the service was really good. The location was near alot of things, not near cable cars. I recommend you stay here

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Incredible Front Desk Manager - Eric Pasch”
Reviews.Author: THEGUYFROMSOCALIF
Reviews.Content: I am SPG Platinum member so it is always nice to get an upgraded room and amenities from some of the Starwood hotels I frequent. There are Starwood hotels that really want your business and go out of their way to treat you nice (happily the majority of them I have encountered) and then there are those hotels that do not. This Westin, run my Eric Pasch, is simply one of the great hotels that really cares about the SPG members and I applaud Eric for running his front desk with such devotion for Starwood's gold / platinum members! Besides arranging an incredible suite upgrade for me, Eric took the time to hand pick for me what he considered to be the finest Chinese restaurant in the city, within walking distance from the hotel. Eric was "right on" with his fabulous selection!! This Westin is perfectly located in the center of SF with easy access to most attractions. I also have the following comments about the hotel: (1) My windows were the absolute cleanest windows I have ever had in a hotel - my son took incredible photos from the room and commented that he had never seen since clean hotel room windows; (2) The bathroom was incrediblly clean and well stocked with towels, etc., (3) The bed / linens were soft, fresh and clean - just as you would want from a Westin; (4) the price of roughly $125/night was a down right "steal" for downtown SF; (5) The Italian restaurant in the hotel looked really neat - if I had another night there I would have loved to dine in the Venetian style restaurant; (6) the entire staff was friendly at the hotel. Once again, I want to personally thank Eric Pasch for my incredible experience at this hotel and i truly hope to be back very, very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Westin Say It Aint So”
Reviews.Author: SFNative80
Reviews.Content: This hotel must not be corporate managed hence, I ask the question "Westin say it aint so?" Mouse traps outside the building!!!! Gross!!! We are locals and thought is was a great location and probably has great views for our out-of-town guests. With a name like Westin you would have never thought the windows were covered with a heavy film of 4 month old dirt! I heard the housekeeper telling another that she was ill from the cafeteria food...I believe it I had flies in my salad!! Not to mention the service in Ducca was slow and not friendly!!! Now I understand why my rates were under $100 in San Francisco. Westin you might want to reconsider or retrain this property. I just stayed in Costa Mesa & Seattle...wonderful properties!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: rollocst
Reviews.Content: I did quite a bit of research on San Francisco hotels and neighborhoods before submitting a bid on Priceline. My work paid off because the Westin was a very nice place to stay in a good location in the city. For 60% off the rack rate it was a great bargain. When I arrived I asked to change my room type and my request was granted. I was nervous when I saw that my room was next to the elevator but unlike other reviewers I had no problem with the elevator sounds at all. It was slight background noise and it wasn't bad at all. At other hotels you'd be lucky if the street noise was as tolerable. I hate noisy hotels and I found this hotel to be very quiet over four nights. The room had a simple yet modern look with a huge window with great views. It was perfectly clean. The beds were wonderful. Often I dislike the super comfy hotel beds but the Westin beds were perfect. The bathroom was clean and a nice size as well. The hotel location was ideal. It's close to BART, MUNI lines and the cable cars. There are many restaurants and coffee shops nearby. It's a nice place to escape the tourist areas even if you are a tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Rich_Forbes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at West Inn Market Street for four nights and were upgraded to a room that had a fabulous view over San Francisco. The hotel itself is very attractive inside and has a lovely outside bar area at the back of the hotel which overlooks a park area. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful, pointing out key places to visit/eat etc The hotel is a great base for transport links and is only a five minute walk to Union Square and the shops. We would definitely recommend this hotel as a good base to explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: csoPhoenix
Reviews.Content: Just returned from three days in SF. Stayed July 5-8. Found great rate of niteny-nine dollars on hotels website two days prior. Two queen beds. The hotel is very clean, the beds are great. We parked across the street for twenty dollars a day. Got the three day muni pass and visited Alcatraz, Golden Gate, China Town and of course, the Wharf. Easy access to public transportation. Short walk to Powell and Market to ride the cable car. No complaints about the hotel. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay again for the price.

Reviews.Title: “everything you might expect”
Reviews.Author: Andrew Bachmann
Reviews.Content: Before we arrived, I noted that the parking fee is $50 a night. So, we found parking on the street, which was free because it was a holiday backed up against a Sunday. My backup plan was to go to a nearby garage that had good reviews. There was a short wait at the check-in. The lady at the counter was friendly, polite and courteous. I changed my room configuration without a problem. We checked a little over an hour before check-in time. (It was 2pm) I asked for a late checkout and she said that we could stay until 2pm without extra charge. After we checked in, I called the front desk and requested a couple of robes and also some shaving cream. The robes, shaving cream, and a shaver came up within 10 minutes. Our room was clean and nice, and the bathroom was fine. The shower pressure was okay and the heat was fine too. Our window was somewhat close to some fans outside on the roof below. (we were on the 10th floor) The fans were audible from the window but not over by the bed. I had requested a room away from the elevator and ice machine and there were no noise issues. The bed was comfortable. We used the mini-bar as a fridge, and the lady at the front desk said they didn't have microwaves. The next day we checked out through the TV, which was reasonably convenient, although I wasn't able to use the keyboard to type in my email address for the receipt. Instead I had to use the direction keys on the remote. (skip that option if you're in a hurry) We left the keys and we were off. All together, we were very happy with the experience. I give it 3 stars for value because the normal prices are not reasonable. However, we found it on priceline for $90, so that wasn't an issue for us this time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, typical Westin”
Reviews.Author: KimmieS
Reviews.Content: I had booked via Hotwire for one Saturday night for $93. When I called the hotel a couple days prior to confirm the room, the desk staff could not guarantee a king bed but noted there were plenty of king rooms available. We checked in very late, and were told we were in a queen room. I requested a king, but was told we had been given the last room available. My husband commented to the front desk clerk that he is a Starwood Gold member, upon which the front desk clerk disappeared to the back for a couple minutes. When he returned, he upgraded us to a king room and suggested we book directly with the hotel instead of using a 3rd party such as Hotwire next time to guarantee a better room. (Of course, we realized that already. In bidding on Hotwire I had been hoping for another hotel and ended up with the Westin. We stay at Westins often, so it would have been interesting to have ended up someplace else.) The room was on a corner and had amazing views. The decor was typical Westin, except it was odd that the room lacked a sofa/loveseat--instead it had two dining chairs, which was awkward. The bathroom was ridiculously small, and they should replace the hinged door with a pocket door. Thank goodness the sink was outside the toilet/shower area or we never would have been able to get ready! This was also the first Westin I've stayed in where there were no robes in the closet. Maybe they have separate rooms for the Hotwire guests vs. the guests that book directly with the hotel? Parking in San Francisco is expensive, and this hotel is no exception. $55 per night. If you don't need a car, utilize public transit while in the city. The hotel is located in Union Square, where there is shopping and restaurants within walking distance. Note that it is in the city, so expect to hear traffic and sirens associated with the hustle and bustle of the area while you are in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location, effortless service - a big thumbs up!!”
Reviews.Author: Glamourpuss-Tourer
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. The check in was swift, the room was very clean and stylishly decorated. Room service was prompt and staff were extremely helpful. Location was perfect for all of the city attractions. Only one minor negative - the internet was $15 per 24 hour period, which is extremely expensive! But other than this minor quibble, the hotel was superb. A big thumbs up here!.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic rooms, good location, snooty bar staff”
Reviews.Author: VancouverTaffy
Reviews.Content: Lovely contemporary rooms, comfy beds and quality bed linens, good location but snooty bar staff who couldn't be bothered to serve you and who shut the bar whenever they felt like it rather than at the alloted time regardless of how many patrons were still in the bar. San Francisco is a cosmopolitan city but this kind of service doesn't fit with that image. This hotel could take a few lessons in service and style from its European counterparts. If there is a deal on stay there if not there are plenty of other comparable hotels with better service.

Reviews.Title: “Our recent stay at Westin Market St”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterKss
Reviews.Content: Hi, we have just returned from a 2 week stay at this hotel. We were very pleased with the hotel. It is in a great location for all the major tourist attractions. We booked a King room and were upgraded to a twin queen room at no extra cost. The room was a good size but the bathroom was a little compact but perfectly functional. This hotel would suit all guests. The hotel is just behind the Yerba Buena gardens where there are open concerts it is also a great place to enjoy the weather. I booked through Expedia and got a good deal. Staff are generally helpful, especially the Concierges. Had a few language problems with the bellboys. Didn't try the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, tidy and a fantastic view”
Reviews.Author: shuggy1001
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while attending the Apple WWDC conference, had room on 34th floor (3rd from top floor). Room was nice and spacious and nicely furnished. Bed was fantastic! view even better - i was able to see Union square, GG bridge, Bay bridge and Alcatraz from the floor to ceiling window... Bathroom nice, but not outstanding, I am 6'4" and had to bend down to get head under shower, but apart from that everything was fine. All extras in room including iron/safe/40+" TV, Starbucks coffee machine. Internet a little pricy at $15/day - it still amazes me that internet access is charged for when you stay at most of these hotels... Was overall very happy with the hotel and staff were friendly also.

Reviews.Title: “nice room, convenient location, shame abotu the noise”
Reviews.Author: sydboy07
Reviews.Content: The Westin market St is in a great location for those wishign to explore the city. I was able to get the room for $99 on hotwire, which seemed very good for San Fran. Easy access to the trams and trolley down to fishermans warf or the Castro. The room was quite large, bathroom was well designed and also quite large. Enjoyed the big LCD TV and the ability to request a mini fridge for the room to store some drinks etc. Not sure how Westin can have such comfy beds, but loved it :) The only complaint I have about the hotel is the lack of double glazing on the windows. The traffic noise was usually not an issue, but fire trucks and ambulances seemed to go past the hotel regularly with sirens blazing.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful staff. Upgraded as a great surprise.”
Reviews.Author: PamandSam
Reviews.Content: Beds and linens were amazing. We had a corner room with a King Sized bed which we could have spent hours in. True luxury. Only complaint, no robes.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great service”
Reviews.Author: drewmeister
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on a saturday night. We found the service to be excellent, whether it was the front desk, the phone operators, or the valets. All were extremely prompt and polite. The bed was fantastic, and the room spacious, clean, and quiet. We were part of a group of about 5 rooms and everyone had positive things to say about, including my friend who went to get in an elevator and found a couple having sex in it. Good times. We paid $99 for the room and as written previously, the valet service was pretty outrageous ($54 with tax). I too thought that $14 for internet service was a bit much. For $99 a night, I'd go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale but small room”
Reviews.Author: VeganChela
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night celebrate a very special anniversary at a very low rate, $99. Parking at the Westin is prohibitively expensive ($48 per day) so it's best to park elsewhere. We found the lobby to be mod and cold. We had difficulty opening the door of our room with the card key because the handle should be turned UP to open, not down. When we finally got into our standard room, we found a very small room that was dominated by the large bed. The Westin advertises "Spacious rooms" (we totally disagree) with a "Heavenly bed" (we totally agree). The pillowtop mattress was wonderful. There was a flat screen TV, perhaps 46 inches, but you had to sit on the SIDE of the bed to watch it. There were NO chairs, other than a desk chair. The configuration of the room was weird.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely stunning views and great quality for the $$$”
Reviews.Author: willtravelwithkids
Reviews.Content: Okay, right up front I should let you know that we stayed on the top floor with a corner room so we had 180 degree views. The view was simply ridiculous! We lived in the city for a number of years and we never saw anything like it. On one clear day we saw all the way to Alcatraz. The room was small but we didn't mind, would have liked to know that there would be no bath, just a shower but the view was worth it! I had read reviews from others that said they had terrible rooms because they booked on Priceline but we did not have that problem. Yes, we booked with Priceline, found out that it was actually cheaper to book directly with the hotel (California residents get an extra 10% off) and when we called Priceline about the price discrepancy...we actually got a refund for the difference. I was shocked! Anyhow, we specifically wanted a SOMA location to be away from the craziness of Union Square and this hotel really was convenient to all the big destinations of the city. Also public transport is nearby if you need to get around...we took Bart from SFO and it was a breeze. Although I wouldn't recommend from OAK, we did that once and it was painful. The rooms are modern, amenities are a bit frugal but a housekeeper was happy to give us whatever we needed. There is Starbucks coffee and Tazo Tea in the room for a quick one cup in the AM. Everyone we encountered was extremely pleasant and the valet even allowed our friends in park their car in the lobby while they came up to our room without any attitude. We have stayed at the Hilton near the Embarcardero (a bit dated) and the Mandarin Oriental (exquisite but in the business district and very pricey) and this fell somewhere in between. I wouldn't call this Westin property luxury necessarily but we really were satisfied with our stay since we didn't spend a whole lot of time in the room. Also we didn't partake in room service or the hotel restaurant but this is San Francisco...there were too many great places to eat! We would absolutely return!

Reviews.Title: “really nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: growingfish
Reviews.Content: good location, cozy room, shopping store surranded a little bitter noisy

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and clean, but small rooms and service lacking”
Reviews.Author: slipstatic77
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights (Thursday to Sunday) at a very good rate. However, after booking on indirectly through expedia, we were put in a triangle room (king bed) which was modern and clean, but small and awkward. Also, during check-in, the front desk staff were not very helpful and were annoyed that we were arriving prior to check-in. Also, upon leaving, the concierge tried to put is in a waiting limo for $45, when I specifically just told him that I wanted to take a cab to the airport (approx $38 incl. tip). Wonder if the limo is owned by the hotel, or the hotel receives commission. Other than those comments, the hotel was in a great location (Union Square and transportation to everything else was a few minutes walking distance). Room service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Great Value but Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: LotteMonet
Reviews.Content: We paid $109 for a standard room on a Saturday night--fabulous! Clean, awesome location, safe and convenient to everything. So everything else is sort of secondary. OK, so... We got upgraded to a "spacious deluxe" room for no extra charge and were so excited, but when we opened the door we thought maybe we were in the wrong room. So tight! Not even sure the bed was king size. The bathroom door cleared the toilet by about a quarter inch, and for the "floor-to-ceiling" windows, they don't tell you that the ceiling above the bed is only about maybe 7 feet high to start with, then there's some sort of built in overhang that lowers the ceiling over the window to about 6 feet. On the plus side: The bed was super comfortable, very soft sheets, and the in-room coffee and tea were awesome. Plus, we requested a fridge, bathrobes, and slippers for no extra charge. Awesome TV. Also, the front desk was really nice and gave us a 2pm checkout b/c we overslept. Minuses: A prom and some other sort of young event downstairs, so lots of teens in the lobby, a few standing around drinking out of red plastic cups. Second, the "sweeping view" in our deluxe room on the 9th floor was the office building across the street. Then there's the small size of the rooms (ours was maybe 8' x 10' + small closet and bathroom) and also the fact that although there was an advertised $109 rate, I had to call the 800 number to get it b/c it wasn't available online. (And the rep told me that because it says rates "FROM" $109, they do not always actually have that rate available. Bait-n-switch or false advertising, take your pick. Overall, we were pretty comfortable b/c we didn't need too much space, and it really is an awesome value, but I definitely felt like this hotel touts itself as a lot more luxurious than it actually is.

Reviews.Title: “Westin SF Great Location, great hotel....”
Reviews.Author: Givenchy77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin SF Market Street over Memorial Day weekend. The hotel itself is very clean and conveniently located near Union Square and the Financial District. It's a 10 minute walk to the Montgomery Street BART station. No need to get a taxi as the BART was readily available to access to and from the hotel. The beds were comfortable and the room was clean. Parking at the hotel is expensive, about $50 per night. We didn't eat at the hotel since there's so many other options to explore around the area, especially in Union Square (which is only a five minute walk away). Our first day, we walked all through Union Square, through Chinatown to Fisherman's Wharf. from the hotel. SF is a walking city. This hotel is located in a great, easily accessible location. My only gripe was that they charge you for Wi-Fi. Other hotels give you Wifi access for free....

Reviews.Title: “rooms are new and clean”
Reviews.Author: siucarnpb
Reviews.Content: stayed for 3 nights, the location is great, close to the Bart and Muni lines. Watch out for parking, they charge 48/night, right next to the hotel down the ally is city parking for 25/day but closes at 11pm and reopens at 5am, but I didn't need my car.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Comfortable...Great Price!!”
Reviews.Author: demitrica83
Reviews.Content: My husband I decided to go to San Francisco very last minute and I suprisingly got this hotel for $100/nt. What a deal for a Westin I thought...there is a catch though. If you are driving there is no self park, you must valet for $50+/nt. However for 150/nt this hotel was still a great deal. Besides that I found that parking in San Franscico in general is just very expensive. Upon arrival the staff were very cordial and we even got upgraded to a corner room with a view of the city. Pros: Location (street car access) Heavenly Beds View of the city Staff hospitality Cons: Room a bit small. Smoke detector went off every time we ironed our clothes. No swimming pool Overall I loved this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ndtpunk71
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in the heart of SF. Located right on Market, it's very conveniently located to just about anywhere you want to go in SF downtown. I didn't get a chance to check ou t the gym or Ducca (their restaurant), but the staff, decor, room, and everything was great. My only complaint is with the service at the front desk. After checking out, my gf has left her sunglasses in the room. We went back in 30 minutes and asked them to look into it. It took them 20 minutes to locate the glasses even though we just checked out 30 minutes ago. I'd expect better service from the front staff. Overall, I had a great time staying here and would not mind coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TRVLR360
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel to be modern and good with a friendly staff. My room was nice and clean with a view of the gardens.
